loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 33 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past two years, Robert has been working hard to manage his bar and lodge, which sells drinks and sodas to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to construct more rooms in his bar, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to develop even more rooms on the lodge side of his bar. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to construct more rooms in his bar

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria de 37 años, el negocio de ventas de desayuno lo empezó con la ayuda de su hermano quien la animaba todos los días, y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien.

Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo de lunes a domingo desde las 5:30 hasta las 11am. Esta felizmente casada y tiene 5 hijos (4, 13, 15, 17, 19 años).

Con el prestamo quiere comprar productos lácteos, ventanas y puertas para el negocio. Su única meta es poder tener un lugar estable para poder trabajar sin ningún problema y seguí adelante con su esposo.
texts.en:
Maria, age 37, started her breakfast sales business with the help of her brother, who encouraged her every day. It has gone very well for her so far.

She works, with her husband's help, every day of the week from 5:30 am - 11:00 am. She is happily married and has 5 children ages 4, 13, 15, 17, and 19.

With this loan, she wants to buy dairy products, as well as windows and doors for her business. Her only goal is to be able to have a stable location to work, without any problems, and to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, as well as windows and doors for her business.

loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en:
Sharifa, who is in her late twenties, is married with two children both of whom go to school.  She has been running a Tinga Tinga business for two years now.  She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second motisha loan.  She used the previous loan to increase her Tinga Tinga requirements. She has now paid back this loan successfully.  She wants a loan to buy materials for the Tinga Tinga paints. Her dream is to one day be able to own a car and to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Msasani" which has a total fifteen members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans

loans.use: to buy materials for the Tinga Tinga paints.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de ser jovial y amable, es conviviente con Antonio, vive en compañía de su pareja, sus tres hijos de 13, 7 y 2 años de edad y una sobrina a la que apoyan con su educación, instalados cómodamente en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Graciela es la venta de gaseosas, para eso cuenta con una congeladora en donde guarda sus productos a temperatura helada al agrado de sus clientes. Cuenta con una gran variedad de marcas y sabores, iniciándose en esta actividad desde hace 2 años con un capital propio y realizándola ella sola, ya que su pareja realiza constantes viajes por su trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos cuando su pareja se demora mucho en los viajes que realiza, además de sentirse productiva y estar en casa cerca de sus hijos para cuidarlos y darles las atenciones necesarias. Por otro lado, comenta que no le gusta cuando llueve ya que baja un poco la venta, pero no se desanima, por eso tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y poder abrir una bodega de venta de abarrotes en su casa. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para así poder concretar sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, para así tener un buen record crediticio y tener acceso a más créditos. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más bebidas gaseosas en mayor cantidad y a menor precio, para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en: Graciela, 37, is a hard working and determined woman, who is also jovial and friendly.  She lives with her partner Antonio, her three children 13, 7 and 2 years old, and a niece which they support with her education, in their own home. Graciela sells soft drinks, for which she has a freezer where she keeps her products cold for customer’s satisfaction. She has a wide variety of brands and flavors, starting in this business 2 years ago with her own capital and realizing it by herself, since her partner made frequent trips for his work. What she likes about this activity is to have an income to cover the costs when her partner is gone long for work, as well as being productive at home and being near their children to care for them and give them the necessary attention.  On the other hand, she says she does not like when it rains because sales goes down a little, but she is not discouraged, so she has plans to expand her business and open a grocery store at home. This will be the first loan with MFP institution, she is very happy to know that she will have financial support in order to achieve her goals. On the other side, she agrees to comply with the payment of their fees in order to have a good credit record and have access to more credit. With the requested amount of 1000 nuevos soles, she will invest in purchasing more soft drinks in larger quantities and lower prices in order to have higher profit margins.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is recognized as a jolly and hard-working woman. She is married to Alejandro and has three children. She has been involved in buying and selling hogs for 10 years and has extensive experience in this business.

Marivic is thankful for having other sources of income aside from hog-raising. She has also run her retailing business for two years. Marivic dreams of lifting her family out of poverty; that’s why she works hard through her businesses.

Marivic wants to provide the necessities for her pigs; therefore, she has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourished, and yield higher prices when it is time for them to be sold. She also hopes to grow her business to secure a good living for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Vijana Nguvu Mpya Lugari Group

texts.en:
Daud is a 33-year-old married man, with one child. He has been doing farming activities, producing maize, beans and coffee, for more than 11 years. His income is low, due to crop diseases and a lack of fertilizers and productive maize seeds.

Daud is working hard to find working capital to pay for fertilizers, productive maize seeds and insecticides. His desire is to boost his scale of production from 5 to 12 acres so as to earn more income that can be utilized to fix his house and to buy food and clothes, and to bank the surplus.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides and productive maize seeds.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.en: Constantina is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She tills her land to grow rice crops to sell. She works hard to improve her income and her family’s living conditions. She requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies. Constantina is hopeful that this loan will help her achieve a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products to sell at her variety store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy 5 bags of sugar, packs of salts,laundry detergents and cereals.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en: Ivy A., who is 36, is a married woman with four children. They all live together in the village of Leusoalii. Her husband helps out with their fishing business. He fishes and Ivy takes the coolers full of fish to the fish market twice a week. She sells 20-30 fish, or 2-3 coolers of fish, and she earns more than $200.00 a day. She uses that money to buy her family's groceries, accessories for improving her business and materials for her home improvement.

loans.use: To purchase 1 fishing net.

loans.name: Nghiep

texts.en: Mr. Nghiep is 34 years old.  Because the Mekong Delta has a lot of rivers, transporting by boat is useful for many people to go to market. Nghiep is a boat driver who transports customers daily, plus his wife wants to become a door-to-door salesperson by boat on rivers. Nghiep’s wife wants to sell vegetables. They have a daughter and son, and the son is attending fourth grade. They have no land for cultivation. Their income is $8 per person/month. They hope to receive a loan of $75 so that they can invest in selling vegetables on rivers. They will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To invest for selling vegetables from his boat shop

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
Matea weaves and sews several handicraft items, including shawls and scarves.

Matea is 35 years old. She is married to her husband, Juan, and has five children. The three children that live with her help to contribute to the family’s outstanding success. Matea has worked hard to buy an electric sewing machine, quite a rarity in this area, and also has acquired a very efficient wooden loom. Most women work with much more basic equipment and thus produce less fabric. You can see in her eyes that she’s very proud of her success.

Her house and shop are connected and the shop is on a main street that tourists stroll by along the shores of Lake Atitlán. As you enter her airy shop you can see the half dozen workstations, where she and the children hand weave over 21 scarves per day.

This will be Matea’s seventh credit cycle, having successfully repaid six prior loans.

Her goal with this loan is to increase production to sell more and eventually purchase a different house. Most importantly, she wants to feed and educate her children. Though she never attended school she can speak Spanish as a second language, having learned it from her children. And speaking Spanish helps a lot in selling items from her store.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Lucia Violeta

texts.es:
Lucia is a very enterprising woman. When her family's financial needs were not being met, she decided to open a business selling "puchero", a typical stewed dish from her town Huancayo. Starting with a small amount of her own savings, she began preparing puchero and selling it on the street. Many people enjoy Lucia's home cooking and she now has a loyal following. At this time Lucia would like to borrow $200 to buy a cart and some kitchen implements. This will make it easier for her to transport the stew so she can better serve her customers thereby increasing her family's income and quality of life. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months and thanks you in advance for your generosity.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Lucía, es una mujer muy emprendedora que decidió iniciar su negocio con la venta del riquísimo plato típico de Huancayo, “el puchero”. Emprendió el desarrollo de esta actividad debido a que las necesidades primarias de su familia no estaban siendo cubiertas satisfactoriamente.Con un pequeño capital se dispuso a salir a las calles de su ciudad y poco a poco; gracias a su excelente sazón fue adquiriendo asiduos comensales. Actualmente su propósito es adquirir un carrito para mejorar las condiciones y desplazamiento de tan exquisito potaje y renovar sus utensilios de cocina para incrementar su calidad en la preparación. Por ello solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares a fin de llevar a cabo su propósito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia con el ingreso monetario que genere la venta de comida, se compromete a retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses y por esta razón apela a sus generosos corazones.

loans.use: To buy a food service cart.

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en: I am Mussarat B. .I am married and I live in a small rented house with my husband and eight children. My husband works at a local steel factory for a meager income. We were making very hard to manage our living in such a scanty pay.  In order to increase the household income my son started a used clothing business, a couple of years ago with the loan we took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. The business is flourishing slowly since then and has enabled us to uplift our financial status substantially. With the increased income   I was also able to get my daughter a medical treatment for a chronic disease of intestines. My son now requires a loan of US$500 to buy used clothes in bulk which will be cheaper and will enable to earn more profits. We plan to save the extra profits and buy a house of our own.

loans.use: Buy used clothing in bulk

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: I am Nasreen A. from Lahore, a big and busy metropolis. I am married with four children. All of my children attend school except one boy who is an apprentice at a tailor’s shop. I stitch clothes on order from my neighborhood clients. I feel the need for an extra income, as it very hard to make both ends meet. I therefore have decided to expand my stitching business. For this purpose, I need to buy an additional stitching machine and hire a helper. Please lend me $350.

loans.use: Expand stitching business

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en: Ruth, the Group Leader, sells banana food (matoke) in the market. She wants to use the business profits to buy a plot of land and also to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy and stock more banana food

loans.name: Icah

texts.en: Icah, 28, is married to S. and has three daughters. The couple runs a grocery store from home, earning $20 a day. Icah is a member of MBK and would like a loan of $125 to buy new inventory for her store. With the extra income, she hopes to pay  for her children's education. She agrees to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Restock her grocery store and diversify inventory

loans.name: Ram Kumari

texts.en:
Ram Kumari M. live in Thecho, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. M. lives with her husband and two children. Her daughter is in grade 4 and her son is only one year old. Her husband is Krishna M.; together, Mrs. M. and her husband opened their grocery shop seven years ago. They sell different types of grocery items in their shop. Due to lack of money they cannot purchase stock for their shop. So to expand their business Mrs. M. is requesting a loan to buy grocery items.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock for her shop

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mrs. Pen T., 31, and her husband, Sum Phy, 28, are farmers. They live with their three children in Dai Boun Village, Kampong Cham Province. They had been farming for eighteen years and earn around $4 per day. They request a loan of $200 to purchase hard stone to create mills, which they hope to sell. This will generate additional income to help them support their family.

loans.use: To purchase hard stone to create mills

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is thirty years old and the mother of three children. Two of the children are in school. Dorothy sells vegetables, such as tomatoes, garden eggs (eggplant), and peppers, and vegetable oil and palm oil. She wants to use her loan to buy more oil and fresh vegetables to avoid price hikes and to increase her inventory.

Dorothy is member of the group called "Commitment." Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable oil, palm oil and vegetables

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
Rosalinda started her business out of necessity. She needed the extra income in order to help her husband with the household expenses and to have her own money to provide a good education for her children.

She got started in March of 2000, when she bought a sawing machine with some money she had saved up. Rosalinda then made a butterfly costume for her daughter, to wear at school, and her neighbors liked it very much. They started to order pieces from her and nowadays she has a good number of clients and is doing very well.

She is now requesting a loan for $300, which she plans to pay in 3 months. She will use it to purchase sawing materials in order to fulfill her client's orders and to continue delivering her pieces on time. Which in turn, can generate more clients and income. With you help Rosalinda can expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Rosalinda inició el negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso extra que le permitiera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y ademas tener su propio dinero para darles una buena educación a sus hijos. Comenzó en Marzo del año 2000, compro una máquina de coser con un dinero que tenía guardado y le hizo a su hija un disfraz de mariposa para la escuela el cual le gustó mucho a sus vecinas quienes le empezaron a hacer encargos de costura y a la fecha tiene un buen numero de clientas y le va muy bien.

Ahora solicita un prestamo por US $ 300 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar material que le permita cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientas y seguir siendo puntual en las entregas, lo cual le puede generar mas clientes e ingresos. Con tu ayuda Rosalinda hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase sawing materials

loans.name: Milly Lwanga’S Group

texts.en:
Milly L. is the leader of a group of five women. She is 47 years old and is married with five children. Her children are ages 15, 20, 23, 25, and 27 years old, and are all in school. Milly lives in Lower Nsooba, which is a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Milly has worked in her house making brushes for over 30 years. The market for her products is fair. The most challenging part of her business is the lack of timber to make the brushes.

With this loan, Milly plans on buying additional raw materials for making brushes to increase her stock. Since she began working with MCDT, Milly has been able to grow her business, support her family, and educate her children.

Milly has successfully paid back 13 loans since she began working with MCDT.

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make more brushes

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina owns a women's clothing business in downtown Zaporozhye. She is very creative and full of ideas. She has rich experience working in this business. Moreover, Irina is very enthusiastic about her own small enterprise and has a good attitude. She sets high goals and takes daily action to achieve them. She has been in this business for 12 years. Presently, her monthly income is about $1300.

Irina would like to get a loan of 5060 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital. She believes financial assistance will support her in her endeavors. She is determined to work on her entrepreneurial dreams to make them a reality, understanding real success and wealth takes time. Irina is hoping to generate more profit and continue to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: Irina would like to increase her turnover capital for her women's clothing business.

loans.name: Lorng

texts.en: Mrs. Lorng C., who is 24 years old, is a pig raiser; her husband, Mr. Thorn Thav, makes wine and drives a motorcycle taxi. Lorng has two children, both of whom live in the family's home and are in school. Now her pig business is going well and she needs to fatten her pigs for sale soon; unfortunately, she lacks money to purchase food. She would like to request a loan of US $300 to purchase pig food. Lorng's husband is in the picture because Lorng is unavailable.

loans.use: Purchasing pig food

loans.name: Dayat

texts.en:
Dayat I. is 30 years old and married with three children. Dayat sells weavons, hair extensions, and hair cream and she is also a hair stylist. She learned how to style hair as an apprentice for two years.

Dayat needs a loan for $1200 to buy a generator so that she can satisfy the growing demand of her numerous customers. She also wants to buy a deep freezer so that she can start selling cold drinks at her shop. She thanks all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy a generator and a deep freezer.

loans.name: Mwashamba's Group

texts.en:
Mwashamba H. sells kanga in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. Kanga is a local fabric with elaborate patterns, bright colors, and a local adage written in Swahili on the bottom. Tanzanian women use kanga for clothing, wraps, baby slings, tablecloths, and other day-to-day needs. This is Mwashamba's first loan, and she intends to use it to buy more inventory and expand her business.

Mwashamba is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $15 each month. She is 30 years old, married, and has no children. She will share this loan with her fellow group member, Zaituni, who also owns a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more kanga for her shop

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She sells provisions, drinks, wine, and cosmetics. Magdalene needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more products to sell. She hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks, wine, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Mubashira

texts.en:
Y. Mubashira has had her own business for 12 years. She runs a clothing business at the clothing market of Istaravshan, Tajikistan. She and her husband have three children - a son and two daughters. Her business is an important source of income for her family.

Mubashira's income helps her to build, little by little, a dowry for her two daughters. They are growing up and will soon be eligible to marry. Lending services from IMON International lent key support for Mubashira as she has developed her business. She has proven to be a great client and has maintained a perfect payment record. Mubashira is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) to boost her available capital so she can purchase new inventory. We are grateful for the opportunity to further assist in the success of this dedicated entrepreneur.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. History of note includes: it was once a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki; and the birthplace of the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition when they request a loan. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and IMON will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing for women

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en: Rafiqa G. is 53 years old and the mother of five children. For most of her married life, she has raised livestock. The self-sacrifice and attention that she brings to raising each one of her young cows has resulted in her being able increase the number of calves. As a result, she is able to give her children the opportunity to pursue university studies, giving her much pride and satisfaction. Her next goal is to expand the business into selling milk. This would generate enough additional income to sustain her home and enable her to pay the university costs for her children. In order to meet her goals, Rafiqa is asking for a loan to buy more cattle. Rafiqa hopes that her expanded business will help her realize the dream of seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet H. is a widow and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through senior high. Janet sells soft drinks at Nyankumasi near Cape Coast, which she has done since 2002. Janet uses her income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills, and other financial expenses. Janet will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Janet plans to reinvest for the expansion of  her trade in soft drinks.

loans.use: purchase more soft drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Imtiaz M. Aslam Group

texts.en:
Imtiaz baji is a 48-year-old married woman and a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 25 years. Her husband's name is M. A., and he has a business selling animals for meat. He buys animals from animal markets and sells them to the butcher shops to earn a profit. Imtiaz baji is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. All of her children are getting an education from a school located near her house. Imtiaz baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy animals (goats and sheep) for her husband’s animal selling business. 

She is the group leader of more women in her area. Iqbal begum baji would like a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Salma baji would like a loan to buy leather to sell. Khatoon baji would like a loan to buy fruits and vegetables for resale. Shamim akhtar baji would like a loan to buy spare parts for motorbikes to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals for resale

loans.name: M. Célestine

texts.fr:
Née vers les années 1952, M. M. Célestine est mariée à ASSA Innocent et est mère de 6 enfants dont un décédé et les 5 autres scolarisés. M. Célestine mène comme activité principale depuis les années 1978 la restauration (poissons, crabes, crevettes , pâte de maïs). Célestine s’approvisionne en poissons soit dans les poissonneries ou au bord du lac. Grâce à son activité Célestine a pu acheter une parcelle de terrain. Célestine est à son troisième crédit avec ALIDé. Soucieuse de répondre au mieux à la demande de ses clients Célestine sollicite à nouveau de prêt. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born around 1952, Ms. M. M. Célestine is married to Mr. ASSA Innocent and is the mother of six children, one of whom passed away, and the others are in school. Célestine has been in the restaurant business (fish, crabs, shrimp, corn mash) since 1978 as her main work. She supplies herself with fish either from the fisheries or at the lake shore. Thanks to her business, she has been able to buy a parcel of land. She is on her third loan with ALIDÉ. Wanting to respond to the demands of her customers better, she's requesting a new loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish, corn, peanut oil, and condiments for sauce

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam, the one who is standing in front of the window, has owned a small restaurant in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to Maisha Imara loan group (Group code 2040). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 70. Each day she works at her business from 7:30 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish, potatoes, rice, and other items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Maryam is 38 years old, married, and has six children: ages 20, 18, 14, 8, 6 and one only 10 months old.

loans.use: To buy fish, potatoes, rice, and other items for her business

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Javier actualmente labora para un Punto de Taxis de la Colonia Jose Angel Ulloa, misma donde el vive, desempeñandose como Despachador y colaborador del punto desde hace dos años, el tenia una Pequeña pulperia pero durante el mes de Enero la lluvia ocasiono muchos problemas en la zona donde vive Javier y su casa se derrumbo y con esto perdio su negocio, El necesita que le apoyemos ya que actualmente el vive en la casa de un primo y quiere comenzar a frescos y frutas para lograr obtener otros ingresos, ya que sus niños estan en la escuela. Su esposa se dedica a la Elaboracion y venta de Tortillas, los dos han luchado fuerte por volver a construir su casa y a la espera que el Gobierno de la Republica tambien les ayuda. Se muestra una persona muy responsable y honesta.
texts.en:
Javier is currently working for a taxi company in the Colonia Jose Angel Ulloa, which is where he lives. He has served as the dispatcher and partner in the company for two years. He has a small grocery store but during the winter months the rain causes many problems in the area where Javier lives and his house collapsed and with it his business was lost. He needs this loan because he currently lives in his cousin's house and he wants to start with soft drinks and fruit to obtain extra income since his children are in school. His wife works by making and selling tortillas and the two of them have fought hard to reconstruct their house and they expect that the Government of the Republic will also help them. Javier is a very responsible and honest person.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and fruit for resale

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
La señora Maura. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rio Desaguadero” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 31 años  de edad, es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, tiene estudios de segundaria incompleta (3ro de segundaria) 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 10 años tiene su negocio de compra y venta utensilios de cocina, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00  nuevos  soles, que invirtió como capital adicional. 
Debido a la demanda de sus clientes, actualmente ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra de utensilios de cocina, cuchillos, cubiertos, ollas, tazas, termos, platos, para incrementar sus ganancias y ayudar a su familia.  Nos cuenta que trabaja con doble capital ya que su negocio no pagan al contado es pagadero en 15 días, mientras tanto ella vende huevos al menudeo. Su deseo es poner una tienda de venta de utensilios la por mayor y además una cristalería.
A la Señora Maura le Gusta mucho los ahorros, y el cumplimiento por parte de sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the "Rio Desaguadero" community bank of the district of Desaguadero in the province of Chucuito, district of Puno. She is 31 years old, partnered and has one child. She did not complete high school (3rd year of high school). She has been working with the Manuela Ramos organization for 10 years. She owns her own business, buying and selling kitchen utensils. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she invested as additional capital. Due to customer demand, she now needs a loan of 3000 soles in order to invest in the purchase of kitchen utensils, knives, dishes, pots, cups, vacuum flasks, plates in order to increase her income and to help her family. She says that she is working with double the capital because she is not paid cash, instead she gets paid settled every 15 days. She also sells eggs. Her wish is to open a store to sell utensils and glassware wholesale. Maura is very happy to be saving money and of having her group's respect.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, knives, dishes, pots, cups, vacuum flasks, plates

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Кодирова  Каромат женщина , которая кредитуется в Микроинвест уже третий год. Она использует кредит на расширение бизнеса , торговли продуктов питания. Её точка торговли находится в городе Худжанде, при входе в городскую больницу. На следующий займ она хочет пополнить свой товарооборот напитками и мороженым. На снимке Каромат на месте бизнеса.
texts.en:
Karomat K. is a woman who has been a client of Microinvest's for three years already. She uses loans to expand her business selling groceries. Her vendor space is in the city of Khudjand, near the entrance to the city hospital. She would like to use the next loan to expand her inventory of drinks and ice cream. The photograph shows Karomat at her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Erasma

texts.en:
Erasma is from Urcos, a small community that is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, 50 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She is married and has six children. For 16 years she has worked at her juice stand near the main square. She sells all types of juices and smoothies that cost between 2 and 5 soles. Her specialty drink is carrot juice.

With this loan Erasma wants to purchase a blender and juicer, and also build up her capital in the business. She is a member of a 44-person lending group with Arariwa that receives financial training from a loan officer. She also participates in the group savings account.

loans.use: To purchase a blender and juicer

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en:
Nazim S. is 49, married and the father of 2 children. Nazim owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated from the store.  He requests a loan of US 2000 to increase the stock of foodstuffs in his grocery store. 

Nazim is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors for his small business.

loans.use: increase the stock of foodstuffs

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca D., 39, is helping her husband manage a small rice farm. She has five children, and the income that she gets from growing rice has helped her family with their needs. Currently, her farm needs fertilizers and chemical treatment. That is why she would like to ask for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI.

She hopes that someday, she will be able to attain better yield in her farm with the help of the fertilzers that she is going to buy. 

CEVI is helping her small business grow. Francisca receives not just loans, but education on how to run a business as well.

loans.use: To purchase farm fertilizers and chemical treatments

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en una casa alquilada, ella es una mujer que genera sus propios ingresos económicos. Desde hace 5 años tiene un restaurante, para este negocio se asoció con su madre y ambas ponen de su esmerada dedicación para atender a su clientela. Cada día preparan gran cantidad de platos variados, tanto para el desayuno, como para el almuerzo. Gracias a que le está yendo muy bien, con las ganancias puede afrontar los gastos familiares. Mariela escogió dedicarse a la venta de comida porque le agrada cocinar y con su buena sazón ha logrado conquistar la preferencia de sus clientes, quienes acuden a su establecimiento diariamente. Por ello, seguirá trabajando arduamente para hacer crecer su restaurante y contar en el futuro con un mejor local y todos los utensilios necesarios. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de ser una de las integrantes de su grupo, pues se siente muy identificada con ellos. El dinero que está solicitando será utilizado para la compra de bebidas gaseosas y más platos de loza.
texts.en:
Mariela is 34 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in a rented house. She is a woman who generates her own income. For the past 5 years she has operated a restaurant. She works with her mother and they are both dedicated to attending to their customers. Every day they prepare large quantities of food for breakfast and lunch. Because her business is doing well, Mariela is able to cover her household expenses. She chose to engage in the food business because she enjoys cooking and has a good time catering to her customers’ preferences.

Mariela will continue to work hard to expand her restaurant. In the future, she is looking to move her business to a better location and acquire all the necessary utensils. This is her third loan with MFP. She is excited to be part of her communal bank group because she identifies with each of the other members. The money she requested will be used to buy soft drinks and earthenware dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks & dishes

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a member of the Dodoma Road borrower group in Kihesa,Morogoro,she is 24 years old woman,she is widowed and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 9,7, and 2 years.

Asia started her own business selling clothes and Vegetable 4 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Asia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes and to farm more vegetable for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Asia hopes to save money,pay school fees,get more food for her family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and vegetable

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
Jose Luis is a member of The Wheatfield village bank. He is 27 years old and lives with his partner. For some time, he studied at an institute of administration, but he stopped because he decided to go to work.

Jose Luis has a business selling replacement auto parts. His grandfather began the business some years ago and his father continued it. When Jose Luis was a child he used to help out and he grew up wanting to go into the family business. Now, after many years, Jose Luis has invested jointly in the business with his father.

Jose Luis needs a loan of 800 soles to buy headlights, light bulbs, transmitters, and speakers. His dream is to have a well-stocked shop. During his time with FINCA Peru, he has realized the effectiveness of the loans and is very happy because they have helped him through tough times.

loans.use: To buy headlights, light bulbs, transmitters, and speakers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: réparer sa voiture

loans.name: God Blessing Group

texts.en:
God Blessing Group is a group of two borrowers led by Nancy B. G..

Nancy is 52 years old and is married with two children aged 29 and 31, with educational levels of 12th grade and university graduate. She also cares for three orphans that were found during the Liberian crisis. Nancy is illiterate due to poverty. She and her family live in the Sheriff Quarter, a large Muslim community in Voinjama, the capital of Lofa county, northern Liberia.

Nancy’s business is selling children’s clothing. She buys children’s clothes wholesale and sells retail in the Voinjama main market. She has been running this business for five years and is hoping to expand to a bigger shop. She talks to her customers with a good manner in order encourage them to continue buying from her.

Nancy and her family depend on her business for their daily needs because her husband is retired. Therefore, she needs this loan in order to purchase more used clothing wholesale to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and of building a house of their own.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing wholesale

loans.name: Isioma

texts.en:
Isioma, 52, is a widow with seven children. She takes care of her children alone. She sells loaves of bread at retail prices to her customers. The demand for her bread is high in the mornings. She lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. 

She hopes for a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda T. lives in the village of Macanhan, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 62 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a store where she sells green bananas. Nilda has been engaged in this business for over 35 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Nilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional income made possible by the loan to improve her family's life. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

location.town: Macanhan, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djekafo de l’association Yenkadi  sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 42 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de MARKA COUNKO, sous préfecture de FANA, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage,  de parentés et exercent le commerce  de produits alimentaires. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, beaucoup de condiments alimentaires en gros et du lait. Les condiments  sont achetés à Bamako, le lait est acheté avec les peulhs du village et tous les produits sont revendus sur place dans le marché de MARKA COUNKO à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 15 000     FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Members of Djekafo group of Yenkadi association are married women, having an average age of 42 years and 4 children. They live in big traditional families with their husbands and children and reside in MARKA COUNKO village within the FANA prefecture of KOULIKORO region of the Republic of Mali. They know each other through their family relations and neighborhood ties and they trade in foodstuffs. These women are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with the aim of making durable their lucrative business activities. They are on their third group loan and all preceding loans have been repaid correctly. With this loan, they hope to buy much food ingredients in bulk and some milk. The ingredients are bought in Bamako, the milk from Fulanis of the village and all products are retailed right in the MARKA COUNKO market to a clientele made up of male and female. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 15 000 FCFA each. On one hand, the profits are reinvested in the business and in the daily family expenses, on the other hand.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food ingredients and some milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of flour and sugar for the production and sale of beignets

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es: María Santos L. S. de 47 años de edad, reside en Nahuizalco, ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo y su hijo de 17 años de edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar. María posee un puesto de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Nahuizalco, en el cual vende su producto por unidad y al mayoreo, ella cuenta con muchos clientes sobre todo  las personas que poseen comedores en el mismo mercado las cuales compran ahí porque María vende las verduras a muy buenos precios. Es por esto que María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras, ya que ella quiere comprar al por mayor para poder comprar a precios menores y vender aún más barato. Esto es de mucha importancia para ella ya que le permite percibir mayores ganancias lo cual beneficia a su familia.
texts.en:
María Santos L. S. is 47 years old. She lives in Nahuizalco, Sonsonate District with her husband and son, who is a 17-year-old student. María has a fruit and vegetable stand in the Nahuizalco Market. She sells individual items and also prepares bulk orders for a number of customers. The people who operate kitchens in the same market are especially good customers. Maria does her best to give them a fair price. María has asked for a loan so that she can buy fruits and vegetables at lower wholesale prices and give her customers an even better deal. She considers it important to increase her earnings and help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette D. es une femme de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans? Elle fait de l'embouche caprine, une activité qui lui permet de contribuer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Maguette D. is 39-year old woman who is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois for five years. She fattens goats, a business that allows her to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions and to build up her savings.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and expand her livestock business

loans.name: Justo Pastor

texts.es:
El señor Justo Pastor A. L., Trabaja Para la Alcaldía de Chinandega, Es soltero y actualmente está estudiando, trabaja como operario de maquinaria   ( patrolero).
Este crédito lo solicito para realizar unas reparaciones en su vivienda y lleva cinco años trabajando con Ceprodel, ha tenido un excelente record crediticio, este financiamiento le ha beneficiado para mejorar su condición de vida y salir adelante sin complicaciones
texts.en:
Justo Pastor A. L. works for the municipality of Chinandega. He is single and is currently in school. He works as a (petroleum) machine operator. He is requesting this loan in order to make some repairs to his home. He has worked with Ceprodel for five years and has an excellent credit record. The financing he has received has helped him improve his standard of living and to make progress in life without complications.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials: metal beams, iron and zinc

loans.name: Nicole

texts.fr: Z. Nicole est née en 1971 à Torri-Bossito au Bénin mais réside au quartier Agblangandan dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji depuis environs 2 ans.   Mariée à AGUEMON Donatien, un chauffeur, Nicole est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et tous à sa charge.  Nicole vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Nicole a eu quelques problèmes avec son mari mais malgré ce problème, le couple assure ensembles les charges de la famille.  Nicole n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Il y a 3 ans que Nicole mène comme activité, la vente d’oeufs devant la pharmacie Abattoir.  C’est à Dantokpa que Nicole s’approvisionne.  Nicole n’a encore jamais bénéficié de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité afin de mieux satisfaire la demande nombreuse des clients, Abibath sollicite un premier prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Nicole Z. was born in 1971 in Torri-Bossito in Bénin, but she has lived in the Agblangandan district of the municipality of Sèmè-Podji for the past two years or so. Married to Donatien AGUEMON, a driver, Nicole has five children, all of whom are at school and in her care. Nicole lives together with her husband and her children. She has had some problems with her husband but despite this, the couple cover the household expenses between them. Nicole has never been to school. For the past three years she has had a business selling eggs in front of the Abattoir pharmacy and she stocks up at Dantokpa. Nicole has never had a loan from ALIDé before. However, in order to expand her business and to meet heavy customer demand, she is applying for a first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of eggs

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Dembagnouma, 3 femmes mariées et 1 veuve, ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles monogames à Médine  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les deux prêts précédents. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait essentiellement  la vente de boissons non alcoolisées, de tissus et  de la restauration. 
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 20 casiers de boissons non alcoolisées, 8 rouleaux de tissus, 1sac de 100kg de riz, 1sac de 150kg de haricot et  5 paquets de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles revendent à Sikasso ville  au comptant,  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.250 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four members of the Dembagnouma group, three married women and one widow, are, on average, 38 years old and have four children. They live mostly in monogamous families in Médine, a district in the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the demands of their clients and are on their third joint loan, after having properly repaid the two preceding loans. This group of women mainly sells non-alcoholic beverages, fabric, and prepares and serves food. With their new loan, they plan to buy 20 cases of non-alcoholic beverages, 8 bolts of cloth, a 100 kg sack of rice, a 150 kg sack of beans and 5 packages of condiments. They get their supplies at the main market in Sikasso and in neighboring villages. They sell in Sikasso for cash and often on credit to a clientele of men and women. They each expect to make a monthly profit of 32,250 FCFA, part of which will be put into savings and to meet the needs of their families, and the rest will be invested in their business.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy various supplies

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby T. R. is from the city of Pulot, Ozamiz City. She is 34 years old. Ruby is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Ruby owns & operates a business operating a motor transport service. Ruby has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruby joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruby has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ruby from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del NorT. and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*NoT.: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a templaT. to automaT. the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this templaT. for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accuraT. information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Rosa Jakeline

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 19 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo de año y medio de edad, vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la ciudad de Chepén, capital de la provincia del mismo nombre, perteneciente a la región La Libertad, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia hizo que iniciara un negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes instalado en su vivienda, ella trata de ofrecer a sus clientes productos de calidad y un buen trato, en el tiempo que lleva trabajando el negocio ha crecido y goza de buena acogida en el sector donde vive, sobretodo porque pone al alcance de la mano de sus clientes productos de consumo diario por los cuales tendrían que movilizarse hasta el mercado de la ciudad para adquirirlos.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por eso se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes.

Rosa es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada en la zona donde vive, sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer responsable y entregada a su familia; su mayor anhelo es entregarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. En la imagen aparece junto a su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Rosa, 19, is a single mother; she has an 18-month-old son. She lives with her parents in the city of Chepén, capital of Chepén province, La Libertad region, located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region capital. In order to support her family, she opened a general store in her dwelling; she tries to offer quality items and kind customer service. During the time she’s been in business, business has grown and she is well-received in her neighborhood, above all because she makes accessible to her customers everything they need on a daily basis thereby ridding them of the need to travel to the city to market. She wants to expand her business to better meet customer demand so she is asking Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for funding. She is asking for 1000 new soles to buy stock merchandise for her store. Rosa is quite well-known and well-liked where she lives; her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be responsible and dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to provide her son with a better quality of life. She appears in the photo with her young son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Mrs. Channy Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Samar village in Kandal province is a village bank loan group which consists of eighteen people. All the members will use a loan for different purposes that will support their businesses. Mrs. Channy C. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a farmer who owns a veR. small piece of land to grow rice to support her family's living situation. Her husband, Mr. Vanna Khoem, is a seamstress in garment factoR. who receives a low salaR.. In the rice field she has a problem: her field is reaD. to farm, but she does not have enough money to plant. Thus, Mrs. Channy C. decided to apply for a loan to hire a plow machine to plow her rice field. She is the mother of a two-month-old child.

loans.use: To hire a plow machine to plow her rice field.

loans.name: Juanita's Group

texts.en:
Juanita D. is from the village of Brgy.Aurora, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Juanita is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Juanita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Juanita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juanita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Juanita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Saroem

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroem M. is 59 years old and lives in Trapeang Prei village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is also grocery seller who owns a small store to support her business. 

Since her grocery business is going well, Mrs. Saroem M. wants to expand it. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries to enlarge her business activities. 

Her husband, Mr. Nat Eam, practices traditional medicine to add a little income to his wife's to support the family. This couple has four children: two are car mechanics; one is staying at home; and the last one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, de 33 años, convive con su pareja Rosa (24), con quien tiene una pequeña hija. Juntos  viven en una casa alquilada. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, y  ahora con mayor razón pues, su motivación diaria es la nueva familia que está conformando. Cada día sale a las 5 de la mañana a trabajar en una tienda comercial, donde vende  productos comestibles, en asociación con su tío. A diario le pagan de 20 a 22 soles, también por trasladar la mercadería, desde la ciudad hasta otra localidad, donde está ubicada la bodega. Además atiende a los clientes y eso es lo que más le gusta, porque considera que tiene un trato especial, ya lleva trabajando 3 años en este negocio, mientras su pareja labora preparado comida, junto a su madre. Esta joven pareja tiene planeado, para más adelante, empezar con su propio centro comercial, y empezaran  por instalar una tienda, ya  que esta actividad es muy rentable, si se sabe administrar bien el dinero.Es  la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y quiere pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas porque, refiere que está haciéndose conocido por tener un buen historial crediticio y eso le importa mucho, al igual que al resto de integrantes de su banco comunal, con quienes les gusta trabajar.Edwin tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado, en la compra de  insumos necesarios para que su esposa continúe preparando comida, y así  generarse más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Edwin, 33 years old, lives with his partner Rosa (24), with whom he has a small daughter. They live in a rented house. He is known as a hard working man, now with more reason, as he is motivated daily by his new family. He leaves every day at 5 in the morning to work in a commercial store where he sells food products with his uncle. Additionally he makes 20 to 25 soles daily, transporting the merchandise from the city to another locality where the general store is located. He also takes care of the customers, which is what he likes the best, he believes that he has a good sales manner after being in this business for 3 years. His spouse works at preparing food with her mother. This young couple has plans in the future of having their own business by opening a store, since this activity is profitable if one know how to manage the money. This is the third loan with MFP and he wants to be punctual with his payments because he is getting to be known as having a good credit history, which is important to him as well as to the other members of the community bank, with whom he likes to work. Edwin plans to invest the proceeds in the purchase the necessary products needed for his wife to continue preparing meals, this way generating more income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy pants, blouses, shirts, underwear, and shoes, etc.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim K., 30, is married and resides with his wife and a child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country. He sells groceries, gasoline, and gas, and provides money exchange for an income of USD 3 per day. His wife is a garment factory worker, earning an income of USD 2 per day. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane R. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Jane is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Jane owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income from the business comes from buying and selling used clothing and ready-to-wear clothes to the local community. Jane has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jane is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to build her working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to build working capital

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 40 años de edad, madre soltera y vive en compañía de su dos hijos en su casa que es propia, que gracias a mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir. El trabajo al que se dedica es la fabricación y venta de zapatos en un taller que tiene en su domicilio, trabajo por el cual lo hace por medio de pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, quienes se dedican a vender calzados. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que este trabajo es muy rentable para solventar los gastos de su familia. En un futuro desea continuar trabajando muy duro para hacer crecer su taller y contratar más personas y así aumentar su producción. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, desea comprar mayor cantidad de materiales como cuero, pegamento para continuar con la fabricación de calzado.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 40 year old single mother. She lives with her two children in her own house, which she managed to get thanks to a great deal of effort. She makes and sells shoes in a shop she has in her house. She works by orders that her customers, who sell shoes, make. She has been doing this for three years. She considers her work to be very beneficial in paying the family expenses. In the future she wants to continue working very hard in order to make her shop grow. She also wants to hire more people to increase her production. This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to be very punctual with all of her payments. She wants to use the loan to buy a greater quantity of materials like leather and glue to continue making footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like leather and glue

loans.name: Brenda José

texts.es: La Sra. Brenda C. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como secretaria en el colegio Simeón Pereira de dicho municipio el cual es un centro de estudios de primaria donde tiene 10 años de laborar. Tiene tres años de trabajar con ceprodel donde se le han otorgado tres créditos para gastos personales. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de medicamentos para la buena salud de su mamá.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brenda C. is from the city of El Sauce. She is currently employed as a Secretary at Simeón Pereira public school. It is a primary school and she’s worked there for 10 years. She has collaborated with Ceprodel for three years and has had three loans for personal expenses. The requested loan is to buy medicines for her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For medical expenses.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djantoyerela, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 51 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Djinina, sous préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce du charbon de bois d’habillements etc.                                                                                              
Ces femmes du groupe Djantoyerela sont à leur treizième prêt solidaire et tous les douze prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                             
KADIA  T., la présidente du groupe Djantoyerela compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des sacs de charbon de bois
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des charbonniers du village et environnants et effectue sa vente au village et au bord du goudron et au marché de Fana, au comptant, en gros et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Djantoyerela are all married and on average they are 51 years old and have three children. They all lives in large traditional families in the village of Djinina in the Fana and Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are known through their families and through neighbours. They sell wood coal, clothing etc. The women of the Djantoyerela group are on their thirteenth loan cycle, having successfully repaid the twelve previous loans. Kadia T. is the leader of the Djantoyerela group. She will use her loan to purchase sacks of wood coal. She purchases the product from coal producers in the village and the surrounding regions and she resells in the village and along the tar pit and in the market in Fana. She completes her sales in cash, in wholesale, and in credit, to a clientele make up of men and women. She foresees a monthly income of 75 FCFA which will be used to cover the family's daily expenses and the rest will be reinvested back in the business.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood coal.

loans.name: Nurulo

texts.en:
T. Nurulo is a hard-working, 50-year-old man who has considerably improved his economic situation due to growing potatoes, onions and other vegetables. He feels happy to have the privilege of being a father to eight children. 

Nurulo grows a variety of different native vegetables and sells them at the market. He is saving money in order to become a taxi driver in the future, when his efforts in the field no longer are fruitful. In order to have a successful harvest, Nurulo is asking for a loan of $1,500 USD to buy sacks of seeds and organic fertilizer for his crop. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients can run successful businesses. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie O. is from the village of Mahayahay, Iligan City. She is 34 years old. Melanie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Melanie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods and other types of snack products in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Mahayahay, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Alinhinkira Women's Association-Jinja Group

texts.en:
N. Joy is affliated to Alinhinkira Group-Jinja. She is happily married with nine children. The trade of welding has mostly been a male preserve, but it is fascinating that in today’s Uganda you will find women who are eager to turn a hand to even the hardest of jobs, which often involve a lot of elbow grease. Joy has been involved in this trade for ten years now. Her operating headquarters are in Ivunamb trading center-Jinja.
The need for self reliance, she says, is what got her started in this business. Her story of transformation from a housewife into a fully fledged businesswoman is something in which she takes pride. She says young underprivileged girls can look up to her and emulate her. Her weekly income is 70,000 UGX. Joy also runs a charcoal sales business. With this loan, she wants to purchase metal materials for welding doors, windows and chairs.

loans.use: To purchase metal material for welding doors, windows and chairs

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina T. is 46 years old, single and has one grown son. She lives in Sokuluk village in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. Irina began her business in cattle breeding in 2005 in order to find an additional means of subsistence. With her initial capital of 6,000 KGS, Irina bought a bull. Today, she manages to earn about 5,000 KGS per month by selling meat products.
Irina is applying for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase bull calves for fattening and resale. In the future, she plans to broaden her business by purchasing more cattle.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en una zona rural de la localidad de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con ovejas y aves de corral, los cuales cría en algunos ambientes dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente cuenta con un terreno de cultivo producto de una herencia en donde suele sembrar mango y limón. Su esposa se dedica a trabajar preparando y vendiendo comida. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben de estas actividades se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Juan desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas durante esta temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda por sus animales aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old, is married and lives with his wife and their four children in a rural area of Tambogrande, a farming district in the Piura region, which is located more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region.

He has sheep and poultry which he raises in enclosures at home.  When the animals have reached a good size, he offers them for sale to the general public and to businessmen who visit the area regularly.  Juan also has a field which he inherited and where he grows mangoes and lemons.  His wife works preparing and selling food.  With their combined income, they try to make ends meet for their family.

Juan wants to expand his business by buying more animals and balanced feed so he can increase his sales during this Christmas season, which is when demand for his animals increases.  For this reason he thought it was a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 new soles.
