loans.use: Purchase animals to expand business growing and selling animals

loans.name: Susana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Susana de 41 años, tiene 4 hijos, una mayor de edad, y 3 que tiene a cargo, la mayor trabaja como docente, dos estudian en la Universidad, el otro hijo de 14 estudia en la Secundaria, ella trabaja como docente de educación secundaria desde hace 23 años, es importante mencionar que Susana con los creditos anteriores otorgados por AFODENIC ha mejorado su vivienda y sus condiciones de vida, a la vez agradece a Kiva por el financiemiento anterior ya que con este pudo realizar los servicios higienico e ir mejorando su vivienda.

Ahora solicita su credito para continuar sus mejoras en su Vivienda y de esta manera poder realizar una habitacion para el hijo mayor y brindarles mejor comodidad y privacidad. 

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos gocen de buena salud, de estabilidad laboral y que lleguen a disfrutar de una casa bonita y comoda y sobre todo estar bien con Dios.
texts.en:
Susana is 41 years old and has four children.  Her eldest daughter is grown up and her other three children are still in her care.  Her eldest works as a teacher, two are studying at university and her youngest son, who is 14, is in high school.  Susana has been working as a high school teacher for 23 years.  We should mention that, with previous loans from AFODENIC, Susana has improved her home and her living conditions.  She is grateful to Kiva for her last loan because she was able to use it to do some work on her bathroom and further improve her home.

Susana is now requesting a new loan so that she can continue improving her home and build a room for her eldest son to provide him with more comfort and better privacy.  Susana's greatest dream is for her children to enjoy good health and stable jobs, for them to enjoy a nice, comfortable home and, above all, for all to be well with God.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 21-year-old single woman living with her parents in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her desire is to be economically independent from her family. Jackline has a retail shop and has been in business for two years now, first as an employee and now as the shop owner. Jackline is requesting a loan to buy salt, sugar, and soap.

loans.use: to purchase salt, sugar, and soap

loans.name: Deysi Diana

texts.es:
Deysi de  28 años, es una joven trabajadora que comenzó hace 3 años atrás con su pequeña tienda  con un capital de $ 300.00. Poco a poco y con ayuda de su esposo ha incrementado la mercadería que vende en la tienda ya que está ubicada en la parte delantera de su casa.

Viviendo en una zona muy turística llamada Playas (conocida porque tiene uno de los mejores climas en todo el mundo) continúa trabajando para darles una buena vida a sus tres hijos que están estudiando. En su tienda tiene a la venta arroz, bebidas, enlatados, azúcar entre otros. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso que por ahora quiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, enlatados y otros víveres de primera necesidad. En el futuro quiere tener nuevas instalaciones en su tienda para su mejora de ingresos.
texts.en:
Deysi is 28 years old. She is a hard working young woman who opened her small store 3 years ago with $300 of capital. Little by little, and with her husband's help, she has increased the merchandise she sells in her store, which is located in the front of her house.  

Living in a very touristy area called Playas (known for having one of the best climates in the world), she continues to work to give a good life to her children, who are in school. In her store, she sells rice, beverages, canned goods, sugar, and more. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. every day.  

She aspires to a lot of things for her business. That is why she wants the loan to buy rice, canned goods and other basic necessity products. In the future, she wants to have new facilities in her store to improve her income.

loans.use: Rice, sugar

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, y tiene cuatro hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Verónica se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez más clientes.

Verónica desea implementar su stock de productos de belleza para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Verónica is 32 years old, she is married and has four children. She lives with her husband in Tambogrande, a district of the Piura province, located in the region by the same name whose main characteristic is the fact that its inhabitants mainly engage in growing fruits.

Verónica engages in selling beauty products by catalogue. She can count on a group of customers who frequently buy her products: the more requests she satisfies the more points she gains form the company that supplies her with the products, consequently earning more. This is why she constantly works hard to win more customers.

Verónica wishes to increase her stock of beauty products in order to satisfy the requests she is currently receiving, and for this reason she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: To increase her stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 50 years old and is married.  He has ten children aged between 1 and 25 years old.  He takes care of two children aged between 2.5 and 6 years old.  

Faustin has a cow trading business. He has been in this business for about four years.   His working hours are from 7am until 5pm every day. His business is well-organized and he employs two people to help him.

Faustin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through adding more cows to sell.

With this loan, Faustin has a vision of growing his business to the extent where he can even start wholesaling.  If he starts wholesaling, he hopes to earn more profits than before,  which in turn will be used for further reinvestment in his business. He will then also be able to renovate his house.

loans.use: To expand his farm

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
El grupo Génesis está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedora una de ellas es la señora Sandra Carolina R. quien tiene una serigrafía y vende cosméticos. Ella inicio con la serigrafía de calzado desde hace 15 años junto con su esposo y a sus tres hijos les han enseñado el oficio de decorar zapatos.
Ella invertirá el crédito en pinturas y otros materiales para la serigrafía.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Elisabeth Cruz quien vende plata y cosméticos y Juana Cristina M. vende verduras en el oriental.
texts.en:
The “Génesis” group has three hard working, enterprising members.  One of them is Mrs. Sandra Carolina R. who has a silk-screening printing shop and also sells cosmetics.  She started out silk screening footwear 15 years ago with her husband and they have taught their three children the shoe decorating occupation.  She will use the loan for paints and other silk screening supplies.

The other group members are Elisabeth Cruz who sells silver and cosmetics and Juana Cristina M. who is a vegetable merchant at the Oriental Market.

loans.use: For paint.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan C. tiene ya más de diez años dedicándose a dar mantenimiento y reparación de llantas para autos. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso para el y su familia, esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio ya que le están haciendo falta mas variedad de llantas y herramientas.
Pero por  el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar a cabo la inversión, es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación en este crédito.
Planea pagar el préstamo con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan C. has more than ten years of experience maintaining and repairing car tires. This business is the source of income for himself and his family. He is requesting a loan to invest in his business since he lacks equipment and a variety of tires.

At the moment, he does not have the necessary funds to follow through on this investment. For this reason, he is requesting assistance through this loan. Juan plans to repay this loan using some of the profits from his business.

loans.use: To invest in equipment and tires for his business.

loans.name: Cenon

texts.en: Cenon C. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling snack foods, candies and biscuits in his community. He is 37 years old, single and has an infant child. He is from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. Cenon has been in his business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Cenon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Cenon is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional snack foods and candies. This will be his second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use additional income to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack foods and candies.

loans.name: Sandra Adriana

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos la señora Sandra, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de  19,  17, 15 y 11 años, uno es mayor  de edad y estudia en Universidad y los menores en colegio y escuela. El marido de dedica a la pesca.

Ella además de atender su hogar también tiene un local en el cual ofrece el servicio de internet (cibercafé), allí vende jugos naturales, sodas, golosinas y bocadillos de picar a sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio, nos cuenta que lleva 7 años dedicada a esta actividad y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, sodas, aguas, golosinas y bocadillos. Ella lleva en el Banco Comunal cinco años y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado a mejorar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Los Arenales is located in the parish of Crucita in the canton of Portoviejo. Every two weeks the members of the Nueva Generación (New Generation) Community Bank meet there. It is a place known for its beautiful beaches, its food, and the warmth of its people.

34-year old Sra. Sandra is a member of the bank. She lives with her partner and their four children aged 19, 17, 15, and 11. The eldest attends university and the younger ones go to college or school. Sandra’s husband is a fisherman.

As well as looking after the household, she runs an Internet cafe (cybercafe) where she sells natural juices, soft drinks, candy, and snacks to her customers. She works there every day from 8am to 8pm. Her children also help with the business. She’s been doing this work for seven years and it is going well.

This loan will be used to buy fruit, soft drinks, water, candy and snacks. Sandra has been a member of the bank for five years and enjoys having access to loans which have helped her improve her business. Her dream is to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy fruit, soft drinks, water, candy and snacks

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lorena de 36 años, es una mujer inspirada en su familia decidió encontrar una actividad economica. Comenzo con la preparación de condimentos y también en la venta de víveres para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.

En la actualidad trabaja sola de 7:30am a 9h30pm  en la preparación de condimentos y la mercaderia de la tienda. Su esposo trabaja de taxi amigo y tienen 2 hijo que estudian en escuela. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, colas y asi incrementar la productividad del negocio. En el futuro desea seguir prosperando y mas ventas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lorena, 36 years old, is a woman inspired by her family who decided to find an economic activity. She began by preparing condiments and also, selling provisions, in order to help her husband with household expenses.

At present, she works alone from 7:30 am until 9:30 pm in preparing condiments and merchandise for the store. Her husband drives a taxi and they have 2 children, both in school. 

Lorena has many aspirations concerning her business. For this reason, she desires a loan to buy rice, sugar, and colas, in hopes of increasing the productivity of the business. In the future, she wishes to continue prospering by increasing sales.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and colas to sell.

loans.name: Adriana Beatriz

texts.es: Adriana Beatriz de veinte años de edad vive con su familia; Ella posee una tienda en el lugar de su residencia la cual es muy visitada por las personas del lugar. Adriana es una joven entusiasta que quiere ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, para ella trabajar todos los días es su inspiración. Últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues da el mejor servicio, siempre con una sonrisa en el rostro y vende sus productos a un buen precio, quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más productos como pan, golosinas, bebidas, granos básicos entre otros para abastecer la tienda y para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Adriana sueña con que su trabajo le ayude a superarse como persona y también le ayude a darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en: Adriana Beatriz is 20 years old and lives with her family.  She has a store in her home in which she serves the people in her area.  Adriana is an enthusiastic young woman who would like to help her family get ahead in life.  She is inspired to work every day.  Lately she has had a lot of customers since she provides a very good service.  She always has a smile on her face and she sells her products at a good price.  Adriana would like to see her business grow and so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy more products such as bread, candies, drinks, basic grains, etc. with which to stock her store and meet her customers' needs.  Adriana dreams of improving herself as a person and providing her family with a better life through her work.

loans.use: to buy bread, candies, drinks and basic grains

loans.name: Agatinde Group

texts.fr: Simon  est client d’ACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Agatinde, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est de 8 ans de l’école primaire, il est marié, il est cultivateur de riz, il a 30 ans, il a 3 enfants entre 12 et 1 an, 2 de ses enfants va  à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Simon va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de riz en paiement de main d’œuvre et achat d’engrais chimique. Sa stratégie est suivre les étapes appropriées et selon la saison pour augmenter la production. Dans l’avenir, il veut un augmenter la surface à cultiver.
texts.en: Simon has been an ACB customer since 2011 and is a member of the Agatinde group. He was born in Rwanda and attended primary school for eight years. He is married, 30 years old and has three children between one and twelve years old, two of whom attend school. He is a rice grower by trade. This is the first loan that he has sought and he will use it to pay labour costs and to purchase chemical fertiliser. His plan is to follow the necessary steps and to harvest his crops during the correct seasons so that he can boost production further. In future he would like to extend the area of land that he cultivates.

loans.use: to purchase fertilisers and pay labour costs

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr: Née le 10 juillet 1976 au Bénin, Félicité  est mariée à un enseignant  du nom de Noel. Le couple  a  cinq enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois restent encore à leur charge.  Félicité  vit ensemble avec  son mari et  ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Félicité a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Félicité prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, riz, accompagné de sauce aux poissons, etc.) qu’elle vend à son domicile. A côté de cette activité qui lui génère des revenus,  Félicité  vend des boissons non alcoolisées.  Félicité s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Félicité sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième prêt. Les deux premiers crédits ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Born on July 10, 1976 in Bénin, Félicité  is married to a teacher named Noel. The couple have five children. All of them have been or are presently in school and their parents are still responsible for three of them. Félicité lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in supporting the family. 

Félicité left her studies when she was in secondary school. To support herself and her children, Félicité prepares food (maize porridge or rice accompanied by fish stew, etc.) that she sells out of her home. Alongside this income-generating activity, Félicité  sells non-alcoholic drinks. She buys her supplies in a marketplace in Bénin. She is requesting her third loan from ALIDé. The two other loans were both reimbursed correctly.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, condiments for stews, fresh fish and drinks.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married and 33 years old. She has 2 school aged children. She has a retail shop where she sell a variety of products that she can offer to the people in her community.

Irene is requesting a loan of PHP11,000 to buy more products as inventory like coffee, creamer, detergents, etc. Each month, Irene earns about PHP300 per day doing this type of work.

In the future, Irene hopes that her business will improve more so that she can sustain the need of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products as inventory like coffee, creamer, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Buisson Ardent Plus Group

texts.en: Christine, age 44, is the chairwoman of the community bank named Buisson Ardent Plus, which consists of 19 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the microfinance institution, HOPE RDC, with the goal of developing their businesses. Christine has been in the microenterprise world for years. She has been running a restaurant located southeast of the city of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of HOPE RDC, who has already received nine different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to increase the stock of her restaurant by buying a sack of flour, fish and beans with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $70. Her ambition is to open a big restaurant in her area. Christine is married and has three children whose ages are between 6 and 12 years old. Two of them go to school.

loans.use: to increase the stock of her restaurant by buying flour, beans and other goods.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. For the past 3 years she has had a food shop where she serves dishes like afritada & caldereta. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking.

Leonita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en: Narangerel is 47 years old and lives with her two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. Her older son works in a private company and her younger one is a student. She manages a meat trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2001 and is planning to continue her business in the future. She bought 10 sheep to sell this coming fall. She is an honest woman who says, "I want my older son to have valid education." She is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more sheep to increase her business sales.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep

loans.name: German

texts.es: El señor German trabaja como chofer de minibús de transporte de pasajeros en el radio urbano de la ciudad de La Paz y es socio del sindicato de choferes “litoral”; su esposa se dedica al comercio de ropa. El crédito lo requiere para la reparación de su vehiculo, específicamente la caja del mismo, pues tiene algunos problemas. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y  tiene  dos hijos. El cliente esta satisfecho por los créditos que obtuvo hasta la fecha y esta es la segunda vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. German works as a chauffeur and drives a passenger minibus within the urban radius of the city of La Paz. He is a member of the “Litoral” transportation union. His wife is a clothing merchant. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair his vehicle, specifically the gearbox, because it has been experiencing a few problems. German lives at the home of his parents in the District of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. He is married and has two children.

German is pleased with the loans he has received to date. This is the second time his loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to pay the cost of repairing the gearbox in his minibus.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
I am continuing to dream and not lose hope that someday I will lift my family out of poverty, Ricardo says. Ricardo is full of dreams that push him to work hard and improve his strategies to attain his dreams. Ricardo is 36 years old and is married to a housewife with four children.
Ricardo is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers and fuel to use in farming. Ricardo visits his farm daily to assure that his crops are not affected by any disease like neck rot and pests. His target is to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds, fertilizers and fuel to use in farming.

loans.name: Agnes Mary

texts.en:
Agnes Mary  is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is single and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Agnes Mary  has been working hard to manage her small retail business, which sells assorted goods. 

To help expand her business, Agnes Mary  has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her stock of assorted goods and will help Agnes Mary  to generate greater profits and expand her business. Agnes Mary  hopes that in the future she will be able to start up an extra business. 

Agnes Mary  is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Agnes Mary  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to increase her stock of assorted goods.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El Comité Virgen del Carmen, está situados en la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi, han avanzando al segundo ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Rurales de la Fundación Paraguaya. Este comité ha renovado el compromiso de que seguirán con la misma responsabilidad del ciclo anterior demostrando solidaridad y unión entre las compañeras.
El Comité cuenta con 10 integrantes, las cuales son mujeres muy sacrificadas y trabajadoras.
Una de las miembros es la señora Rumilda, ella tiene una despensa donde tiene todo tipo de productos. Ella comenta que al principio tenia una pequeña despensa pero que de a poco ha ido creciendo. Dice que este es su principal fuente de ingresos, para ella y su familia. Tiene muchos clientes que siempre acuden hasta su local, pues tiene mucha variedad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas y demás para abastecer su local comercial, pues de esa forma podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Committee “Virgen del Carmen” is located in the city of Villa Ygatimi and has advanced to its second loan cycle as part of the Committee of Rural Women Program with Fundación Paraguaya.  This committee has renewed its commitment to continue with the same level of responsibility as its previous loan cycle, in which it demonstrated solidarity and unity among its members.  

The group consists of 10 members, all of whom are self-sacrificing and hardworking women.  One of them is Sra. Rumilda, who has a food pantry where she sells all types of products.  She says that her food pantry was small at the beginning, but it has grown a little bit at a time.  Rumilda says that this is the main source of income for herself and her family.  She has many customers who always come to her store because she offers great variety.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy food products, beverages, vegetables, and other products to restock her store.  This will enable her to fulfill the requests of her customers.

loans.use: to buy food products, beverages, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur. She enjoys her daily activities in acquiring profits in her sari-sari (variety) store. She is selling soap, shampoo, biscuits, canned goods and beverages to the people in her village. Her store is located near the school; that is why she needs to buy more items to sell that would increase her earnings. She had insufficient funding so she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy soft drinks, breads, eggs, sugar and coffee to sell in her store.

Marissa is now 40 years old, married and has one infant age child. Someday, she wants to establish a bigger store to conveniently stock her groceries, acquire good sales and save enough money for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads, eggs, sugar and coffee to sell in her store.

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en:
Crisanto, age 24, is from the village of Calaocan, Angadanan, Isabela. He and his wife have a baby. To make a living, Crisanto plants and harvests corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 14 years and earned approximately 35,000 PHP with his last crop.

At this time, he would like to request a loan of PHP 50,000 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides to supplement his farm business. He hopes that Kiva lenders will continue assisting him in the business so that he can further improve it and thereby support his family basic necessities.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides for his farm

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia, a widow with ten children, lives in Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur where she has been selling bananacue to make a living for more than a year, earning about Php 3,000.00 per month to support her family.

A member of GDMPC for more than two years, Lucrecia has requested a loan of Php 5,000.00 to buy bananas and other cooking ingredients for her business. She intends to stand firm in her efforts to support her family, and she will work hard to expand the enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and other cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su esposa y sus hijos quienes son independientes, él se dedica a atender un taller de ojalatería y herrería, haciendo machetes, hachas, cuchillos, este trabajo lo realiza de 5:00pm a 10:00pm, las ventas las realiza los fines de semana en el mercado municipal.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de carbono y hierro, para la elaboración de machetes, barra, asadores,  el préstamo será un gran aporte económico para Manuel, ya que comprara lo necesario para la elaboración de las herramientas que muchos clientes le solicitan.
Su aspiración es convertir el taller más grande de la zona, atender la demanda de muchos clientes, y capacitándose para mejorar la ejecución de su trabajo.
texts.en: Manuel lives with his wife and his children who are adults.  He works in a tin and blacksmith shop, making machetes, axes, and knives.  He works daily from 5:00pm to 10:00pm.  He sells his work on the weekends in the city market.  Currently he is requesting a loan to purchase coal and iron in order to make machetes, poles, and grills.  The loan will be a great economic help to Manuel, since he will buy what is needed to make the tools that many clients request.  His goal is to make his shop the largest one in the area, to meet the demand of many clients, and to increase his skills in executing his work.

loans.use: To purchase coal and iron

loans.name: Gabriel Jaime

texts.es:
En una vereda en el oriente de Antioquia en el municipio del Carmen de Viboral caracterizado por tener grandes artesanos, se encuentra la vivienda del señor Gabriel quien es un gran experto en la elaboración y comercialización de artesanías en madera orgánica y telares antiguos en compañía de su esposa y una de sus tres hijas, quienes son su gran motivación y apoyo. Esta bella labor de Don Gabriel la lleva a cabo desde hace 20 años durante los cuales ha participado en ferias artesanales  y  se desplaza cada primer sábado de cada mes hasta Medellín para participar en la feria artesanal llamada San Alejo; feria muy famosa en la ciudad donde se reúnen en el Parque de Bolívar todos aquellos artesanos que ofrecen sus productos a los habitantes de Medellín y sus turistas.
El señor Gabriel desea comprar materia prima para continuar elaborando sus productos para poder atender la demanda de pedidos y ferias artesanales que se avecinan con la temporada de fin de año y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos para continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar y brindarle a sus tres hijas y esposa una mejor calidad de vida. A sus 48 años,  Don Gabriel desea construir su casa propia y darles todo lo necesario a sus hijas de 17, 16 y 13 años de edad quienes ven en su padre el mejor ejemplo a seguir.
texts.en:
On a sidewalk in the east of Antioquia department, in the town of El Carmen de Viboral which is noted for its great craftspeople, you will find the home of Gabriel who is a great expert in making and selling organic wood handicrafts and woven products together with his wife and one of his three daughters who are his greatest motivation and support.  Gabriel has carried out this beautiful work for 20 years, during which time he has participated in craft fairs and traveled on the first Saturday of every month to Medellín to take part in the San Alejo craft fair.  This is a very famous craft fair in the city.  All the craftspeople who sell their products to the inhabitants and tourists in Medellín gather there.

Gabriel would like to buy raw materials so that he can continue making his products and meet his demand for orders and craft fairs which are approaching with the end-of-year season.  In this way, he will increase his income and so be able to continue providing for his household and providing his three daughters and wife with a better quality of life.  At 48 years of age, Gabriel would like to build his own home and provide his daughters, who are 17, 16 and 13 years old, with everything they need.  The girls see their father as the best example to follow.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making his handicrafts

loans.name: Lesly Noemy

texts.es:
La señora Lesly tiene 35 años y vive el la aldea de 2 Caminos Sur con su esposo Fangio y sus 4 hijos. Tienen un hijo de 18 años y 3 hijas de 16, 14, y 12 años de edad. Todos están estudiando. 

Lesly y su esposo trabajan juntos en el negocio. Tienen un comedor donde venden comida como chuletas, pollo, tortillas con quesillo, tacos y carne asada. Empezaron el negocio hace 17 años. Antes Lesly trabajaba en una maquila, pero decidió poner su propio negocio. Ella trabaja 10 horas diarias en el comedor y con la ayuda de tres créditos, el negocio se ha expandido. 

Solicitó este credito de L15000, para invertirlo en la compra de insumos para el comedor como ser: carne, tortilla y quesillo entre otras cosas. Lesly espera surtir un poco más el negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Lesly is 35 years old and lives in the neighborhood of 2 Caminos Sur with her husband Fangio and their four children. They have an 18-year-old son and three daughters who are 16, 14, and 12. All of them are studying.

Lesly and her husband work together in their business. They have a diner where they sell food such as pork chops, chicken, tortillas with cheese, tacos, and grilled beef. She started this business 17 years ago. Lesly previously worked at a factory, but she decided to start her own business. She works 10 hours a day at the diner. With the help of three loans, her business has expanded.

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL to invest in the purchase of supplies for her diner such as meat, tortillas, cheese, and other items. Lesly hopes to stock up on a little more inventory for her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, tortillas, cheese, and other items.

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.ru: Чахонгир проживает в районе Пяндж. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он занимается скотоводством. Чахонгир разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота и минеральных удобрений. У него при доме имеется небольшой участок земли, где он выращивает овощи.
texts.en: Jahongir lives in the Pyandj region. He is 28 years old, married, and has three children. He is engaged in livestock breeding. He raises cattle for sale. He needs a loan to buy small cattle and mineral fertilizer. Next to his house he has a small plot of land where he grows vegetables.

loans.use: to buy small cattle and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 27-year-old married woman from Irvbid, Jordan, and is a mother of three children.
Yasmeen sells clothes from her home and is requesting a loan of 4,100 JOD to purchase more clothes for the winter season. Yasmeen is looking to have a shop for her products so that she can better display her clothes and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Evelyn has a shop that sells vegetables & spices like onions, garlic & black pepper. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with nine children, three of whom attend school while the others have graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a mat and basket-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors. She dreams of expanding her business so she can meet her customers' demands. 

With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase bamboo slivers to weave baskets and mats to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo slivers to weave baskets and mats to sell.

loans.name: Sareim

texts.en:
Sareim is 27 years old. She is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs the business of purchasing junk materials to resell. He earns about $10 per day.

Sareim is building her house. Due to lack of funds, Sareim is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase cement to use for building her house. This money will help her finish the house’s construction and provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cement to use for building her house

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela vive junto a su madre, una sobrina y una hermana,  Desde hace 12 años que Blanca posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborarlas y venderlas,  Este negocio  ha  nacido con el deseo de poder mejorar la economía familiar, ya que en muchas ocasiones no se contaba con el dinero necesario para solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que Blanca desea poder seguir creciendo  con el negocio y atender a más personas. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor, de manera que pueda obtenerlo a precios más accesible, así mismo comprar cilindros de gas propano y cal para el maíz. Esto será de mucha ayuda para ella por lo que la ilusiona mejorar en gran manera su estabilidad económica.

loans.use: Compra de maíz y cal para elaborar tortillas

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle. He is a 35-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Although he never went to school, Christopher has a vision of educating his children up to university. For seven years, he has been in the transport sector. He started as a hired driver and, after accumulating enough wages, Christopher bought his own motorcycle and has found the sector to be very lucrative. He faces the hardships of high fuel and transportation costs. His vision is to diversify his business to include dairy farming and to own at least six motorcycles. 

Christopher is requesting a loan to buy a new motorcycle that he intends to hire out to a second person who will be remitting 80% of the daily earnings.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Chabi

texts.en:
Chabi, a 50 year old woman from Jayanagar village in the Koraput district of Odisha, is a hard working agricultural laborer, earning a daily wage. Apart from her full time work as a laborer, she also runs a animal husbandry business. 

A household income of 6,000 INR and expenses of 5,000 INR would mean savings as low as 1,000 INR per month. With the current scenario, the family of three has a long way to go before they make significant changes to their lives. Chabi wants to make sure that her family is headed towards a brighter and better future, even if it means doubling the amount of work that she does. She wants to expand her small scale animal husbandry business by buying a new buffalo. She seeks a loan of 35,000 INR for this purpose. With the help of the loan she is confident about increasing her monthly earnings by 2,000 INR. This increase, though seems minimal, can make a lot of difference to their lives.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milking

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 25 years old. She is living in Monterrey NL and married. Her husband works as a butcher and together they have two children, Brandon and Escalet are 8 and 4 years old respectively. At the moment Ana Maria is pregnant. Two years ago she felt the need to help her husband with the home expenses and pay an education to her children. Her older son started school and this added to their family expenses. She decided start to sell beauty products with her family and friends, so that she could care for her children and take care of her house.

She requests a loan of $275 USD to purchase additional merchandise, because her customers are increasing with the Christmas season. Ana Maria also wants to be supplied from merchandise with prices that are cheaper than the normal market.

This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Ana Maria tiene 25 años, es originaria de Monterrey NL y esta casada; su esposo trabaja como carnicero y tiene dos hijos, Brandon y Escalet tienen 8 y 4 años respectivamente. Actualmente Ana Maria esta embarazada y hace dos años se vio en la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que su hijo mayor entro a la primaria y esto incremento más los gastos familiares. Fue así como decidió comenzar a vender productos de belleza con sus familiares y amigas, al mismo tiempo ella podía cuidar a sus hijos y atender su casa.

Solicita un crédito de $275 USD para compra mercancía adicional, debido a que sus clientes se están incrementando con la temporada navideña y además Ana Maria quiere abastecerse de mercancía a precios de mayoreo para que le sea más barato.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison is a rice farmer from the county of Santa Lucia in rural Ecuador. He has a very small farm, but it suffices to cover the expenses of his family. He is hoping that with this loan he will be able to maximize the production of his fields. He has about 25 years of experience in rice farming. He has three children ages 16, 12 and 5 who are all in school. He hopes he can continue to provide for them so they will be able to receive an adequate education.

The Primero de Agosto Communal Bank in Santa Lucia

Edison is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program: the Primero de Agosto Communal Bank. All bank members are part of the Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia, and they will use these microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. As members of a communal bank, they are all guarantors for each other's loans. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we work with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about the commnity of Santa Lucia, compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The region is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area, as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them harvest their crop. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not have access to formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also often lack skills and knowledge of how to commercialize their product and get fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them to repay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Plant Rice

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married and has a 12-year-old child. Her husband is only seasonally employed, and he did not anticipate the necessary resources to sustain the family. Due to this, five years ago Irene decided to start her own business selling snacks. Little by little her business has gained popularity among neighbors, and she has increased her clients. Irene only seeks the best for her child and hopes that he can continue his studies.

To cover the demand of her clients and continue growing, Irene asks for a loan of 750 dollars to purchase goods. She intends to pay back her loan within 6-12 months. Now is moment to help those in greatest need; the well being of this family is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Irene es casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, su esposo tiene trabajos sólo por temporadas y en ocasiones no contaba con los recursos necesarios para el sustento de su familia, ante esta necesidad, Irene decidió abrir su propio negocio, hace cinco años, con la venta de botanas, poco a poco se ha dado a conocer entre sus vecinas y se han incrementado sus clientes. Irene sólo busca lo mejor para su hijo y desea que pueda continuar con sus estudios.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo, Irene solicita un préstamo por $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, no lo dudes más, el bienestar de esta familia está en tus manos.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Arzulla

texts.en: Arzulla is 47 years old and lives in Salyan region, Khaladj village. He is married and has a child. This man has been in this business for 9 years. Now he needs a loan of $475 to buy  3 sacks of fertilizer and orchard medicines for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and orchard medicines

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma P. is a selfless hard-working mother with high hopes of providing a better life for her two small daughters, ages 6 and 9. She's determined to put behind her the painful memory of when her husband left her when she was pregnant with her youngest daughter, leaving Norma without any support. This act did not deter her, and she decided to consolidate the haberdashery she started some years back, selling items like pins, needles, elastic and dyes. She has now been in business 10 years, selling products in her city's streets. Norma’s goal is to increase her stock with a wider variety of products to offer to not only her clients in the city but also to new customers living in small towns in the outskirts. In this way she will generate more income and be able to improve the quality of life of her two daughters. Her day begins at 4:30 a.m., when she prepares Jennifer and Cinthya's meals for when they return from school, cleans the home and makes preparations for when she goes to work.

Norma is requesting a loan of $150, which she plans to repay within six months. This will help her purchase higher-quality products and offer a wider selection to her customers, fulfilling her goal. Norma is waiting for your support and friendly hand.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Normita P., es una madre trabajadora y abnegada con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a sus dos menores hijas de 6 y 9 años; ávida de olvidar un penoso episodio que le causó mucho dolor ,hace años atrás, cuando esperaba la llegada de su última niña; su esposo decidió abandonar su hogar y dejarlas sin ningún amparo. Este hecho no hizo que Norma se amilanara y decidió consolidar el pequeño negocio que había emprendido hace ya varios años atrás, la venta de mercería (pasadores, agujas, cintas de elástico, tintes para ropa, ganchos para ropa, peines, etc.). Actualmente lleva realizando esta actividad 10 años de forma ambulatoria en las calles de la ciudad donde reside desde muy temprano y su deseo es adquirir mayor cantidad de artículos para tener un stock más amplio y variado para ofrecérselos no sólo a sus clientes citadinos sino también a sus nuevos clientes que habitan los pueblitos aledaños a su localidad. De esta manera generará mayores ingresos y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dos pequeñas niñas.Sus actividades las inicia desde las 4.30 am.con la preparación de los alimentos que consumirán Jennifer y Cinthya, cuando retornen de la escuela, la limpieza de su hogar y los preparativos de las cosas que llevará con ella para ofrecérselos a sus clientes. Su solicitud es por la suma de 150 dólares con un compromiso de pago de 6 meses, que la ayudarán a tener mayor cantidad y variedad de productos para iniciar el cumplimiento de su meta. Ayudémosla juntos, Norma espera de tu apoyo y mano amiga.

loans.use: Purchase more and better products for her haberdashery to increase her sales radius and help her provide a better life for her children.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en: Bina M. is a 39 year old woman and she lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Ashok M. works in the peon post in a bank. Her older son is studying in grade 5 and her younger son is in primary school. Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop 4 years ago. She sells different grocery goods in her shop. Now she needs a loan of Rs20000 to increase the necessary stock of food for her shop such as noodles, rice, biscuits and others. She wishes to use her income to give better education to her children.

loans.use: Bina would like to buy grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben D. is a hardware dealer who deals in all kinds of building materials. He is married with three children. The wife is also a trader. Mr. D. works very hard and has lots of customers. The shop is located at a very good place. He supplies building contractors with all kinds of building materials. 

One major challenge that Ben faces is that orders from his customers keep on increasing but his capital has not.   So it has become difficult to meet rising customer demand.  He is therefore asking for a loan of US $ 1,200 dollars to buy more door locks, paints, brushes, plywood, water closet seaters, and roofing sheets to supply to his contractors.

loans.use: To buy more door locks, paints, brushes, plywood’s, water closet seaters, and roofing sheets to supply to his contractors.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
This is Nelly K. from Mbeya, Tanzania, who is widowed with two children, aged 27 and 30, and has one other dependent, who is her niece. In 2002 Nelly established a farming business, and now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
This is a committee of 15 working women in the San Francisco Neighborhood in the city of Caacupe. Most of them make and sell “chipas,” and others have little kiosks or small stores. Currently, they are in the 8th cycle of the committee program of Women Entrepreneurs, and they are being benefited by a credit of 1,000,000 Gs the equivalent of 217 dollars for each member.

The committee started with the initial reunions of Mrs. Felicita L., who was in charge of gathering the women to be members. Two of the many characteristics of this group is their punctuality in their payments and their savings.

This committee is part of a group of 3 committees of Women Entrepreneurs that gathered under the supervision of the Caacupe office of Paraguayan Foundation, with the objective of cleaning abandoned lots, the streets and alleys in their neighborhood, on order to stop the breeding of mosquitoes. There are many infectious diseases transmitted by these insects.

The women are soliciting this credit to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante Kiva volunteer

El comité está compuesto por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Caacupé, la mayoría se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chipas, otras poseen despensas y kioscos. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra en el 8 ciclo del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendoras, y la misma están siendo beneficiadas con un crédito promedio de G. 1.000.000 cada integrante.

El comité se inició con las primeras reuniones en la casa de la señora Felicita López, quién fue la encargada de convocar a las señoras. Una de las características del grupo es la puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas y sus ahorros.

El comité actualmente es parte integrante de un grupo de 3 comités de Mujeres Emprendedoras que se unieron bajo la supervisión de la oficina de Caacupé de la Fundación Paraguaya, con el fin realizar limpieza de patios baldíos, veredas, calles de sus barrios con la finalidad de eliminar criaderos de mosquitos ya que existen diversas enfermedades que se transmiten con la picadura de estos insectos.

Las señoras solicitan el crédito para invertirlos en sus negocios.

loans.use: Para la compra de almidón, queso, aceite vegetal, así azùcar, carne, yerba, harina, leche, carbón, y bebidas de todo tipo.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea N., age 30, is a vendor of grocery products, earning around $10 of income per day. Her husband Mr. Soy Tor works as an assistant clerk for the local government in his village and makes approximately $2 a day. This couple has three children, all of whom are students. They need to pay for their children’s schooling, especially the extra classes in the afternoon that helps them pass exams. She plans to use the loan to purchase more grocery products to sell as she now has high customer demand. She will also buy a water pump and fertilizers for their small plot of farmland.

loans.use: She plans to use the loan to purchase more grocery products and a water pump and fertilizers.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mr. Van T., 59, earns $1 per day as a government official in Balung Lech Village, Kampong Thom Province. His wife, Nhem Sinat, raises ducks from their home. Their married children don’t live with them.

Mr.T. requests a $400 loan to purchase more ducks for his wife to raise. With the extra income generated by the ducks, they hope to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks for his wife to raise

loans.name: Uk´ux´kem Group

texts.es:
Entering the meeting place of the women who make up the Uk´Ux Kem Group, one can feel the difference between this group and the average communal bank. In my case, I observed a cheerful environment that involved such riotous laughter at one point that we had to pause briefly before continuing with my interview! This resulted when I asked for a show of hands from those women present who raised farm animals. The translator told them to raise their hands if they were animals.

The Uk´Ux Kem ladies are unequalled in their sense of joy, which is reflected in the manner in which they work and use their credit. It appears all the group members feel a loan helps them better themselves business-wise, given that this increases their working capital and grows their small businesses.

The majority of the members invest their loan in fabric. Many create beautiful traditional blouses called “huipiles”. In addition, they also use the same creative techniques to make cloth napkins, table coverings, and other items for interior decorating. The other part of the group uses the credit to raise livestock to be sold at the market. This is a good business in rural areas where large enterprises in this arena have not yet arrived at the markets.

You will find several outstanding businesswomen among this group. For example, Mrs. Candelaria H. told me she was currently employing three women to make cortes, a traditional skirt, and another woman to make cloth napkins. Mrs. Albina Yiax commented that she raises chickens, and uses their waste to fertilize her maize crop.

Interviewing this group of women was a pleasure and wonderful assignment because they are hard-working ladies who, despite their difficult situations, keep a lovely smile on their faces. It is for this reason that you must provide them with your support.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Entrando al lugar de reunión de las mujeres que conforman el grupo Uk´Ux Kem uno puede sentir la diferencia entre este grupo y un banco comunal promedio. En mi caso, pude sentir un ambiente alegre que se materializó en risa incontrolables que hasta en un punto ¡llegaron a ser un breve impedimento para proseguir con la entrevista! Este punto llegó cuando les peí a las compañeras que levantaran la mano las que criaban animales y la traductora les dijo que levantaron la mano las que son animales.

Las mujeres Uk´Ux Kem no solo son inigualables en el sentido de la alegría que reflejan sino en la manera como trabajan y utilizan el crédito. Al parecer, todas las clientas creen que el crédito las ayuda a superarse empresarialmente, ya que les ayuda a aumentar su capital y por ende agrandar su pequeño negocio.

La mayoría de ellas invierten su dinero en tejido. Muchas siguen elaborando bellas blusas típicas llamadas huipiles. Asimismo, ellas también elaboran usando la misma técnica servilletas, caminos de mesa, entre otras cositas para el interior de las casas. Otro grupo de mujeres utilizan el crédito para criar animales y luego venderlos en el mercado. Este es un buen negocio en las área rurales en donde grandes empresas, dentro de esta industria, todavía no entran al mercado.

En este grupo se puede encontrar varias empresarias destacadas. Por ejemplo Doña Candelaria H. contó que ella estaba actualmente contratando a tres mujeres para que tejan cortes, una falda tradicional, y una mujer para que teja servilletas. Doña Albina Yiax comentó que ella criaba pollos y que las eses fecales son utilizadas para abonar su milpa o cosecha de maíz.

Entrevistar a este grupo de mujeres fue un placer y a la misma vez una linda hazaña porque son personas luchadoras y que a pesar de su difícil situación ellas mantienen una bella sonrisa. Es por eso ,que se les tiene que apoyar.

loans.use: Purchase fabric to make traditional outfits, and investing in the necessities for raising livestock.

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phun H. and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Phun is a widow with four children, two sons and two daughters, all of whom attend school in their village. Her daughters weave silk when they are free from school.

Mrs. Phun has been sewing mosquito nets for over twenty years. She hopes to continue to expand her business so she can support her children’s studies to the highest possible level. She is requesting this, her second loan, in the amount of $600, in order to buy thread and silk material for weaving and to set up a loom for her daughters.

loans.use: To purchase thread, silk material, and a loom for weaving.

loans.name: Paulina Nantongo`s Group

texts.en:
Paulina is the leader of a group of five women. She is 32 years old and married with 3 children, ages 5 months, 10 years, and 14 years. Her two eldest children are in school, the youngest is an infant. She lives in an urban community which is highly susceptible to floods during the rainy season.

Paulina has been selling shoes in the market near her home six days a week, Monday through Saturday for the past five years. Her market for shoes is fair. The biggest challenge is few customers. She has been able to augment her shoe business by also selling soda, water, and passion fruit.

Paulina plans on using this loan to increase her stock of shoes and drinks. She hopes to one day be able to buy a plot and build a house.

Paulina has successfully paid back 10 loans.

loans.use: Increase stock of shoes and drinks

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene breeds cattle and later on sells the milk to a company called PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) Andina.

He also works as a construction worker in his hometown, he lives in the community of Chijipina Chico, in the province of Omasuyos (3 hours away from La Paz).

Rene is married and has three children (ages 12, 16 and 18). This is the second loan he requests to Impro and the loan evaluation that was realized qualifies him to receive the loan. Rene will use the loan to buy better cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Rene se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, su producción de de leche es vendida a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche).

Asimismo, se dedica a la albañilería en el pueblo donde vive (comunidad Chijipina Chico de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.)

Tiene una esposa y 3 hijos de 18,16 y 12 años de edad respectivamente.

El crédito será usado para comprar ganado de raza mejorada.

Este es su segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: COMPRA DE GANADO VACUNO

loans.name: Eam

texts.en:
Eam H., 64, is a rice farmer who lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1980, she and her husband, Tim Pet, have been growing rice to earn a living and are able to make around $1 of profit per day. 

This couple has nine children and they live with one of their children. All the children who no longer stay at home are employed at different jobs.

Mrs. Eam would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, of $1,000 to plant rubber trees.

loans.use: She wants to plant rubber trees.

loans.name: Bossa

texts.fr:
Née le 31 décembre 1974 à Bassar au Nord ouest du Togo, madame S. Bossa est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a pour activité principale, la vente charbon de bois et d’ignames dans l’un des marchés locaux de Lomé. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2005 et dispose des clients ont qui elle livre sa marchandise après son retour du lieu d’approvisionnement. Avec le reste de son stock elle procède à la vente par exposition au marché. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé.
Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite de faire l’approvisionnement par l’achat de 400 tubercules et 6 sacs de charbon de bois.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1974 in Bassar in northwest Togo, Bossa S. is married and the mother of three children. Her main field of endeavor is the sale of charcoal and yams in Lome’s local markets. She started this business in 2005 and has a clientele to whom she delivers merchandise upon returning from buying trips. She puts any remaining inventory up for sale, displaying it at the marketplace. Bossa has already received and successfully repaid her first loan, and now requests a second loan to increase her inventory by purchasing 400 yams and six bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yams and charcoal

loans.name: Mana

texts.fr: Mana S. achète et revend depuis 3 ans en détail des pagnes à Kpalimé au Togo. C’est un commerce très florissant ; Elle souhaite par ce second crédit acheter de nouveaux pagnes pouvant répondre à l’attente de sa clientèle qui devient de plus en plus exigeante. Les profits tirés de son activité lui permettront de faire face à ses soucis financiers et de répondre aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Mana S. has been retailing "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African-print cloth) for three years in Kpalimé in Togo. It is a flourishing business. With this second loan she wants to buy new "pagnes" that meet the expectations of her clientele who are becoming more and more demanding. The income from this business allows her to face up to her financial problems and meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Bokk Kholl 2 Group

texts.fr: L'écovillage de Mboumbaye est situé dans la région de Saint Louis à 300 km de Dakar. La  Population de gandiol s'estime à 13968 habitants. Les principales activités économiques dans la zone sont : le commerce, la pêche, le maraichage, l'élevage et l'extraction du sel. Cependant du fait de la péjoration climatique et des phénomènes anthropiques, le niveau de dégradation et de désorganisation est ressenti par sa communauté entière. Les femmes du groupement ayant bénéficié d'un premier prêt qui leur avait permis de réaliser leurs rêves reviennent auprès de Kiva pour solliciter un renouvellement. Le groupe Bokk kholl 2 compte faire de l'élevage de poulets de chair, de vente de poissons frais, des fruits et légumes et aussi de la vente d'habillement pour femmes.
texts.en:
The ecovillage of Mboumbaye is located in the Saint Louis region 300 km from Dakar. The population of Gandiol is about 13,968 inhabitants. The principal economic activities in the area are: commerce, fishing, truck farming, farming and extracting salt. However, due to the climatic decline and anthropogenic phenomena, the level of decline and disruption is felt by the entire community. The women of the group, having benefited from a first loan which allowed them to realize their dreams, are coming back to Kiva to seek a renewal. The group Bokk Kholl 2 plans to raise chickens, as well as sell fresh fish, fruits and vegetables, and women’s clothing.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fish, fruits and vegetables; to raise poultry; to sell clothes

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: La Sr. Ana tiene 47 años de edad, habita en el barrio primavera, estado en la capital de Managua, es madre  soltera con dos hijos de 20 y 23 años de edad que están trabajando, Los planes para su familia es terminar la construir   su casa. Doña Ana tiene un pequeño negocio una comediría desde hace cinco años desde horas muy tempranos tiene abierto su comedor para aprovechar a sus clientes con el desayuno, trabaja de esa forma y así a logrado que sus hijos salgan a delante en la vida, lo inicio con financiamiento. Con esta solicitud de préstamo  quiere remodelar su negocio, va hacer un bajarete y embaldosar, para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Así como comprar materia prima para seguir elaborando ricos y variados platillos. A largo plazo espera captar mas clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Ana is 47 years old, and lives in a neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is a single mom with two children who are 20 and 23 years old, and who also work. The plan for her family is to finish building their house. Doña Ana has had a small business eatery for five years. She opens her diner very early in the morning to to take advantage of its breakfast clients, and has worked in this manner with her children in order to manage to get through life. She began her business with a loan. With this loan request she wants to remodel her business, including tiling, and building a porch in order to improve her service to her clients. She is also going to buy commodities to continue baking a rich variety of dishes. In the long term, she expects to attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer bajarete y embaldozar

loans.name: Zamin

texts.en: Zamin F. is a young, energetic man. At the early age of 17, he started his own business in order to support his parents. His business is selling food products such as eggs, soft drinks, and so on in the southern city of Azerbaijan. His store is located next to his house so he is always near his parents. This business allows him not only to support his family, but also to continue his University education. Zamin needs to increase the variety of goods he sells and is asking for a loan of US $1,200 with a term of 15 months. This loan will allow him to expand his business and earn more income. This loan will be important to the growth of Zamin’s business.

loans.use: To purchase food products to sell, such as tea, sugar, and butter

loans.name: Salman

texts.en:
Salman S., 45, is a farmer, not only devoted to his work but also to being the father of a family consisting of his wife, 2 sons, and his elderly parents. He works hard raising cattle, which he has taken out to graze in the early mornings since 1998. Without a doubt it is not an easy task, but the love for his family gives his work reason and meaning.

Salman also has a car and uses it as a taxi to take people from his village to the city. But the main source of income in his family is still calf-breeding. Currently, Salman wants to improve his situation by increasing the number of his cattle which in the long run will provide better income. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1200 USD to purchase two calves. If you support him, he will be forever grateful.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Naziran Bashir Ahmad Group
loans.use: To repair auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicles).

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.en:
A. Abdukarim is a young married man with two kids, aged 3 and 1 and a half. Faced with high unemployment in his country, it proved very hard for him to find a job and he thus he started his own business of selling teenagers' clothes and hats. Fortunately, he made good sales and his business is growing thanks to the quality of his products and the good service he provides. Abdukarim now needs a $ 2500 USD loan which he will use to buy goods to respond to his customers’ demand. He promises to repay this loan in 12 months. Abdukarim is very thankful to you for helping him improve his service and the quality of life of his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new hats and T-shirts

loans.name: Hala Group

texts.en:
The group name is Hala; it is made of three ladies, who are living in the region of the Bekaa, Lebanon.

Rana is a 30 year old married woman with two children. Rana has been selling accessories from her home for two years. She requested a loan of 300 U.S. dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work. This is the first time that Rana has requested a loan.

Rana is speciA. in her work because she sells nice accessories. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had financiA. issues. Rana started her business because she wanted to work and supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her work.

Rajaa is a 43 year old married woman. She has been selling shoes for four years. Rajaa requested a loan of 300 U.S. dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her business. This is the first time that Rajaa has requested a loan.

Rajaa is speciA. in her work because she likes what she does and knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the startup capitA.. Rajaa chose her business because she has experience. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

Hala is a 40 year old married woman. She has owned an accessory shop for four years. Hala requested a loan of 300 U.S. dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work. This is the first time that Hala has requested a loan.

Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When Hala first started her business, she didn’t have the startup capitA.. She chose her business because of her experience. In the future, Hala plans on expanding her business.

About Group Loans:
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individuA. loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Samoa

texts.en: Samoa P., 64, is married and has 10 children.  She has 10 years of experience in the vegetable business. She sells to the village community & to the general public 3 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Samoan Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Samoa’s only access to capital as she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds (cucumber, cabbages, pumpkin), gloves, a rake and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Ivetti

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86603&_tpos=12&_tpg=2
Ivetti estudio corte y confección, y trabajo por años en un taller, hasta que decidió poner en su casa un taller de confección, ella hace ropa sobre medida y recibe  cose para algunas empresas.
Ivetti necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para invertirlos en la compra de  tela, para confección de prendas de vestir. 
Desde que Ivetti está en Finca  aprendió a ahorrar, a ser puntual con los préstamos y ser puntual con las clientas.
El sueño de Ivetti es tener una boutique de ropa, hecha por hecha.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86603&_tpos=12&_tpg=2 Ivetti has studied dressmaking; she worked many years for a workshop before deciding to open her own dress shop in her home. She makes custom-tailored clothing and works as a seamstress for some businesses.She needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy cloth for making garments. Since Ivetti became a part of FINCA she has learned to save and to be punctual with both her loans and her clients. Her dream is to eventually own a clothing boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth in order to make garments

loans.name: Adot

texts.en:
Adot P. sells beer at home and is requesting a loan to open up a bar at the market to increase her sales. Adot is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a security guard. She has three children, who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bar.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar T. A. y su esposa la señora  Eva Luna tiene un hijo para el cual quieren lo mejor.
      A la vivienda le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor de ella pero por el momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora.
     Es por eso que están solicitando un crédito, ya que están preocupados cunado el niño sale a jugar no tiene seguridad. Planea pagar el préstamo con el ingreso que genera de su trabajo como chofer de un camión.
