(En la foto aparece la esposa la señora Eva Luna ya que el señor Oscar T. se encuentra se encontraba en su trabajo).
texts.en:
Oscar T. A. and his wife, Eva Luna, have a son for whom they want the best. Their house needs a wall around it. They do not currently have the money to buy the material and pay a person to make the improvement. That is why they are asking for a loan. They worry when their son goes to play and they do not have security. They plan to repay the loan with the income generated from his work as a bus driver. (Eva Luna, Oscar T.’ wife, appears in the photo because he was working at the time the photo was taken.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall around their house

loans.name: Manlikova  Ivanova

texts.es: Manlikova Ivanova M. M. de 27 años de edad reside en el municipio de Cojutepeque ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Manlikova vive con su madre, su esposo y su hijo de 3 años de edad, Manlikova posee una tienda ubicada en su casa con diversos productos de consumo, la tienda es atendida por ella y su madre Doña Sara; ya que Manlikova trabaja también como profesora de Computación en una escuela y recibe un salario mensual de 200$. El crédito que Manlikova solicita es para surtir su negocio el cual tiene ya diez años a flote y quiere seguir creciendo en su volumen de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Manlikova Ivanova M. M. is 27 years old and lives in the county of Cojutepeque which is located in the district of Cuscatlan. Monlikova lives with her mother, her husband and their 3 year old son. Malikova has a store in her house which sells various consumer products. The store is looked after by her and her mother, Doña Sara, as Manlikova also works as an IT teacher in a school and receives a monthly salary of $200. Manlikova would like a loan to stock her business which has been going for ten years as she wants the amount of products she is able to offer her clients to keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business/Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Isabela

texts.en:
Isabela is a member of the Upendo borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 48-year-old woman, married, and a mother of 7 children. Her children are ages 30, 24, 22, 18, 16, and 14. She also cares for 2 other dependents.

Isabela started her own clothing business, selling clothes like trousers, 5 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 50,000 Tanzania schillings.

This is Isabela’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Isabela hopes to get more food for her family, save money, and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Maribel Zonia

texts.en:
Maribel is 28 years old and is married with one child. She works together with her mother buying and selling regional farm products such as chickens, plantains, grains and beans. Maribel’s husband is a chef. Maribel and her family live in the city of Pucallpa.

Maribel has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Dalinas II.” She used her very first loan of 300 soles to invest in bakery products. With this loan of 2500 soles, Maribel will purchase farm products such as hens, plantains and beans. Since she first began receiving loans from Manuela Ramos, Maribel has worked with her mother purchasing and selling such farm products in Pucallpa’s port. (Pucallpa is located on the Ucayali, the wide brown river that flows past the city and eventually joins the Amazon to the north. Many small agricultural communities line the banks of the Ucayali.) Maribel is pleased to have her own business because it has enabled her to increase the earnings of her household and to support her husband and son. Maribel’s goal is to build a home for her family and to have a small home-based grocery shop.

loans.use: Hens, plantains and beans for sale.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en: Tatyana is married with one daughter. She sells dishes and cups at a small open market. Her income is about 3,000 UAH per month. Tatyana has been in this busies for 14 years. Large experience helps her to choose the right kind of inventories that will sell well. This helped Tatyana to get free shipping from her suppliers. Tatyana's business goal is to get a larger kiosk and develop her business further. Tatyana would like to borrow 15,500 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventories.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo, Salvador de 50 años, y sus 2 hijos: Juan de 18 y Frank de 14 años de edad. Hace 5 años decidió emprender un negocio que pudiera realizar en su hogar y que le permitiera cuidar de sus hijos, los cuales estaban en edad escolar y necesitaban de su ayuda. Es por ello que aprovechando el gran espacio que tenía en su casa puso una cochera, la cual hoy en día alberga de 6 a 7 autos. Su negocio es rentable y no necesita de mucho tiempo, es por ello que le resulta muy cómodo, aunque últimamente María está pensado realizar otro tipo de negocio paralelo, como es la venta de productos de medicina natural a domicilio, lo que realizará en sus ratos libres. Su objetivo es reunir dinero para implementar una librería en el espacio que ahora usa como cochera, ella sabe que aún falta mucho para ello, pero no pierde las esperanzas de hacerlo pronto una realidad. 
Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, ella y su grupo siempre se han caracterizado por ser muy responsables y puntuales en sus pagos y eso es algo que a María le agrada mucho. Con el dinero que solicita comprará productos de medicina natural para empezar a distribuir y vender a domicilio.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old. She lives with her husband, Salvador, who is 50, and their two sons, Juan, 18, and Frank, 14. Five years ago, she decided to start a business which she would be able to operate at home, allowing her to take care of her children, who were school aged and needed her help. As a result, she took advantage of the large space available in her home and established a car parking facility, which currently has room for 6 or 7 cars. Her business is profitable and does not take much time, which is very convenient for her. However, María has recently been thinking about starting another type of business parallel to her current one, such as the sale of natural health products to customers in their homes, which she will undertake in her spare time. Her goal is to save enough money to open a bookstore in the space that she is now using as a garage. She knows that she still has a long way to go toward this goal, but she will not give up her hope of making it a reality soon. This is María's ninth loan with MFP. She and her group have always shown themselves to be very responsible and punctual in their payments, and this is something that makes María very happy. With the funds she is requesting, she will purchase natural health products so that she can begin selling and distributing them to customers in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital for her new business

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Hardwork and dedication are the keys to success according to Florentina S., 48 years old, who has continuously improved her living through her own efforts.

She is married to Jose Jerry S. who is presently engaged in fish vending together with his wife. They have 3 children, the oldest of whom is 21 and the youngest of whom is just 9 years old. The family lives in the village of Prk. Balinghoy, Brgy. Malingin Bago City Negros Occidental.

Florentina grew up in a very poor family. Her parents could not afford to send their children to school, but she strived hard to support herself and get a proper education by selling fish with her parents to different barangays (villages).

When she got married, she, together with her husband, continued selling fish in her community, neighboring barangays and nearby towns. Because they sold good quality fish, they soon had regular customers in every place they went, selling all their stocks much faster.

But even with the ongoing business, they were starting to worry that they might not be able to save enough to send their children to college later on. This propelled Florentina to join NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could expand her business and be able to buy more fish to sell. Now she earns an average profit of PHP 10,000 per month, good enough to support their family with enough left over to save for her children's higher education.

For her previous 9th cycle loan she borrowed Php 15,000 for her business. She was able to repay her loan on time without any delays. She planned to borrow for her 10th cycle loan the same amount of Php 15,000 that she intends to use in her fish vending business. She plans to expand her business. If there is any extra income, she plans to put up a general store and the rest will be saved for children future.

About Kiva's partner NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending

loans.name: Fataou

texts.fr: Pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoins,  ce monsieur s’est lancé dans la vente de produits pharmaceutiques. Ce commerce lui réussit bien et il s’approvisionne au Ghana, cela lui permet de  vendre à un prix  abordable et de cette façon de vendre plus. Faisant face à une réduction de son stock, il sollicite un crédit pour acheter 2 cartons de QUINIMAX, 3 cartons de sérum, 3 cartons de perfuseurs.
texts.en:
To be able to provide for his own needs, this man launched himself in the sale of pharmaceutical products. This business succeeds well for him. He supplies himself in Ghana, which allows him to sell at a reasonable price and in this manner to sell more. Facing a reduction of his stock, he requests a loan to buy 2 boxes of QUINIMAX (an anti-malarial drug), 3 boxes of serum, and 3 boxes of intravenous drip lines.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical products for resale

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio G. is from the village of Panalsalan Plaridel Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old. Rogelio is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Rogelio owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. Rogelio has been in business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rogelio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand his product offerings. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rogelio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand his product offerings

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina A. is currently in the business of selling beer at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Lina is 25 years old and is married with a husband that is a business man. She has 3 children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to settle down in.

loans.use: stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Nkodo V Evas Eyebasibwe Group

texts.en:
Evas E. is a twenty-six-year-old businesswoman. She lives with her spouse, who is the loan group representative. They are blessed with three children, two of whom go to school, and also care for two dependents, who are in school. 

Evas sells spare parts. She has been involved in this business for over six years. She is using the loan to purchase spare parts to sell. She is a hard-working business woman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Supplying her store with merchandise

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert W. is a 31-year-old married father of two children. They live in Likoni, Mombasa where Robert operates a pharmaceutical shop. Robert has been in the pharmacy industry for four years now and his business has been a success.

Robert is currently accessing his first KADET loan and plans to purchase more medicine stock and to do some renovations in the shop. His customers are mainly the surrounding households, who enjoy his services.

He hopes to open more pharmacies in other parts of the coastal city of Mombasa in future.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine stock and to do some renovations in the pharmacy

loans.name: Rodney

texts.en:
Rodney C. is from the village of Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 27 years old. Rodney is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rodney owns and operates a service-based business providing motorcycle repairs in his shop to local community members. Rodney has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $142 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Rodney joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Rodney has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide his repair services. Rodney is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for his business. This will be his 2nd loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for his business

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita es una mujer amante a las caminatas, tiene 55 años y es madre D. 4 hijos. Vive con su esposo y dos D. sus hijos en una modesta, pero acogedora casa en una zona al sur D. L. ciudad D. Lima.

DesD. hace 3 años se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza D. dos líneas muy reconocidas en el mercado. Adicionalmente venD. algunas golosinas y bebidas en un espacio que acondicionó en su vivienda. Pero su inclinación es por los cosméticos, así tenga que caminar largas horas en busca D. sus clientes, por lo que cada vez que tiene que repartir sus productos cierra su negocio D. dulces, pues D. lo contrario sus nietos se comen las golosinas.
Felicita está muy contenta con su actividad porque ha conocido a mucha gente, y se ha hecho D. una larga lista D. clientes regulares.
Es por ello, que para el futuro quiere comprar vitrinas para exhibir sus productos y otros accesorios D. belleza, en el mismo espacio donD. venD. sus dulces.

Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, y así como hasta ahora ha sido responsable en sus pagos, promete seguir siéndolo. En su grupo si siente a gusto porque son pocas personas y se conocen muy bien, sobre todo porque tienen muchas cosas en común. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en el incrementó D. sus productos D. belleza, además D. comprar más golosinas para seguir obteniendo ganancias con ambos negocios.
texts.en:
Felicita is a women who loves to go for walks. She is 55 and has four children. She lives with her husband and two of her children in a modest, but cozy house on the south siD. of Lima. For three years she has worked selling cosmetics for two well-known companies. Additionally, she sells snacks and drinks in a small space she has arranged in her house. However, she prefers to sell cosmetics, so she has to walk for long hours looking for clients. Every time she goes to deliver her products she closes her shop because otherwise her grandchildren eating the snacks. Felicita is very happy with her job because she has met many people and has built up a long list of regular clients. In the future, she wants to buy display cases to show her products and other accessories in the same space where she sells her sweets. This is her sixth loan with MFP and to date has been responsible with her payments and is promises to continue to do so. In her group she feels very happy because it is a small group, they know each other well, and they have a lot of thing in common. She will invest the money she is applying for to purchase beauty products and snacks in order to continue earning money from both businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new merchandise

loans.name: Chori

texts.ru: Пайгамов Чори проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Клиент не имеет высшего образования. Подрабатывает строительными работами по найму. Кроме того занимается растениеводством. Он в основном сажает пшеницу и оващи. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 6 лет. Урожай который он получает, вывозит на рынок. А часть оставляет своей семье. Сейчас посевной сезон и клиент планирует купить качественные семена. Это поможет ему получить хороший урожай, что привлечет новых клиентов. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en:
Chori P. lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 56 years old. He is married, with six children. He does not have a higher education. He earns some money as a construction worker for hire. In addition, he cultivates crops, mainly wheat and vegetables. He has been growing crops for over six years. Some of the produce is for consumption by his family, and the rest is sold at the market. It is now planting season and he is planning to purchase high quality seeds. This will help him achieve a plentiful harvest and attract new clients. He is applying for a loan to purchase seeds.

Translated from Russian by Irina Chakraborty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng R., 51, is a resident of Siem Reap, the province of Cambodia, where she has established a small family home and lives with other family members. She is married to Leng Khon, 52, and has five children. Three of her children are married and employed while the remaining two are single and require her financial support. 

Her husband owns a small business fishing fish in and around the river. Seng R. sells fresh fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing and from other fishermen. Recently her husband's catch has frequently suffered from some tools having been ruined. Seng R. would like a loan for her husband to repair his broken tools, as well as to buy new essential accessories for his fishing trade.

loans.use: Repair existing and purchase new fishing equipment

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Sajida wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen wants a loan to buy material (betel nuts, betel leaves) for her Pan Shop. (Pan is an Urdu word used for betel leaves in Pakistan.) Asia wants a loan to buy plastic baby toys for her toy-selling business. Shahnaz is the group leader of the afore-mentioned ladies. They all come from a city called Lahore, famous in Pakistan for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

Shahnaz is a 43-year-old woman. She is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses due to lack of financial resources. She has a two-room brick house in which she has been living with her family for the past 22 years. She has given birth to three children: two boys and one daughter. Her sons work in a gas station on monthly wage.  Her daughter is 16 years old and reads in 9th standard.  Her husband's name is S. A. and he is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

Shahnaz is a very hard-working lady. She does embroidery on different items such as tablecloths and pillow covers and sells her embroidery at the market. She does this work to supplement their income. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw because it’s creating a problem and if it isn’t repaired soon the chances are its engine might seize up which would be a great loss. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Shahnaz is seated second from left holding a piece of embroidered cloth.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Aurora Elena

texts.es: La señora Aurora posee un negocio que es la venta de granos básicos ubicada en su casa de habitación, sus compras las realiza de compra do y sus ventas de contado y al crédito. Por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar ya que ha demostrado ser una mujer muy responsable por pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Además  de su negocio la señora venden cosméticos para a si ayudarse con los gastos de su hogar, su esposo trabaja como sastre brindándole un poco de ayuda a su familia. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es brindar el mejor servicio necesario.
texts.en:
Aurora’s business is selling basic grains from her home. She purchases her goods and then sells for cash or on credit. She has always enjoyed working, and has demonstrated that she is very reliable, in that she has paid her installments on time and correctly. In addition to this business, she sells cosmetics, to help out with household expenses. Her husband works as a tailor, which offers some help to the family. The loan is for working capital to buy stock. Her goal is to offer the best service required.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Iem

texts.en:
Iem P., 26, is married and lives with two young children in the Siem Reap province. Working a farm together with her husband, Iem P. typically makes $1.50 each day. 

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Iem P. included. In light of this economic difficulty, she is asking for a loan of $500 to expand her farmland. In order to increase her profits and possibly raise her standard of living, she would like to purchase more land to produce rice with the loan given to her through CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: Expand farmland

loans.name: Nemia's Group

texts.en:
Nemia R. is from the town of Quirino. She is 43 years old. Nemia is the leader of a 9-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nemia R. Group.

Nemia is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nemia owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Nemia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Nemia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nemia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Nemia's fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe T. is from the village of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. Fe is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children’s education. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Naim's Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people who reside in An Long Barang village in Kandal province selected Mrs. Naim C. as their village bank president. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that improve their standard of living.

Mrs. Naim C., 55 years old, is a farmer with a plot of land where she grows crops to earn a small income to support her family. Mrs. Naim C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay a farm laborer to plow her land.

Mrs. Naim C. is widow with six children; four are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is a construction worker, and one is a farmer who helps his mother with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay a laborer to plow her farm.

loans.name: Doris Agripina

texts.es:
Doris de 58 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con una ecología en reconstrucción). Ella tiene un local de carnes, comenzó con mucho esfuerzo vendiendo unas libras de carnes, hasta que pudo tener su propio local.

Ella vende carne, pollos, embutidos en su local con la ayuda de sus hijos, desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer. Como ha estado trabando desde joven no ha podido revisar su salud durante mucho años, y ahora tiene un problema en la columna, por eso con el préstamo ella quiere el préstamo para poder ir al medico. 

En el futuro quiere continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Doris, 58, lives in Perimetral, a peripheral zone of Guayaquil (an area where the ecology is being rebuilt). She has a meat shop. She started out working very hard, selling a few pounds of meat, until she was able to own her own store. From early in the morning until sunset, she sells meat, chicken, and sausages in her store with the help of her children. Because she has had to work since she was quite young, she hasn't been able to take care of her health for many years. Now she has a problem with her back. For this reason she is requesting a loan, so she can go see a doctor. Her plan for the future is to continue working on her business.

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To see a doctor

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam L., 46, is married and resides with his two children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for its garment industry. L. and his wife are farmers and grow rice, earning an income of USD 2.5 each, per day. 

L. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase fruit plant seedlings to grow for their fruit to sell. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy fruit plants to grow

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
For almost 14 years of her membership in ASHI, Miguela M. has been a model member dedicated to managing her family’s operations.
 
Miguela is 43 years old and married to Eduardo, who is 41 years old and a fisherman. She has four minor-aged children and lives in Talim Island, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is a God-fearing and courageous mother. She and her husband have helped each other to overcome the poverty that impeded their family. 

In 1996, Miguela joined Kiva partner, ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI in the Philippines, in order to acquire capital for her fishing business and embark on her bamboo set (furniture-making) business. As a member of ASHI for almost 14 years, she has a remarkably good performance in her credit rating and is therefore being trusted by ASHI to obtain larger loans. 

This loan is her ninth – she has made good use of her previous loans to expand her business and income. Miguela has applied for a new loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos to buy fishing nets, a fish cage and other supplies. The remaining money will be used in her business of making bamboo sets (furniture).

Miguela dreams of expanding her business into a full-fledged fish farm. She also dreams of sending her five children to school until they finish college and find good jobs. Until that dreams happens, she is happy with the way in which ASHI and Kiva have changed her family's life and given them a good possibility of making their dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets, a fish cage and other supplies. The remaining money will be used to make bamboo sets (furniture)

loans.name: El Aguacate (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Aguacate se encuentra formado por un grupo de 10 mujeres, quienes trabajan en diferentes actividades pero con un solo propósito que es el de salir  adelante con sus familias, viven en la comunidad del Aguacate en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, sus paisajes, su gastronomía y su gente que es calida y amable.

La Señora. Mercedes María A. vive en la comunidad del Aguacate, este es el primer crédito que realizar en la fundación, fue invitada por una amiga que era socia de otro banco comunal. Nuestra socia se dedica a la agricultura,  este  oficio aprendió de sus padres, cría  animales como: chanchos y becerros los mismos que los vende en su comunidad, cuenta con una pequeña tienda  que lleva 5 años en funcionamiento y  labora en ella desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m.
Doña Mercedes tiene de 62 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos todos son mayores de edad,  4 de ellos son casados y viven de manera independiente y solo uno es soltero que tiene 31 años de edad, es quien vive con ella y le ayuda económicamente, su esposo por su edad pasa en casa, cuentan con su casa propia la cual la construyeron en su juventud con  el trabajo y sacrifico de los dos. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, pollos y cuyes para la cría. Su meta es agrandar su tienda.

La Señora Sonia Beatriz C. vive en la comunidad del Aguacate, tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su segundo hijo estudia en la escuela, su esposo no tiene un trabajo fijo por lo labora en el trabajo que le salga en ese momento, no tienen casa propia y por el momento viven en una casa prestada en donde no pagan arriendo. 
Doña Sonia hace un mes se dedica a trabajar en una fabrica de bloques siendo su oficio el de armar los moldes, labora de lunes a sábado desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., pero su verdadera profesión es estilista la cual espera ejercer muy pronto ya que con su crédito va a comprar las herramientas para iniciar su gabinete de belleza. Su sueño es estudiar en la universidad y sacar titulo de  medico.
texts.en:
The El Aguacate community bank has 10 members, all women, who operate different businesses that they started for the purpose of helping their families get ahead. The live in the Aguacate neighborhood of Cuenca, a Peruvian city known for its beautiful architecture, its cuisine, the surrounding countryside and the warm and friendly people who live there. Sra. Mercedes María A. lives in Aguacate. This is her first loan from the foundation. She joined the community bank after a friend told her about it. Dona Mercedes makes a living from farming and raising animals, work that she learned from her parents. She raises pigs and calves and sells them locally. She has also operated a small store for 5 years and she works there from 6:00 in the morning until 7:00 in the evening. Dona Mercedes is 62 years old, married and has 5 children, four of whom are married and independent. One son, 31, is single, lives at home and helps with the family's expenses. Her husband can no longer work. The couple live in a house that they built together, at some sacrifice, when they were young. Sra. Sonia Beatriz C. also lives in Aguacate. She is 30 years old, married and has 2 children, 14- and 6-years old. Her oldest child, a girl, is in high school and her youngest child, a boy, has just started school. Her husband works at odd jobs but he doesn't have a steady income. They don't own a house so they live in one with no rent that has been loaned to them. A month ago, Dona Sonia started a job at a factory making cement blocks. She is responsible for setting up the molds for the blocks, work that she does Mondays to Saturdays from 7:00 to 5:00. She trained as a hair dresser, work that she would like to pursue, and she is applying for a loan to buy the supplies she needs to stock a salon. Her dream is to go to college and get a degree in medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for multiple businesses.

loans.name: Kem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kem Y., who was born in 1962, was selected as the village bank president by the members of this village loan. They all live in Ta Nu village, Kandal province. Each member of the loan hopes to increase their income to improve their families' living.
  
Mrs. Kem Y. and her husband, Mr. Chaem Thorn, are farmers who own 2-hectares of land that they use to cultivate rice for a living. This couple are also farmers who work very hard to support their three children, who are seamstresses in a garment factory. In order to support the farming crop, Mrs. Kem Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay for farm laborers to cultivate the rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and to pay for farm laborers to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
M. Benson is a 41-year-old married father of seven boisterous school children. To shoulder his responsibility of providing for them, he has over the period of the last 15 years been operating a consumable items retail shop in Muhorro Trading centre, Kyenjojo alongside produce business with sales made out of groundnuts, maize and more. His business has not been without setbacks; since its beginning, he has had to bear with a myriad number of challenges, such as the lack of steady income inflows. However, his business has remained active because of his hard-working traits and good customer relations. This principally he attributes to the good working chord he has struck with his clientele.

In a month, Benson says he makes 300,000 Ugandan shillings, a figure he admits will substantively make his business see the light of near future. He is therefore seeking a loan to lend countenance to his business so that he is able to do restocking for his shop as he looks at substantial growth.

loans.use: For business restocking

loans.name: Ganmyagmar

texts.en: Mrs.Ganmyagmar is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter sews in a clothing factory and her son is in secondary school. She has two more children who are grown and live separately. Her husband works as a butcher in the local food market. Between 2005 and 2009, Mrs. Ganmyagmar used to rent a small space inside the local grocery shop to sell a variety of products. But the owner of the shop sold it so she had to change her business location and profile accordingly. At the moment she rents a stall inside the market in one of the busiest and most crowded areas of the city, selling clothes. She said that her new business has more competitors, but is still giving a better return then the older one. Since 2005, when she started her retail business, she has bought a minivan for her family and also obtained a license to own a piece of land. Her future plan is to build a house on her land. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her working capital and inventory in her business.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and inventory

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma B. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Bangon, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Ramon, who is 55 years old, works as a driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 18 and 31 years old. Wilma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Wilma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use to buy stock of goods to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Wilma B. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Paul Kimani

texts.en:
Paul has been in the  motorcycle  transport in Naivasha town since  the year 2008, and earns a good income.  He is 37 years old, married to Margaret Muthoni, and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy new tyres, renew his PSV license, and buy a helmet for his passengers.

In future, Paul hopes to buy a minibus to operate in transporting people from one place to another.

loans.use: To buy new tyres, renew his PSV license, and buy a helmet for his passengers

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married with two young children. He is a small businessman from Vinogradovo. Yuryi offers transportation services. He launched this enterprise 8 years ago. He purchased a car for 40,000 Grivnyas and started working as a taxi driver. Ever since then, his pricing policy has remained reasonable and affordable thus attracting a number of clients. Currently, Yuryi makes about 8,000 Grivnyas a month. His profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas.   

Yuryi is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to receive his vehicle service record and do major repairs on his vehicle. He enjoys owning his business and believes he could never exchange being self-employed for any other job. One of Yuryi’s future plans is to put aside enough savings to be able to afford buying a newer car.

loans.use: to do major repairs on his vehicle

loans.name: Yok

texts.en: Yok T. is a 47-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Tom Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Her husband assists her in the farming business. The couple have five children, all of whom are single. Yok T. now has one son who is no longer in school and is unemployed. She wants her son to have an occupation as a motor-taxi driver. Due to her lack of capital, Yok T. has decided to ask for a loan on Kiva to be used to buy a motorcycle for her son to begin running a taxi service.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son to begin running a taxi service.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Los Andes.

Encontramos a la señora Mariana, Está desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos, tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija de 18 años de edad que estudia el segundo semestre en la universidad. Ella aprendió corte y confección en un centro de enseñanza.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a  confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00.
 
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos botones y otros materiales para la costura. Su sueño es tener un taller más grande y bien implementado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 'Los Andes' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo which has been known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet Mariana.  She has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it because the interest rates are low.  She is 60 years old and a single mother with an 18 year-old daughter who is in her second semester at university.  Mariana learned dressmaking in an educational center.

Mariana has a small dressmaking workshop where she has been making all kinds of clothes for many years.  She works on orders from individuals and also makes uniforms for institutions, elementary schools and high schools in the area.  She works every day from 6.00am until 10.00pm.

Mariana will use her new loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other dressmaking materials.  Her dream is to have a bigger, well-equipped workshop.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Elena; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de joyas,productos de belleza y ropa,ella vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones y publico en general,la socia quiere tener una tienda donde pueda vender la ropa,los cosméticos y joyas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa,joyas y productos de belleza.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Elena belongs to the “Buena Esperanza” (Good Hope) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

Maria Elena is 54 years old, married, and she has five children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling jewelry, beauty products, and clothes.  She sells independently by going to different places like institutions and taking her products to the general public.  

She wants to have a store where she could sell clothes, cosmetics, and jewelry.  She is requesting the loan to buy clothes, jewelry, and beauty products.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy clothes, jewelry, and beauty products

loans.name: Eid

texts.en:
Eid S. is a 29-year-old man from Bethlehem City who runs a grocery store in the city in partnership with another man from Bethlehem. Eid hopes to own the grocery store.  Therefore, he works constantly to increase the business' returns.  In addition to his work at the grocery store, Eid installs electricity networks for new houses and saves the money to buy all the shares of the store.

Eid came to Kiva partner FATEN to request a loan to purchase a larger variety of goods to sell in the store.  The new items would be additional to the wide range of items he currently sells.

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of goods to sell in the store

loans.name: Liny

texts.en:
Liny G. is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: an oyster business and a general store. 

She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her oyster and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. 

Liny  is  borrowing PHP 13,000 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Liny  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: El Milagro 1 Group

texts.es:
Grupo El "MILAGRO 1" se llama asi por que el grupo se formo de milagro ya que no se acompletaba el grupo invitaban a otras personas y algunas decian que si y despues que no, es por ello que al final si se acompleto. Este grupo esta formado por 10 mujeres que se dedican al comercio. Este grupo esta ubicado en la comunidad de Villa de Tututepec de Melchor Ocampo significa “Cerro del Pájaro”, de tototl, “pájaro” y Tepetl, “cerro” en el cual la mayoria de las personas que habitan este lugar son indigenas.
La representante de este grupo es la señora Balbina A. G. de 39 años esta casada con el señor Melquiades Lopez ambos tienen 2 hijos de 15 y 13 años los dos estudian la secundaria, la señora Balbina se dedica a la reposteria de pastel y pan.
La señora Rosa Elia G. M. de 42 años vive en union libre con el señor Armando Mata, la señora Rosa tiene 4 hijos de las respectivas edades 23, 21, 18 y 17 años los cuales estudian.
La señora Rosa se dedica a la venta de tortillas de mano ella elabora estos productos desde hace 30 años ya que sus mamá le enseño desde pequeña pero los vende desde hace 15años, sus ventas las realiza en su casa para que la gente valla a comprarlas los anuncian en una bocina, tiene muchos clientes ya que sus productos las da un buen precio y como son muy ricas pues la gente los compra muy bien.
Ella solicito el prestamo para poder comprar maiz, leña para la elaboracion de las tortillas y con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta es para la educacion  de sus hijos ya que ella quiere que sus hijos estudien aunque sea hasta la prepa y tengan un mejor futuro, de igual manera para poder realizar sus pagos.
Ella agradece infinitamente porque le hiiceron el prestamo que solicito y por confiar en personas humildes como ellas.
Las integrantes de este grupo son las siguientes:
Tomasa J. S.: De 39 años de edad se dedica a la compra y venta de gallinas y huevos.
Faustina Jovita H. X: De 79 años de edad se dedica a la compra de abarrotes para la venta.
Gloria F. H.: De 62 años de edad se dedica a la venta de comida y refrescos.
Maria Dolores C.: De 62 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pescado, mariscos para la venta.
Rosa Elia G. M.: De 42 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas de mano.
Balbina A. G.: De 39 años de edad se dedica a la compra ala reposteria de pastel y pan.
Guadalupe H. N.: De 47 años de edad se dedica a la venta de pan y tamales.
Jovita G. E.: De 45 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas
Eustolia B. J.: De 68 años de edad se dedica a la venta de atole y tortillas
Silvia L. H.: De 31 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tamales.
texts.en:
The “EL MILAGRO 1” group is called thus because it was a miracle that the group formed at all because they didn’t have enough people for the group; they’d invite others to join and they’d say yes but then change their minds and say no but it was formed at last.  The group has ten women who are merchants.  The group is located in the community of Villa de Tututepec de Melchor Ocampo.  It means “Hill of the Bird” from tototl, “bird” and tepetl “hill.”  Most of the residents of this place are indigenous.

The group representative is Mrs. Balvina A. García, 39.  She’s married to Mr. Melquiades Lopez.  They have two children who are 15 and 13 years of age.  Both go to middle school.  Balbina is a cake and bread and pastry maker.

Mrs. Rosa Elia García M., 42, is in an unmarried relationship with Mr. Armando Mata.  She has four children who are 23, 21, 18 and 17 years of age and all are studying.

Rosa sells handmade tortillas.  She’s been in this line of work for 30 years since she learned from her mother while still a little girl.  She’s been selling them for the last 15 years, though.  She sells from home and so that people will come by to buy them she advertises over a loudspeaker.  She has many customers because she sells her product at a very good price and because they are delicious so people buy them well.

She requested the loan to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas.  She will use the profits obtained from the sales for her children’s education because she wants them to continue in school, at least through high school, and have a better future.  She also wants to be able to make her payments.

She is infinitely grateful because she got the loan she requested and because humble people like her are trusted.

Following are the group members:

Tomasa J. S., 39, who sells chickens and eggs.
Faustina Jovita H. X, 79, who buys groceries to sell.
Gloria F. H., 62, who sells food and beverages.
Maria Dolores C., 62, who buys fish and seafood to sell.
Rosa Elia G. M., 42, who sells handmade tortillas.
Balbina A. G., 39, who sells cakes and bread.
Guadalupe H. N., 47, who sells bread and tamales.
Jovita G. E., 45, who sells tortillas.
Eustolia B. J., 68, who sells atole and tortillas.
Silvia L. H., 31, who sells tortillas and tamales.

loans.use: To buy cake, bread and fast food making ingredients.

location.town: Villa de Melchor Ocampo, Tututepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a young man from Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Rani started a mobile phone store one year ago. He sells mobile phones and phone accessories. The store is still new but attracts a good number of customers; therefore, Rani took out a loan from FATEN to purchase more phones and increase his sales.

Rani is photographed in the picture here in his store in Rafah.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones to increase sales

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BARRIO LINDO” iniciará un nuevo proceso en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por  nueve integrantes, las que están dirigidas por una mesa directiva que tiene como presidenta la señora Virginia.

La señora Virginia, indica que es su segundo ciclo de trabajo en la A.C. “Barrio Lindo”.  Este ciclo piensa aumentar su producción de rellenos de papa y patitas, ya que con el préstamo comprará insumos (aceite, papa, verduras, etc.) para su negocio de elaboración de rellenos; los que son vendidos los días martes y viernes, todo el día, en un puesto fijo que se encuentra en la cuidad de El Alto, específicamente en la Ex tranca de Rio Seco. Esta forma de trabajo le ayuda apoyar a su familia ya que ella es casada y aporta económicamente a su hogar.

Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados: Tienda de barrio, venta de rellenos, costura de enaguas, tejido de manta, artesanía, artesanías en plástico, tejido de vicuña y venta de comida. 

Se observa en la foto un grupo de mujeres que muestran algo de sorpresa  por nuestra visita; durante la reunión manifestaron el deseo de mejorar.
texts.en:
The 'Barrio Lindo' (Beautiful Neighborhood) community bank is starting a new cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional office.  The bank has nine members and is managed by a board of directors whose president is Virginia.

Virginia indicates to us that this is her second cycle with the 'Barrio Lindo' community bank.  This cycle she is planning to increase her production of 'rellenos de papa' (meat-stuffed potatoes) and 'rellenos de patitas'.  She will use her loan to buy supplies (oil, potatoes, vegetables, etc.) for her business preparing 'rellenos'.  She sells her products all day Tuesdays and Fridays, from a fixed sales location in the city of El Alto, specifically in Ex-Tranca de Rio Seco.  Virginia's work helps her to support her family since she is married and financially supports her household.

The businesses that the members of this community bank are engaged in are varied: running a neighborhood store, selling 'rellenos', sewing 'enaguas' (traditional underskirts), knitting blankets, creating handicrafts, creating plastic handicrafts, knitting products from vicuna wool and selling meals.

In the photo you can see a group of women who show themselves to be somewhat surprised by our visit.  During the meeting they showed a desire to improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, oil and flour

loans.name: Maricyle

texts.en:
Maricyle G. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 24 years old. Maricyle is single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she buys and sells coconuts for copras (dried coconut used for making coconut oil) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maricyle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Maricyle is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to sell

loans.name: Turbold

texts.en:
Turbold is 34 years old and lives with his wife and a son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  They  live together in a rented one-bedroom studio apartment. His family used to live in France for seven years and he worked in a scrap yard over there and has gained a lot of experience over the years. Therefore he started his own spare parts retail business last year. He is renting a stall at the “Mison”, the auto center in Ulaanbaatar city. 

Turbold purchased a small family car using his earnings. Turbold is a very hard-working and honest person who cares a lot about his family. His business is doing very well and he has his regular customers. He buys old cars and takes their spare parts out and sells them. Now it is the start of the warm season when the spare parts business gets busy, therefore he is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying an old car and some spare parts.

loans.use: to buy some spare parts and an old car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items to cook

loans.name: Khomida

texts.en:
A. Khomida is a hardworking woman who is married. Her husband is an entrepreneur. She is engaged in dried fruit trading and also in animal husbandry. Khomida has been running her business thanks to Imon International which supported her in improving her dried fruit sales. She successfully repaid her first loan. She plans to use the second one to purchase an apricot garden in Kanibadam.

From her profits she purchased milk cows. She has a barn where she keeps her four cattle. Her daughter-in-law helps her in her business. Her sons are currently working in Russia and, with the money they have been sending her, she purchased a house. This loan will help her to improve her business.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy an apricot garden

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina vive en la hermosa ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, en el barrio el Socorro donde tiene un negocio llamado “Festejarte” dedicado a la organización de fiestas infantiles, negocio que le ha servido para apoyar la gestión de su hogar conformado por su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 3 a 7 años; Ella inició con un trampolín que ubicaba en los parques de barrios, gradualmente empezó a alquilar esta infraestructura y fue comprando juegos infantiles que adicionó y que hoy ofrece el servicio en las fiestas dirigidas a niños. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará juegos de jardín para alquilar e invertirá  en volantes promocionales  para dar a conocer su negocio. Su sueño es lograr tener una casa propia  y está haciendo todos los esfuerzos en familia para lograrlo, así como llevar a que sus hijos disfruten de bienestar y principalmente que tengan una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Luz Marina lives in the neighborhood of Socorro in the beautiful city of Cartagena de Indias. She has a business called “Festejarte” which organizes children’s parties. This business has helped to support her household, which consists of her husband and three children who range in age from 3 to 7.

She started with a trampoline that she brought to the neighborhood parks. Luz gradually began renting equipment and then bought additional children’s games. Today she offers party services designed specifically for children. This Kiva loan is the first loan she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the funds to buy kindergarten games to rent out and invest in promotional leaflets to advertise her business.

Her dreams are to have her own home and devote all of her efforts for her family so that her children can experience well-being and receive a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase kindergarten games and invest in promotional leaflets.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana  D. 46 años D. edad, vive con su esposo en casa propia (cuenta sólo con  servicio D. luz) ubicada en el distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana que se desarrolla en ella.

DesD. hace unos años Juana se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, etc) y D. bebidas. Su negocio se encuentra en su misma casa. Con las ganancias obtenidas Juana trata D. cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel D. vida.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 500 nuevos soles que le permitirá comprar más mercadería, con el único ideal D. que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes y así poder cubrir su préstamo y las necesidades D. su casa.  Juana es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades para su esposo y ella.
texts.en:
Juana, 46, lives with her husband in their own house (it only has electricity) located in TambogranD. District which belongs to Piura Department.  This zone is noted for farming, raising livestock and crafts.

For a few years now Juana has sold groceries (products that are used every day like: milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, etc.) and beverages.  Her business is located in her house.  With profits obtained Juana tries to cover all her expenses and to improve her standard of living.

In order to expand the business, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan that will make it possible for her to purchase more merchandise with the sole aim of having the business grow and to have more products available for her customers and thus be able to repay the loan and cover household needs.  Juana is a responsible, dedicated, hard working person who strives to have more comforts for her husband and herself.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Raeesa's Group

texts.en:
Raeesa is 26 years old, married with three children. Two of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Her husband deals with construction supplies. He provides construction supplies such as cement, bricks and sands to his customers at reasonable rates and generates income for the family. 

Raeesa herself is a beautician as well as running a boutique business. She provides her services to her female  clients. She operates her businesses from her home and is known as an expert in her fields. Her clientele base is her community women. They prefer to approach her to buy dresses and for getting beauty services.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of both her businesses. With the loan, she will buy beauty products (creams, masks) and makeup items (lipsticks, mascara, eye shadow) etc. and clothes and thread to be able to provide better services to her clients and increase her profit. 

She is confident that her businesses will grow further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, clothes & thread for beauty salon & boutique business.

loans.name: Jose Bayardo

texts.es: Jose Bayardo tiene 22 años, su actividad es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio por su papa el cual se dedicaba a vender estos productos de manera ambulante en una camioneta que tenia fue así que el logro obtener sus clientes, fueron el paso del tiempo que decide brindarle la responsabilidad del negocio a su hijo Jose Bayardo. Este es motivo por el cual solicita este crédito para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz entre otros.
texts.en:
José Bayardo is 22 years old and sells basic grains.  He has been in this business for more than three years.  He started his business through his father who also sold these products.  He would sell his products as an itinerant salesman, using a truck that he owned.  This is how he managed to obtain his customers.  Over time, he decided to pass responsibility for the business over to his son José Bayardo. 

José Bayardo is requesting this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn and other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn and other products

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Fedelina has a shop that sells grown pigs. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Fedelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Fedelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store in the Philippines.

Virgilia has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store. She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Virgilia would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 50 years old. He lives in the village of Gomi, Imereti Region, West Georgia. Merab is unmarried and lives with his 86 year old father and 53 year old sister. Merab’s father is retired. His sister has health problems and gets the relevant pension from the government. Merab is the only income provider in the family. 

Merab manages the dairy farm, which consists of 4 milk cows. Merab produces, on average, 60 kg of cheese per month. He sells it at the local open market. The family also has a pig and sells 10-12 piglets per year. Along with the above-mentioned, Merab grows maize on the family owned plot of the land. Part of the harvested corn is used for feeding the cows and the other part is sold locally. The total average income of the family, including the pensions for Merab’s father and sister is 950 Laris. 

Merab has requested credit for expansion of the existing cattle-shed and construction of a hen-house. In the near future, he plans to increase the amount of cows on the farm, as well as to buy about 10 hens. 

After implementation of the set plan, Merab will sell more cheese, as well as eggs, the income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for expansion of the existing cattle-shed and construction of a new hen-house.

loans.name: 5.5 Hoằng Thịnh Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs Khánh works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattles to raise and sell in future.

Khánh is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 5.5 Hoằng T.nh Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. Khánh lives with 2 dependents in Hoằng Hoá district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Khánh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Khánh has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khánh has been involved in her business for 6 years. Among the most critical business difficulties that concern her are natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Khánh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattles to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 47-year-old married woman. She opened a grocery store in 2009 in order to do something useful, as she said, and to help her husband in covering their expenses.

Layla is a smart woman. She works on improving herself as much as she can, in addition to expanding her business since she started.

She requested a loan from A. Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for the first time, in order to increase her business capitA. by increasing her merchandise to fulfill her customers' needs and reply to their requests.

Layla is a hardworking woman. She sells food, beverages, vegetables and sweets. She will also add new products, attracting customers. She will work hard on expanding her working place and might add a butchery zone.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Isaidel

texts.es: El señor Isaidel  es  propietario de  un taxi  el  cual  lo renta  al  señor  Gustavo, de esta  manera  el  obtiene  ingresos  para  sacar adelante  a  su  familia, en esta  ocasión  requiere  de  nuestra  ayuda  para   comprar  refacciones  para   el  taxi y  así  poder  seguir  obteniendo  los  ingresos  de  la  renta  del   vehiculo y que  puedan  seguir  brindando  el  servicio  a  los  clientes, agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para  la  realización de  su  proyecto.
texts.en:
Señor Isaidel owns a taxi that he rents out to Señor Gustavo. and in this way he earns income to move his family ahead in life.

On this occasion, he is requesting our help to buy spare parts for the taxi, so that he can continue earning income from renting out the vehicle, and can continue providing service to the customers.

He is grateful for the support being offered so he can realize his plans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Malo has been in this business for 8 years now, and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water.

Malo has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. In the future, Malo would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Savan

texts.en:
Savan and her husband, Sombath, have been married since 1987 and have six children-five sons and one daughter. Two are garment worker and other four are in school.  The family is living in a village outside of Phnom Penh City.

Savan is a rice farmer, while her husband works for commune official. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase water pumping machine to spray her rice farm.

Photo: Savan is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine to spray her rice farm.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, has four children and earns a living by running a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, spices and vegetables such as cabbage, radishes and squash. She has had this business for 10 years and is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and vegetables to sell to her customers. Leonida joined HSPFI last year and is committed to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa , tiene 39 años de edad, casada desde hace 20 años, tiene 7 hijos de 4, 7, 10, 18, 21, 22 y 25 años de edad, vive en una aldea de Santa cruz de Yojoa. Su esposo se dedica  a la agricultura.
Desde hace 3 años se motivo a establecer una pulpería (venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar, como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, manteca, condimentos, jabón, pastas etc.), ya que su casa esta en frente de un colegio, aprovecha a vender refrescos, jugos,churros, confites, pan, otras cosas que necesitan los estudiantes, hasta la venta de comida como otros ingresos. Este negocio ha sido rentable, de éste obtiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de estudio de sus hijos. Con ODEF a solicitado varios préstamos, este es el séptimo y son para invertir en su negocio en compra de productos alimenticios.
texts.en:
Josefa, 39, has been married for 20 years and has 7 children who are 4, 7, 10, 18, 21, 22, and 25 years old.  She lives in a village in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  Her husband’s a farmer.

Three years ago she decided to open a grocery store (sells basic family staple items like rice, beans, sugar, salt, lard, condiments, soap, noodles, etc.) because her house is across from a school and she takes advantage of this to sell students soft-drinks, juice, snacks, sweets, bread and other things they need.  She even sells food to earn extra income.  This business has been profitable and earns the necessary income from it to cover her children’s educational costs.  She has asked ODEF for several loans and this is her 7th one; all have been used to buy foodstuffs.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Yhire Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YHIRE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Zenobia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, tejido de ropa de niños, venta de comidas, venta de productos de belleza, venta de juguetes, costura de enaguas, venta de condimentos.

La señora Zenobia,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de heladera) que adquirirá de la Ceja, por mayor, y posteriormente lo implementara en su tienda para guardar y conservar los productos a vender. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The YHIRE communal bank will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer with the Santiago II regional office. It is composed of eight members and has a board of directors headed by señora Zenobia. The members have various businesses including a neighborhood shop, making children’s clothing, selling meals, selling beauty products, selling toys, sewing petticoats, and selling spices.

Señora Zenobia says that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she established the communal bank at the invitation of her friends. Currently, she has a neighborhood shop which she has worked with for some time.

The loan she is applying for now is to purchase a refrigerator which she will acquire at wholesale in the community of La Ceja. She will install it in her shop to keep and preserve the products that she sells. Her business allows her to generate income to support her family. She is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the training in finance and health.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Antonio Miguel

texts.es:
Antonio es un señor de 72 años de edad, vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada Cimarrón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago. Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y la agricultura. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. Cimarrón se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias.

Desde hace varios meses que Antonio ha querido iniciar con un negocio de siembra de banano, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con el propiedad que le heredaron sus padres para tal fin pero le faltan lo principal para que su negocio surja y sus expectativas son  vender sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad. Dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante.

Actualmente Antonio está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢596.000 (quinientos noventa y seis mil colones) para la compra de de semillas de banano. Con esto espera hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia.
