Antonio es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Antonio is a 72 year old man who lives with family in Cimarrón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the Provincia of Cartago. It is a small rural community of approximately 2000 inhabitants. The inhabitants work mainly in milk production and agriculture. It has an irregular relief and most of the land remains moist tropical forest. Cimarrón is located about an hour and half by bus from Turrialba, the closest commercial centre. However, several times a year the road becomes impassable due to the rains.

For several months Antonio has wanted to start a business planting bananas, as he now has the property he inherited from his parents for this purpose but lacks the main thing for his business to thrive; he plans to sell his products to the residents of in the community. He says that the project is very interesting.

Currently Antonio is asking for a micro loan of ¢596.000 (five hundred and ninety six thousand colones) (CRC) to buy banana seeds. With this he hopes to grow the business and improve not only his quality of life but that of his family as well.

Antonio is a member of the communal bank the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón, one of the 150 member organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and with it he hopes to continue growing at the personal and ecnomic level as well as actively participating in his community's communal bank.

loans.use: to plant bananas.

loans.name: Janine

texts.en:
Janine is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Janine has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and vegetables like tomatoes. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Janine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Janine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is 41 years old, married, and has four children. With two children in school, Liezl works very hard to provide for them.

Liezl runs a sari-sari store (convenience store) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, sugar, spices, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Liezl would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Osanva

texts.en:
49-year-old Osanva is a married woman, with two children to take good care of. A year ago, Osanva moved to her new shop. This decision to expand her business was an important one. Thirteen years ago, Osanva opened her own clothing shop, in order to help her husband in covering their family's expenses. Her extensive experience has provided her with the necessary skills and customer service techniques to attract new customers and gain their trust.

Osanva has been a borrower from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for three consecutive cycles. Her previous loans were invested in her business, which improved her social and financial situations. Today Osanva is applying for a loan in order to add more items to her winter collection. 

Osanva plans to expand her business more in the future, through introducing new products and moving to a larger space.

loans.use: To buy a new winter collection of clothes for resale

loans.name: Guleysha

texts.en:
Guleysha is a refugee from the occupied Fizuli region of Azerbaijan since 1993. She began her business with $200 in 2001. At first, she was selling children\\\'s clothing and earning little money. This money was enough for only some of her family\'s basic needs. She had difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, school etc.

In 2004, after borrowing $500 from Normicro, Guleysha was able to expand her business and increase the income of her business and improve her family\'s livelihood.

With this loan, Guleysha plans to expand her business and possibly pay for school expenses for her children properly.

loans.use: She will use this loan for opening a materials section in her business.

loans.name: Vine

texts.en: Vine is a happy mother of five kids, married and residing at Vailele where her shop located. She sells groceries (flours, salts, gels, herrings, etc. and items the locals use daily. She is the only person operating this kind of business in her area, and she uses her income to support her family. Vine is requesting a loan to buy a deep freezer so she can stock more perishables that her customers use.

loans.use: 1 deep freezer

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with an 11-year-old son whom she is raising all alone. The need to provide for her family forced her to look for a stable source of income. That is why Nataliya started her small business selling clothing in the market. She has been in business now for three years. Currently she has about $1,400 in inventory. Her gross income is over $700, and her monthly profit amounts to around $240.

Nataliya is a quiet optimist who always strives for accuracy and quality in her work. This has helped her earn an excellent reputation among her loyal customers and other vendors in the market. Nataliya is market-driven – she listens to her customers and tries her best to meet their needs.

Today she is requesting a loan of $800 to increase the assortment of inventory she has available in her kiosk. We believe that her abilities, professionalism, and business knowledge will promote further growth of her trade and ensure the success of her small business.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Dossy

texts.en:
Dossy runs two business: decorations for functions/ceremonies (weddings, business meetings, etc.) and a boutique. She was educated up to secondary school. She could not get a job because employment opportunities are limited, especially for girls. Her parents decided to send her for a tailoring course, which she completed and started her own tailoring mart. Later she discovered that during weekends there is high demand for decorations. She decided to learn the skill through apprenticeship. This new line of business keeps her busy, particularly on Fridays and Saturdays when weddings and other cerebrations takes place.

The loan of US$ 1200 will assist her to purchase up-to-date decoration materials and equipment. The materials are locally available through importers who normally get them from Far East. She thanks all the lenders of her first loan with Kiva, which she has paid in full.

loans.use: Purchase of decoration lamps, artificial flowers, table cloths

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia's husband has been a fisherman all his life. This has been the family's main source of income. Malia is married with 7 children. Having a big family brings a lot of responsibilities. The hardest part for her is to pay for her children's education.

Malia decided to join SPBD because she wanted to buy some more equipment for their fishing business. Malia is planning to have a fishing boat in future and to own more equipment to help them so that it will make the work easier.

loans.use: To assist in developing their fishing micro-business

loans.name: Maharram

texts.ru:
Maharram H. was born in 1955, is married and has 2 children. He serves clients with his own car. Maharram needed a loan to fix his car and turned to the Agsu division of Normicro for a loan. By getting a loan in a timely manner he was able to fix his car and to serve his passengers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гусейнов Магеррам.Родился 1955 году. Женат . Имеет двоих детей. Занимается обслуживанием клиентов на своем личном автомобиле. Нуждался в кредите чтобы отремонтировать свою машину. Обратился по поводу кредита в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала.Вовремя получив кредит на сумму пятьсот манатов сделал ремон автомабиля. В данный момент занимается обслуживанием поссажиров.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila is a seamstress. She makes embroidered tags for articles of clothing and also makes belts for women and men. She makes these items by the dozens in the markets of the city of La Paz. The sales from the markets are her source of income that she uses to support her two children who are dependent upon her. She lives in the Portada area of the city of La Paz.

The loan requested will be used to buy prime materials such as thread and leather, to fulfill the orders that she has for the parties at the end of the year. This is the fifth loan with IMPRO. The prior loans qualify her to be approved for this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Teofila es costurera; realiza bordados de etiquetas para prendas de vestir y tambien confecciona cinturones para damas y caballeros que comercializa por docenas en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz; esta actividad es su fuente de ingreso con la que mantiene a su dos hijos que dependen de ella; vive en la Zona de la Portada de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito requiere para comprar materia prima hilo y cuero para satisfacer la cantidad de pedidos que tiene por las fiestas de fin de año. Es el quinto crédito con Impro, los antecedentes anteriores le facultan para aprobarle la solicitud realizada por el prestatario.

loans.use: Purchase of thread and leather for her business.

loans.name: Teo's Group

texts.en: Teo is married with 7 children. She has a poultry farm. She intends to use the extra profits constructing another poultry house, buying more chicks and connecting electricity.

loans.use: Enlarge the business

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophorn was married in 1968, but she is now a widow with seven children: three boys and four girls. One of the children has married and the others are single. This family lives along National Road Number 05 on the way to Battambong Province. They are all very kind and friendly.

Mrs. Sophorn has been selling groceries in the village since 2000. She buys most of grocery items from a market in Phnom Penh. She is requesting her fourth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1000 to purchase more grocery items, such as candy, oranges, bananas, and cake, to sell in her neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Mrs. Yen S., 32, sells food products, earning approximately two dollars a day. Her husband grows vegetables on a plot of land that he owns. He earns about two dollars a day. They have four children, all of whom are students.

The loan they are requesting will be used to purchase a water pump to water the crops.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump to water crops

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 30 years old and is married woman with 5 children, ages 9 to 16 years old. Asha is a food seller, and she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 38 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 1 to 18 years old. Mwanahawa is a market seller, and she started in 1990. Everyday, she works from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more market items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more market items for her business.

loans.name: Toshbibi

texts.en:
Toshbibi S. is 48 years old. She is married and has 7 children. She works on a collective farm in the Asht region of Tajikistan, where her husband is a stock keeper and she is engaged in the family business of raising and selling livestock. Mrs. S. has 30 years’ experience raising livestock because she grew up helping her mother take care of the animals.

Mrs. S. is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $625.00 US to build a cowshed.

loans.use: To build a cowshed

loans.name: Akossiwa Djigbodi

texts.fr:
Born on July 20, 1975 in Lomé, Ms. Akossiwa Djigbodi F. is a single woman who is a hairdresser by trade. She opened her own hair salon “Divine Coiffure” in the Lomé suburb of Adidogomé. Since the opening of this salon in 1998, Ms. F. has had many customers who were, for the most part, female civil servants. She runs her business in a professional manner and always gains the trust of her customers. This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy hair relaxer, 4 boxes of hair coloring caps, and some hair weaves.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 20 juillet 1975 à Lomé, Mademoiselle F. Akossiwa Djigbodi est une femme célibataire qui est coiffeuse de profession. Elle a ouvert son atelier de coiffure « DIVINE COIFFURE » dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Depuis l’ouverture de cet atelier en 1998 elle accueille beaucoup de clients qui sont pour la plupart des femmes fonctionnaires. Elle exerce son activité avec beaucoup de professionnalisme et gagne toujours la confiance de ses clients. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter de défrisant, 4 cartons de mèche et des tissages.

loans.use: Purchase of hair coloring caps and hair weaves

loans.name: Reyna's Group

texts.en:
Virginia lives with her common-law husband and is a 44-year-old mother of 4 children. She sells vegetables at the 12 de Abril market. She buys them in the mornings at the Ayacucho market.

Miriam is a 24-year-old single woman. She sells recorders, radios, and CDs; she resells them at the regional fairs where she travels 3 times a week.

Reyna is separated and is a 28-year-old mother of 2 children. She lives in the Chiara district. She has a store where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat.

Virginia, Miriam and Reyna are members of the Rubí Village Bank. They need respective loans of 400, 600, and 600 Nuevos Soles to buy tomatoes, carrots, recorders, rice, sugar and flour. 

They dream about having a bigger business and having their own house. They want their children to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, recorders, rice, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Te

texts.en:
Te Y., 58, is a housewife who stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family members.

Her husband works digging wells (pumping wells) to earn a living and is able to make $10 of profit per day. This couple also has support from their children of about $50 per month. 

To make more profit to support the family, Mrs. Te would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, to purchase a grinding mill to offer that service to the local people for extra profit. She hopes the grinding mill will double the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill to offer that service to the local people.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace mucho tiempo, a sus 62 años es madre de 6 hijos, los mismos que ya son profesionales e independientes, hijos que la hacen sentir muy orgullosa.Quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio, para ello necesita arreglarlo, así como también mejorar los ambientes. El propósito de Viviana es ampliar su negocio y llegar a tener un Minimarket, para ello requiere del capital que la ayudará a concretar su objetivo. Con tu ayuda Viviana verá crecer su negocio en un corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Viviana has been selling groceries for a long time. At 62 years of age, she is the mother of 6 children who are now professionals and independent—children who make her feel very proud. She wants to continue building her business, and to do this she needs to make some repairs and improve the atmosphere of her place. Vivian’s intention is to expand her business and eventually have a Minimarket. For this she needs capital to help her achieve her goal. With your help, Viviana will see her business grow quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business and increase her merchandise

loans.name: Way To Success Group

texts.en:
This is Alpha S. K. and Marie M.. Their group name is Way to Success. They named their group Way to Success because of the firm belief that with loans from SMT, they are on their way to success. This will be their 3rd loan from Kiva through SMT. The previous loan they received from SMT was for Le 500,000 each. This was a great help to these entrepreneurs. 

Alpha is the leader of the group. He was born in Kabala 21 years ago. He is single with no children. He has been in business for 3 years now. Alpha dropped out of school when his dad passed away. He became the breadwinner for his family following the death of his father. He started a small business in order to raise money to support his 5 junior brothers in their schooling. Three of them are still in primary school and 2 are in secondary school.

Alpha sells biscuits, margi (used in sauce), toothpaste, sardines, batteries, milk, sugar, soaps, and a lot more. He buys these items in Freetown (abut 570 r/t) because of the cheaper prices in Freetown.

One great challenge he is facing as a businessman is the lack of items in his shop. But with SMT, he is now confident that gradually he will be able to get a shop full of items to sell.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar P. vive en la calle Franz Tamayo de la zona 16 de Julio, ciudad de El Alto.
 
Es madre soltera vive junto a su hijo de 10 años de edad.

Trabaja como docente del ciclo básico, en una pequeña escuela del área.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una computadora, así mejorará la enseñanza de sus alumnos, guardando información para exponer en clase, llevando un registro de las tareas, etc.
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Pilar P. lives on Franz Tamayo street in the 16 de Julio zone in the city of El Alto. She is a single mother that lives with her 10 year old son. She works as an elementary school teacher in a small school in the area. The loan will be used to purchase a computer, which will allow her to improve the instruction of her students by showing information in class, having a record of homework assignments, etc. This is her first loan with Impro, but an analysis was performed that qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of computer for her classroom

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es: Rocío tiene 32 años, se separó de su pareja y cría a sus tres hijos Antoni de 12, Shiomara de 9 y Corayma de 8 años. Ella es una ejemplar madre que en busca del bienestar de sus hijos y teniendo que criarlos sola se ha desempeñado en muchos trabajos, los cuales le han costado esfuerzo y dedicación, es así que hace 15 años decidió incursionar en el negocio de la artesanía, ella elabora bordados para vender por pedido. Las ventas son altas, ya que Rocío le pone muchos detalles a sus bordados, haciendo que la clientela prefiera sus prendas, lo más difícil es tener que realizar las cantidades que le solicitan. Rocío quiere incrementar la elaboración de bordados pagándole a otra persona para que la ayude en la elaboración de los mismos. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de materiales para la elaboración de sus bordados y contratará a una ayudante para realizarlos en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Rocío is 32 years old. She separated from her husband and she is raising her three children on her own: 12 year old Antoni, 9 year old Shiomara and 8 year old Corayma. She is an exemplary mother looking after her children’s wellbeing. With hard work and dedication, she managed to have several jobs. For that reason, 15 years ago, she decided to enter into the handicrafts business. She makes embroideries for sale upon request. Sales are high because Rocío’s work has many details one of the main reasons to be the artisan of choice for her customers. The hardest part of her job is to finish every request on time. Rocío wants to hire another person to help her increase the amount of pieces of embroidery made for sale. This is her first loan request to Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the money to purchase more material to make more pieces of embroidery and to hire an assistant to produce more textile art.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for her embroideries and hire an assistant

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi: Chị Vũ Thị Thể, 46 tuổi ở Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2007 Gia đình anh chị có 3 con đều đã lớn và có khả năng lao động phụ giúp cho gia đình, chồng chị làm nghề lái xe con trai làm  ở cảng Lễ Môn, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị hi ện nay  từ chăn nuôi, lương của chồng và sự hỗ trợ thêm của các con là 3.000.000/tháng.. Vòng vốn tới Chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vu Thi T., 46 years of age, lives in Quang Xuong district, Thanh Hoa province. She has participated to T. Fund since 2007. Her family has 3 children who are grown up and can support T. works in T. family. Her husband is a driver and her son works in Le Mon Port. T. average income of her family from livestock raising, salary of T. husband, and financial support from her children is VND3,000,000 per month.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND9,000,000 to invest in livestock/poultry raising.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising livestock/poultry

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Unité) Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier dar-salam 2 de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali).
Elles exercent presque la même activité d’achat et de vente  de friperie. Par ailleurs, elles vendent des légumes et fruits. Elles sont  très sollicitées pour leurs activités. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de leurs clientèles qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Benkadi a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son deuxième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des balles  de friperie à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali). Les fruits et légumes sont achetés au fur et à mesure et sont vendus en détail au marché  de Koutiala et  environs (zangasso, koro barrage). Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 80 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’agrandir leurs activités telle que l’ouverture d’un magasin de friperie.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Benkadi group are all married; they have an average age of 36 and 3 children and live in big traditional extended families in the district called Dar-Salam 2 of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali).

They work in almost the same business, buying and selling used clothing. They also sell vegetables and fruit. They are much in demand for these businesses.

In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-growing clientele, the Benkadi group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan was correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to buy bales of used clothing in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). The fruit and vegetables are bought little by little and sold retail in the market at Koutiala and in the surrounding area (Zangasso, Koro Barrage). They each hope to earn an average profit of 80,000 F CFA during the term of the loan. That money will be used to pay the interest on the loan and support their extended family, with any remainder invested in their businesses.

Their ambition is to expand their businesses, for instance, to open a used clothing store.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of used clothing, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Marlene  Lecahdo

texts.es: Marlene Lechado A. tiene 47 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Marlene tiene 2 hijos. Todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Marlene es la venta de productos varios como veta de queso, gaseosa, golosinas y otros. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y se da por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos. Sus propósitos son de mejorar la calidad del queso para que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para comprar golosinas y  gaseosas. Los deseos de Doña Marlene son de poseer una casa propia ya que actualmente donde reside es en la vivienda de sus suegros. La cantidad que necesita es de C$ 19.000 córdobas a un plazo de 14 meses.
texts.en:
Marlene Lechado A. is 47-years old and is married with two children. Both her children are currently studying. Marlene’s trade of choice is to sell various products such as: veta cheese, beverages, candy and other things.

She has dedicated more than 5-years to this business and is in need to obtain more income. Marlene wishes to improve on the quality of her cheese to ensure that her customers are satisfied. Funding is for working capital to purchase candy and beverages. Marlene’s desires are to own her own home where she can live with her in-laws. She requests a loan of C$19.000 cordobas which will be repaid in 14-months.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for supplies and food refinement.

loans.name: Koffi Nyento

texts.fr: Monsieur A. Koffi est un célibataire qui  réside dans le quartier d’adidogomé, il est un informaticien de formation, mais depuis 2007  comme il ne trouvait pas de travail il s’est lancé dans  la vente de quincaillerie, son dynamisme a fait qu’il a conquis beaucoup de clients, aujourd’hui il est un vendeur  très connu dans son quartier. Présentement le stock de marchandises dont il dispose ne lui permet pas de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, il demande à WAGES son premier prêt pour acheter des contre plaquets, des tubes, des tôles et autres matériaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi A. is single and lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood. He is trained as a computer specialist, but since he could not find a job in his field, he started a hardware business in 2007. He has won over many clients with his dynamism and is a well known vendor in his neighborhood. At present, his merchandise inventory levels don't allow him to meet his clients' needs. He is seeking his first loan from WAGES to purchase tubes, sheet metal and other material.

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hardware mateial

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambo K., forty-four, and her husband, Mr. Horn He, thirty-six, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1991 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. Two of the children are in secondary school and the other two are in primary school. 
 
Sambo has been a silk-weaver since she was sixteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then distributes it for resale at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a construction worker since 1986. Sambo is requesting her second loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy has owned a small salon in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two months. She belongs to the Jipe moyo loan group (group code 2088). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can improve her business by buying more salon items, like weaving supplies, hair treatments, artificial items, hair condition, and shampoo. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Emmy is 32 years old, married, and has two children who are ages nine years and four months. She also takes care of one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 34 años, es padre de un hijo y vive junto a su pareja, quien está de acuerdo con sus propósitos y lo apoya al 100%. Desde hace 7 años atrás cuenta con una peluquería en un pequeño local alquilado, donde hace todo tipo de cortes de cabellos para caballeros y damas. Le gusta mucho esta labor porque conoce a muchas personas con quienes entabla buenas relaciones, además que le es rentable porque aparte de contar con su propio local, también brinda sus servicios a domicilio y cuenta con una fiel clientela. Para más adelante, Carlos quisiera tener un local propio y dejar de pagar alquiler. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque sus integrantes son muy responsables y comunicativos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará herramientas y productos para su peluquería, además la ambientará adecuadamente para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 34-year-old father who lives with his son and his wife, who agrees with all his goals and supports him 100%. He has owned a hair salon in a small, rented office space for 7 years, providing all sorts of haircuts for men and women. He really likes this field because he gets to meet a lot of people with whom he forms good relationships. Furthermore, this business is profitable because aside from having a business space, he also provides in-home haircut services, and he has loyal customers. In the future, Carlos would like to have his own business space so that he can stop paying rent. This is the first time that he requests a loan from MFP. He likes to work with his microfinance institute because its members are very responsible and communicative. With the money that he is requesting, he will purchase work tools and products for his hair salon. He will also give his salon some atmosphere in order to better welcome his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase work tools and products for his hair salon

loans.name: Uyimwen

texts.en: Uyimwen has a farm where she plants cassava and corn. She is 60 years old and married with 8 children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N70,000 to purchase more cassava stems to plant. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava stems to plant.

loans.name: José Hedi

texts.es:
José Hedi M. V. tiene dos hijos pero una de ellas va  a cumplir quince años, la muchacha le pidió a su papa que fuera en el patio de su casa ya que es ahí donde ella creció y vivió una infancia muy bonita. José quiere darle la sorpresa a su hija arreglando el piso y alrededor de ese lugar para que la quinceañera de la muchacha quede muy bonita que en compañía de su familia como amistades se lleven una buena impresión del lugar pero sobre todo ver la felicidad de la quinceañera.
El señor es pensionado ya que por muchos años fue maestro pero ahora recibe su dinero cada mes, su esposa le ayuda en la venta de ropa usada en las pulgas de la ciudad.
El crédito lo utilizara para compra de material de construcción como cemento varilla, grava, pintura y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
José Hedi M. V. has two children. His daughter is going to turn 15 soon and asked her father to hold her birthday party in the patio of their house, since that's where she grew up and enjoyed a lovely childhood. José wants to surprise his daughter by repairing the patio floor and fixing up the walls so that his daughter's quinceañera will be a beautiful celebration. He wants his family and friends to come away with a good impression of the place but most of all wants the quinceañera to be a happy one. José is retired. He was a teacher for many years but now receives a pension every month. His wife helps him by selling secondhand clothing in the local flea markets. He will use the requested loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, rods, gravel, and paint, and to hire workers.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Evarista Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Evarista del Carmen R. , tiene la edad de 56 años , habita en el barrio el cielo , ubicado en Masaya , junto a su esposo , el cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, ellos tiene cinco hijos tres de ellos ya son casados y dos todavía estudian y le poyan con las actividades del hogar y campo, los planes hacia sus familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Evarista desde hace 12 años se dedica a la agricultura , el mayor problema que se le presenta es el mal invierno y la falta de financiamiento  , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus hermanos , los planes futuros hacia la producción es diversificarlo y darle mejor mantenimiento .Con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y aplicar el cultivo para lograr una buena producción.
texts.en:
Evarista del Carmen R., 56, lives with her husband in the El Cielo neighborhood in Masaya. Her husband helps her with the farm work. They have five children. Three of them are married, and two still go to school. They help with the work at home and in the fields. The family plan is to improve their living conditions. Evarista has been farming for 12 years. The biggest problems are the bad winter and the lack of financing. She started this activity with help from her siblings. Future production plans are to diversify and to have better maintenance. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and supplies to put on the crops to achieve better production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers to put on the crops

loans.name: Aurora Alexandre

texts.pt:
Aurora Alexandre N. nasceu na localidade de Ponta douro (sul da Província de Maputo fronteira com a Republica de África do Sul), tem 31 anos de idade e mãe de um filho de sete anos que frenquenta 2 classe na Escola primaria da vila da Ponta douro.
Aurora foi obrigada a ter que interromper os estudos na 5 classe para refugiar a áfrica do sul, devido à guerra civil que ocorreu no pais.

Após o ternimo da guerra (no ano de 1992) Aurora regressa aos pais juntamente com os seus pais e ano depois começa a ter uma relação com o seu marido. 
Aurora começou interessar se em fazer pequenos negócios. Em conversa com suas amigas, descobriu oportunidade de negocio e montou um pequeno salão de cabelaria para tratar de beleza das mulheres da zona.

Vive na casa própria com o seu marido e sem ninguém mais por sustentar. Nunca teve empréstimo com outros bancos (na ponta do ouro existe apenas a Hluvuku-Adsema com actividade crediticia) e que conheceu pessoalmente devido a sua localização estratégica, ao lado do mercado central.
Decide solicitar o primeiro credito no valor de 9.000,00MT para compra de material de construção e dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa que vem construindo em fases.

Para alem da cabelaria, possui também um mine estabelecimento comercial onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade. Tem um rendimento diário, proveniente das duas actividades, no valor de 1.500,00MT e conta com uma empregada no salão, enquanto ela cuida do principal negocio. ( venda de produtos de mercearia)
Propõe se a pagar bem o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros créditos para satisfazer o sonho de ter a casa concluída e prosperar no negocio.
texts.en:
Aurora Alexandre N. was born in Ponta douro (south of Maputo in the frontier with South Africa), she is 31 years old and has a 7 year old son, who is studying the 2nd grade at the elementary school in the village of Ponta Douro. Aurora had to interrupt her studies when she was on the 5th grade to get refuge in South Africa, because of the civil war in her country. After the war ended (in 1992) Aurora came back to her country with her parents and years later started her relationship with her husband. She lives in her own house with her husband. She never had a loan with other banks (in Ponta do Ouro there is just one Hluvuku-Adsema with credit activity) she learned about Hluvuku-Adsema in person due to its strategic position, near a central market. She decided to request a loan for 9,000MT to buy construction material to continue building her house in phases. Besides a beauty parlor, she has a grocery store where she sells basic needs products. She has a daily income of 1.500MT and she has an employee at the salon, while she takes care of the main business (selling merchandise). She expects to pay well the loan in order to access more loans to satisfy her dream of finishing her house and improve her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Don Roger E. E. es un señor de 53 años de edad que vive con su esposa y dos hijos, en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.

Debido a las pocas fuentes de empleo que ofrece la  comunidad, don Roger se incursionó  como microempresario en el área de la agricultura especializándose en la siembra de arroz para vender  tanto en su comunidad como en lugares vecinos, que según su criterio, hay un excelente mercado ya sea por medio de venta a intermediarios o al público directamente. 

Desde muy joven don Roger se ha dedicado a la siembra de arroz, por lo tanto, dice que tiene bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo; tiene un terreno en el cual ha sembrado arroz anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirlo por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Roger  es un micro crédito de ¢570,000 (quinientos setenta  mil colones), para ayudarse con  la preparación del terreno, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del arroz y lograr una buena cosecha.

Don Roger es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera crecer a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Roger E. E., 53, lives with his wife and two children in a small, rural community in Costa Rica called Las Delicias de Upala. It is located in the Alajuela province. The activities there are business, livestock with double purposes (meat and milk), and planting basic grains such are rice, beans, corn, and others. Due to the few sources of employment offered in the community, Roger became a small businessman in agriculture. He specializes in planting rice to sell in his community as well as neighboring places. He feels there is an excellent market selling to intermediaries or directly to the public. Roger has devoted himself to planting rice since he was very young. He has significant experience in the care and maintenance of this type of crop. He has land where he has previously planted rice, and he got very good results when it came time to distribute the rice. That is why he wants to expand his field. Thanks to this business his family’s quality of life has improved considerably. Roger is asking for a loan for ¢570,000 (five hundred seventy thousand colones) to help him prepare the land, buy seeds, fertilizers, and other necessary supplies to guarantee optimum rice planting and achieve a good harvest. Roger is a member of the “Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban” (Datraban Community Credit Company), one of the 100 organizations partnered with EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan, and he expects to grow on a personal and economic level. Also, thanks to this type of organization and their ways of facilitating loans, he can dedicate more time to his productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and maintenance for planting rice

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is 35 years old and married with four children. He is a hard-working man who is confident that he can work well. 

He has a shop in which he sells car accessories and oil for cars. He wants to take out an individual loan of $3,000 to purchase additional materials to expand his business. He hopes to be a good businessman in the future to support his family and his society. He says thank you.

loans.use: Purchase additional materials

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: Eufemia C. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, is widowed, and has five adult children. Eufemia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Eufemia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: La señora Vilma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Cucardas II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años y 03 hijos,  que aun dependen de ella.Se dedica a la venta de gallinas vivas hace muchos años atrás, iniciándose con un capital de S/. 300.00, hoy en día continúa con el mismo negocio, por las mañanas y tardes,  ubicada en su misma casa, nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus negocio y esta muy  contenta con lo que hace.Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00, comprará patos y gallinas criollas vivas en javas,  estas aves son criadas a base de maíz y no de alimento balanceado.Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres de la región San Martín.

loans.use: Comprará gallinas criollas vivas en javas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase horses to help transport merchandise

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en: Jane K. is the leader of her group in Mukono. She is a hard-working and devoted lady who grows matooke, cassava, sweet potatoes and so on. She also makes local brew for sale as a wholesaler and at a retail price for her customers at her bar. She is happy that the loans help her buy quality seeds, employ manpower, and buy bananas and yeast to make her brew. She is a married woman with 10 children, five of whom are still in school. The rest work at various businesses. She needs a loan to help pay for her children’s school, to pay for farm work and to buy bananas and yeast needed to make her local brew.

loans.use: To buy seeds and labor for her farm and raw materials for making her local brew.

loans.name: Ladu

texts.en:
Ladu N. is in the business of selling bread and cakes in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase other items such as tomatoes, fresh fish, onions, etc., to sell. Ladu is 23 years old and married to a soldier. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase items such as tomatoes, fresh fish, onions, etc., to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk

loans.name: Concepcion Manuela

texts.en:
Ms. Concepcion Manuela is 63 years old and lives at home with her husband and her two eldest daughters. Her husband is a builder who specializes in constructing gutters (eavestroughs) at construction sites.

Manuela’s business is based around buying and re-selling clothing for men, women and children. She also sells small appliances, household goods and other items according to requests she receives from her customers.

The loan will help Manuela acquire a larger quantity of goods for this summer season, for the holidays, and for year-end, a season which is usually very high in orders and retail sales.

Manuela longs to build up her business through hard work so that she can retire and spend time in the company of her grandchildren, ensuring herself a prosperous and dignified future.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of goods

loans.name: Sot

texts.en:
Mrs. Sot S., 56, is a widow with one son. She lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her son has full-time employment.  


Sot has been a farmer for twenty-four years. She grows banana and tomato plants on her farm in the village. She doesn’t have capital to maintain her farm, so she is requesting a loan of the amount of $100 to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Nogoye

texts.fr: Nogoye N. est âgée de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant en charge, par ailleurs 4 autres  lui sont confiés par des parents et des proches. Elle est membre de banc Villageois depuis 3 ans. Elle fait la broderie de draps de lit qu'elle vend, elle vend également de l'encens fabriqué artisanalement. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de prendre en charge ses enfants.
texts.en:
Nogoye N. is 45 years old, married and has one child of her own; furthermore she has four other children who have been entrusted to her care by close relatives. She has been a member of the Village Bank for three years. She embroiders bed sheets which she sells, and she also sells incense which is produced by craftsmen. Her aim is to boost her savings and to take care of her children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Jimmy Rafael

texts.es:
El Sr. Jimmy T. A., casado y padre de familia de un hijo el que se  encuentran en edad escolar. El Sr. Jimmy acude a ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita comprar materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que necesita comprar perlines, zinc, pintura y clavos para el techo de su casa el cual esta deteriorado y en invierno el agua penetra en su hogar.
Cabe mencionar que desde que ceprodel me ha estado financiando créditos e podido mejorar mis condiciones de vida para mi familia.
texts.en:
Jimmy is married and the father of a family of one child who is of school age. Jimmy came to Ceprodel in order to request a loan to buy construction materials for home improvements. He needs to buy beams, zinc, paint and nails because the roof of his house has deteriorated and water gets into his home during the winter.

It is worth mentioing that, since Ceprodel has made loans to me I have been able to improve the living conditions for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard A. is an individual client of Pearl Microfinance in Kyenjojo. He is a friendly and determined-to-work married man with 4 children all still in school as he takes care of 3 dependents.

Richard has operated a butchery in Kigunda Trading Centre for 3 years from which he is able to collect 70000 UGX as profits weekly. He attributes this to his good customer care and the quality meat that he sells from his butcher shop. He works so hard to ensure that he becomes a successful business man as well as have a stable and well established family.

Richard needs a loan to be able to increase his purchase of cows so as to increase his sales and hence income and profits.

loans.use: To buy more cows for his business.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en: Mike A. is 50 years old, married with six (6) children. He is an honest and hard working man. He sells for long hours to enable him to put food on his table to feed his immediate family. He sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to his customers. He hopes to own a classic super market in the future. He hopes for a loan amount of N100,000, to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. He loves this business because it is profitable to him. He says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks

loans.name: Ufunuo Group

texts.en:
Amina R., age 48, is married with three children, ages 29, 24 and 12 years old. She has had a charcoal business since 2001. She works from 6 am to 8 pm daily and she is able to earn a monthly profit of about $104. 

This will be Amina’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first loan to increase her charcoal stock. She hopes for a new loan to go to the forest herself and collect the charcoal of her choice. 

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, Ufunuo, which totals 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, Amina is behind in a red dress.

loans.use: To start going into the forest and collecting the charcoal herself

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria es una persona joven y muy alegre. Ella y su esposo, Carlos, tienen un pequeño hijo en edad escolar y viven en la zona de Villa Salomé que se encuentra a 30 minutos del centro de la cuidad. María se dedica a la venta de carne de llama y cordero en el Mercado 10 de Enero de Pampahasi. Comenzó con esta actividad debido a que su madre realizaba la misma actividad pero debido a que ya era mayor le dejo a María el puesto de venta. Carlos trabaja como enfermero en el Hospital General de esta cuidad. Ellos son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables ya que con su trabajo esperan poder ahorrar lo suficiente para poder comprar una casa propia. Uno de los mayores anhelos de Maria es poder ver a su hijo como profesional. Este es el segundo préstamo que María tiene con nuestra institución, en el primer préstamo ella demostro ser una persona muy puntual. En esta ocación ella solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para levantar un muro en su casa. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
María is a happy young woman. She and her husband, Carlos, have a young, school-aged son. They live in the Villa Salomé zone, which is located 30 minutes from the city center. María sells llama and lamb meat in the "10 de Enero" market in Pampahasi. She began this business with her mother, who left the business to María when she retired. Carlos works as a nurse in the city's general hospital. They are both hard working and responsible people. They hope to be able to save enough money to buy their own home. One of María's greatest desires is to see her son in a professional career. This will be María's second loan through our institution. She demonstrated great punctuality in repaying her first loan. She will use the money from this loan to build a wall around her house. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have placed in her by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building Materials

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer H. took a loan from FATEN to help her husband improve and expand his meat shop. Abeer is a mother of five daughters and four sons; one of them has already graduated and works in the United Arab Emirates while the rest are school and university students.

Abeer's husband, Jala, started his business twenty years ago. He sells frozen and fresh meat and chicken which he prepares at his own shop.  Jalal is thinking of expanding his business and purchasing a bigger fridge to include selling fish and expanding his business in order to cover his family expenses.

Jala's shop is well-known and is located in the market of Jenin city where you can see him in the picture above preparing chicken for one of his customers, who is standing next to him.

loans.use: Purchasing a bigger fridge

loans.name: Mrs. Chum Seam Village Bank Group

texts.en: The 15 people in this village bank loan live in Ampil Kaeut village in Takeo province. Mrs. Chum S. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose. She is a weaver at her home. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve her business, Mrs. Chum S. is asking for a loan to buy more silk. Her husband, Mr. Pheng Boeng, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support his family and he is a construction laborer too. She is a mother of three children. One of her children is also a weaver, one is a teacher, and one is a beautician.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Nyanama Tweyogerere Society, Kampala Group

texts.en:
N. Robinah is the mother of ten children, all in high school. She also takes care of three orphans. 

For the last ten years, Robinah has been operating a restaurant business in Nyanama, Kampala. With the profits from this business, this hardworking woman has managed to greatly improve her family's welfare in subsequent years. By her own account, in a month she makes profits totaling up to 100,000 shillings.

Robinah's future plans are to expand her business so that it is able to fully compete in an increasingly competitive business field. With this loan, she foresees this unfolding. She wants to buy more furniture like chairs, tables and also cutlery for her growing restaurant business.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture and utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Kem S., 35, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. provides water supply in her village, with her husband, for an income of USD 2.5 per day. Her husband is also a construction worker, earning an income of about USD 2.5 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a water pump to get the water to supply the village for more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to get water to supply the village.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 47 años y tiene un hijo.   Yo vive en la comunidad campesina de Rayanniyoc de la distrito de Taray de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco.  

La mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, yo cuento con un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en llevar y vender verduras en los mercados de  la ciudad del Cusco como por ejemplo a Huancaro, Wanchaq, etc. Mi segunda actividad económica es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, chanchos, ovejas,  etc. Al principio se me hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal de Arariwa, el cual nos brindo apoyo con préstamos de dinero y así pudimos muchos de nosotros empezar y así mejorar nuestros negocios. Ya son varios años que participo en el banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” y mis compañeras confían en mi responsabilidad y puntualidad de mis pagos por ese motivo requiero el crédito para aumentar el capital de mi negocio y deseo comprar más cereales como por ejemplo tarwi, quinua, maíz, etc.
texts.en:
Catalina is 47 and has one child. I live in the rural community of Rayanniyoc, in the Taray district of the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco. The majority of the villagers work in agriculture and ranching. I have a small business which consists of growing and selling vegetables in the markets of the city of Cusco, such as Huancaro and Wanchaq, etc. My second activity is the raising of small animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, sheep etc. In the beginning it was a bit difficult since I did not have much capital, and then I was given the opportunity to belong to the Arariwa community bank, which offered us support with loans. This way many of us were able to start and improve our businesses. For several years I have participated in the "Villa Rayanniyoc" community bank and my peers trust my responsibility and punctuality of my payments. For this reason I request this loan to increase my business' capital. I want to buy more grains such as tarwi, quinoa, corn, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more grains such as tarwi, quinoa, corn, etc

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im S., 72, lives with in Takeo province. He, together with his wife (who is pictured in front of their house), grows rice and weaves palm leaves to sell at the local market. On average, he makes a combined US$1 each day. This couple is supported by their three children, all of whom are garment factory workers.

Im S. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for his children to use to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his childen to use for commuting

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda B. is from the village of South Cogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old. Gilda is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Gilda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Gilda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gilda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Gilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.es: El  SR. VLADIMIR  tiene 38 años vive en casa  de su madre es  separado tiene 1 hijo   de 6 años quien vive con su madre tienen una movilidad  que  lo  administra  su  ex conyuge  es  por ello que no se le esta  considerando en la evalaucion de su carro ,solo  se esta evaluando el ingresos como chofer, cuenta con buenas referencias personales no tiene experiencia crediticia, solicita dicho credito para gastos personales se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo volunta de pago.
texts.en:
Mr. Vladimir is 38 years old, and he lives in his mother’s house. He is separated from his wife and has a six-year-old son, who lives with his mother. His ex-wife manages the vehicle that they share. As a result, he can only count on income from his work as a driver, not from the vehicle itself. He has good personal references, even though he doesn’t have credit history. He is requesting this loan for personal expenses that he plans to use wisely and, above all, plans to repay.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal Expenses

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie O. is 39 and married with eight children. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro to sell.  Julie has three years of experience in this business. Julie needs a loan of 1,000 talas to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $135 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2010, Julie joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Julie's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa A. J. is a married woman with four children aged between 3 and 14. Her business is located at a very busy market known as Likoni in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attractions including the Indian ocean white beaches. 

She sells water to the local people. She has been in business for one year and she says that this business is profitable. She says the major challenge is water supply. When there is shortage of supply to the hawkers, she cannot continue her business. However, she works very hard to keep her business going well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy a water storage tank to be able to reserve water and to meet customer demand. 

She hopes to be a big supplier of water to households in the area in the future. She also hopes to own her own house. She describes herself as kind and understanding.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz Marina G. Ruiz,  es comerciante activa su actividad económica  es venta de ropa usada, su negocio está ubicado en el Reparto primero de mayo con 4 años de experiencia en el negocio.

Este crédito lo utilizo para comprar pacas de mejor calidad el cual le agradece a ceprodel porque hoy compra su producto por pacas ya que antes de obtener créditos compraba por pieza el producto.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz Marina G. Ruiz is an active merchant who sells used clothing in order to earn a living. Her business is located in the May 1st District and she has four years of experience in this field.

This loan will be used to buy bundles of high quality clothing. She is grateful to CEPRODEL because she can now buy merchandise in bundles. Prior to this, she had to buy individual garments on credit.

loans.use: Purchase two bundles of high quality clothing

loans.name: Anayat's Group

texts.en:
Anayat lives in Kasur which is a small city located in Punjab, famous in Pakistan for its tanneries.  She lives in the area of Bhutta Sohan Din with her family in a 2-room brick house. 

She has a thread roll making business. She recovers thread from old warm clothes such as sweaters and sells rolls of it to different thread dealers at the market and earns good income. Her income allows her to pay the utilities for her family. She is married to Y. M. who doesn’t have any specific work. 
  
She has given birth to six sons. She couldn’t provide them formal education due to poor financial conditions. Her two elder sons have an embroidery business; they operate their embroidery shop in the market and contribute to their family financially. 
  
Anayat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s embroidery business. With the loan, they will buy embroidery items such as beads, colored thread, cloth and sketches in bulk quantity that will enable them to fulfill the orders of their customers according to the latest trends.  

Anayat is hopeful that this investment will bring positive changes to their embroidery business and their income will double.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for embroidery business

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members her mother and her grand children). Kasifa has a business selling second hand clothes.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Kasifa sells her products at the market, by means of retail.     

Kasifa has requested for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes.   She also generates additional income through selling piped water at her home.The main business challenge(s) for Kasifa include transportation of bales of clothes from Owino market to Mulago market and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing bales of clothes and also selling at wholesale only.    

Kasifa lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon M., aged 25, is a single businessman. He runs a general shop in Tala where he sells flour, sugar, cooking fat, and hair pieces among other items. His customers come from Tala and its surroundings.  He has been running this business for three years and makes a monthly profit of Kshs 15,000. Simon was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office. He has applied for a loan to increase his inventory. If the loan succeeds in boosting business, Simon plans to expand his shop to wholesale. Simon describes himself as hard-working and dreams of having a wholesale business, getting married, and being able to provide for a family.

loans.use: To buy stocks of sugar, cooking fat, and maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Amna Naveed Hassan's Group

texts.en:
Amna is a resident of Multan, a famous Pakistani city known for its history and culture. She lives there with her family in a two-roomed brick house in the area called Dewan bagh. She came here six years ago when she married N. H..
Amna's husband has a business selling washing machines. He has been in this business for many years and has a good reputation in the market. He gives his customers the advantage of paying for a washing machine in installments. Due to this, people like to buy a washing machines from him than from other sellers.
Amna supports her family by doing embroidery work. She is skilled at this work and likes to do it. In doing this work, she improves her skills and also helps her family financially. She receives orders from her customers in her neighborhood and provides them with the finished work on time in order to make a good income.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase more washing machines and sell them through his shop. She is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her husband and he will make more money from it.
Amna is a mother of two children – a five-year-old son who reads in one class and a three-year-old daughter who is not ready to attend school yet. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will bring good profits to her family.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Amna.

loans.use: To buy washing machines for resale

loans.name: Ana Candelaria

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

La señora Ana fue socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación pero se retiro por unos ciclos y decidió volver ahora es su primer ciclo y nos cuenta que siempre le ha gustado el banco que lo dejó por motivos de viaje. Ella tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y  tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad pero que aún viven en su casa. Su marido se dedica a  la pesca.

Es un ama de casa que para ayudarse y ayudar a su marido se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene un pequeño local en su casa, lo que ella mas vende es ropa de mujer y  también vende ropa de hombres. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00. Su mercadería la va a comprar cada fin de mes a Guayaquil.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, vestidos, blusas y camisetas. Sus sueños son tener una gran boutique.
texts.en:
A place called Los Arenales is in Portoviejo’s Crucita parish.  The members of the Nueva Generación (New Generation) communal bank meet here every two weeks.  The place is known for its beautiful beaches, its gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Ana was a founding member of the Nueva Generación communal bank but she dropped out for two cycles.  She’s now decided to return and this is her first cycle.  She tells us that she’s always liked the bank but dropped out due to travel.  She is 55 years old, married and has two adult children that still live at home with her.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a housewife who started selling clothes to help herself and to help her husband.  She has a small store in her house.  What she sells the most is women’s clothes and she also sells men’s clothes.  She works every day from 8:30am until 4pm.  She goes to Guayaquil at the end of every month to buy merchandise.

This loan will be used to buy pants, dresses, blouses and undershirts.  Her dream is to have a great store.

loans.use: To buy pants, dresses, blouses and undershirts.

loans.name: Otoniel

texts.es:
Otoniel P. N., es apenas un joven de 19 años de edad, el actualmente no estudia ya que por falta de recursos tuvo que truncar sus sueños de seguir estudiando, ésto lo motivo a iniciar algunas labores de trabajo para la obtención de recursos económicos. Él terminó el tercer año de bachillerato y actualemte vive con su madre, en la poblacion llamada San Jaun Cacahuatepec, en mixteco "yuko sihgva". A él le empezo gustar el mundo de las manualidades, y es por eso que desde hace 4 años se dedica a elaborar bordados y manualidades.
Otoniel se intereso por un credito para comprar fomi, papel mache, diferentes tipos de papeles, listones, tela de manta, zatin, botones, agujas, hilos, pagamento blanco, silicón, estos son algunos materiales que utiliza en la elaboracion de bolsas, arreglos, detalles, y otras cosas en comun, nos paltica que este es su primer credito en la vida y que por ese motivo él lo tomara con mucha responsabilidad y cuidado, ya que de esto depende su continuidad en continuar con su negocio.
Por el momento lo que mas le gustaria a Otoniel es consolidar su negocio, teniendo un establecimiento donde pueda poner a la venta sus productos que le elabora, pero el mas anhelado de sus sueño es el de seguir estudiando, el desea con todo su corazón el continuar con su preparación, el espera que en este año pueda ingresara  a alguna escuela para continuar, pero sin descuidar su pequeño negocio.
Le da las gracias a los que apoyan su proyecto, a kiva, a fundacion realidad y a los que hacen posible sus sueños.
Con su apoyo , gracias por la confianza que le brindan en el credito les manda un abrazo y un cordial saludo.
texts.en: Otoniel P. N., a very young man of only 19 years, does not currently study; since he does not have the resources, he had to cut short this dream. This motivated him to start various jobs to secure the necessary economic resources. He has finished his third year of undergraduate studies and currently lives with his mother in the village of San Juan Cacahuatepec, called Yuko Sihgva in Mixteco. He has begun to like the world of handicrafts, and for this reason he has made handcrafts and embroidery for 4 years. Otoniel would like this loan to purchase foam, paper mache, different types of paper, strips, blanket fabric, satin, buttons, needles, thread, white glue, and silicone. These are some of the materials that he uses in the making of purses, baskets, details and other items. He tells us that this is his first loan ever, and so he will be very responsible and careful, since his ability to continue with his business depends on it. At the moment, what he would most like would be to strengthen his business, and to have a store where he could sell his products. However, his greatest wish is to continue studying. He wants with all his heart to continue his education, and hopes that this year he will be able to enroll in a school, but without leaving his small business. He thanks Kiva, those who support his project, Fundacion Realidad, and those who are making his dreams possible. He thanks you for your support and confidence in him through this loan. He sends you a hug and a friendly greeting.

loans.use: The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of materials for the making of crafts and tokens. The materials to be bought are shell paper, foam sheets, felt, white glue, silicon for gluing, quilt fabrics, satin, ribons, skeins, threads, needles, and clasps.

loans.name: Maria Sydney

texts.en:
Maria Sydney is 36-years old single and supports her family by operating two business ventures: networking (natasha, MSE) and electronic re-loading businesses. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her networking (selling Natasha and MSE Personal Products) and electronic re-loading businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6000. Maria Sydney is borrowing PHP 19500 so that she could fund operations.  This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19500, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maria Sydney aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 


About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds in business operations

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 57-year-old widow who supports her family by fishing. She lives in Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1995 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and her own efforts. 

By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Lydia is borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can fund her business operations. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Lydia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the community's respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase materials for a pumpboat renovation

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a member of the Jawabu Njema group in Faulu, Kenya.  He runs a mobile money-transfer business.  He also loves painting and he earns extra income from it.  He really appreciates Faulu Kenya for supporting his business.  This has helped him to provide for his family and to improve his standard of living.  He is determined to open other outlets for his business in the future.  

Francis has requested a loan for 80, 000 Kes to top-up money as floating funds for his business.

loans.use: To add floating funds to money-transfer business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.
