La socia es la Sra: Lucila;  La socia tiene 80 años de edad; La socia es viuda; y tiene 5 hijos todos independientes; La socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura, ella tiene sus terrenos de maíz y papa, la socia cuanta con el apoyo económico y moral de sus hijos, ella es una socia antigua y le gusta tener su dinero propio e invertir, ella desea el monto para poder invertir en la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizante, del tractoreo de sus terrenos, para lo cual está destinando el monto requerido, la socia, trabaj dentro de este banco más de 5 años y es una mujer muy trabajadora y muy sociable, uno de los motivos por los cuales ella se encuentra dentro de este grupo ameno. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas, abono y otros para los terrenos de cultivo.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucila is a member of the Communal Bank “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” which is located in the District of Ollantaytambo, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 80 years old, widowed, and has five children, all of whom are independent. Lucila’s main business activity is farming. She has land on which she grows corn and potatoes. Lucila has the financial and moral support of her children. She is a long-time member and enjoys having her own money to invest. Lucila wants to invest the amount of her loan in the purchase of seeds, compost, and fertilizers to use in plowing her land. She has worked with the Communal Bank for more than five years and is a hardworking and sociable woman. One of the reasons why she joined is because she enjoys being part of a group. Lucila is requesting this loan so that she can purchase seeds, compost, and other supplies for her farmland.

Lucila is satisfied with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, compost, and other supplies for her farmland.

loans.name: Samit

texts.en:
Mr. Samit O., 39 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Srun Lonh, 40 years old, live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and one daughter; one is a garment factory worker, two are in school and another one is still young.

Samit is a motor taxi driver, while his wife sells num onsorm, a kind of Cambodian cake which is made of rice and coconut with soybean and pork in the middle. She buys her ingredients from the market about three kilometers away, makes num onsorm on her own and then sells it in front of the garment factory. In addition, the couple also rents out a space in their house to garment factory workers because their house is located near the factory.

Samit is in the process of building more rooms to rent, but he does not have enough money to pay for the building fees. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of 1,100 USD.

loans.use: To pay for his building fees

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en:
Gigi is 40 years old and is married with 4 children.  With 3 children in school, Gigi works very hard to provide for them.

Gigi runs a rice-retailing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 11 years and has requested a loan of 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more sacks of rice.

In the future, Gigi would like to expand her business to secure her family's future and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for sale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos.  Tiene grado de instrucción educación superior..
Viene trabajando con  el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.  Paralelamente se dedica al cuidado de niños (Wawa Wasi), actividad que la realiza en su misma casa y le permite vender sus productos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 700.00 nuevo soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos, etc.  A veces le ayuda en el negocio su mamá. 
Su sueño es poner un centro educativo inicial y tener una tienda al mayoreo.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones y las reuniones ya que le permite relajarse un poco de las actividades diarias.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the “Flor de Canela” (Cinnamon Flower) communal bank located in Puno District, Puno Province and Department.  She is 40 years old, single and has no children.  She finished higher education.

She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years.  Her first, 300 new sol, loan was invested in her grocery store.  She also cares for children (Wawa Wasi-Government sponsored child care program) in her home which allows her to sell her products.

She will use this new, 700 new sol, loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, etc.  Her mother helps her in the store sometimes.  Her dream is to open an school and to have a wholesale store.

What she likes about the communal bank is the training sessions and the meetings that allow her to relax a bit from her daily activities.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Abdulkosim

texts.ru: Нуров Абдулкосим проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 43 года. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Он занимается растениеводством. Арендует участок земли, где выращивает дыню и арбуз. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Целью кредита является закуп топлива, минеральных удобрений и семян арбуза для посева.
texts.en: N. Abdulkosim lives in Shahrituz. He is 43 years old, married, and has one child. He is a farmer. He rents a plot of land where he grows melons and watermelons. He has been doing this for twelve years.  He is taking out a loan to buy fuel, mineral fertilizer, and watermelon seed.

loans.use: Закуп топлива, минеральных удобрений и семян арбуза для посева

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elisa; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de servicio de cabina de internet y también tiene fotocopiadora, la socia también es profesora del nivel inicial en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m y en las tardes atiende la cabina de internet, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de servicio de internet. La socia solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de la computadoras, para comprar papales y recargar las maquinas impresoras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Perolniyoc". The bank is located in the Urubamba district, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.
The member is Elisa. She is 41 years old, single, and has one daughter. She combines her daily chores with a business running an internet kiosk and photocopier. She is also a first grade teacher in the Ollantaytambo district. She works from 8:00am until 1:00pm and in the afternoons she staffs her internet kisosk. She wants to grow her internet business. She is requesting a loan for the maintenance of the computers, to buy paper, and to recharge the printer cartridges. 
The member is happy to have the loan and promises to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to maintain the computers, to buy paper, and to recharger the printer cartridges.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: María es cliente de hace mucho  años, ella en principio se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo de una empresa muy conocida, pero hace dos años atrás esa actividad la realiza en menor escala, siendo ahora su actividad principal la repostería, ella prepara para la venta pan, queques  de plátano , naranja y pies de manzana o limón, comercializando por la zona y algunas pastelerías de la zona sur,  también realiza tortas a pedido para cumpleaños, ella es una persona joven al igual que su esposo, tienen dos hijos pequeños a los que cuida mientras trabaja preparando sus masitas, el esposo trabaja con movilidad en el un taxi trufis de la zona sur, con el dinero de crédito comprar un horno industrial y así mejorar su elaboración de tortas, el deseo de la Sra. María es el de tener su propia pastelería, ya que la señora demuestra muchas ganas de superarse, es muy trabajadora y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
María has been a client for many years. At first she worked selling cosmetics by catalog from a well-known company, but for two years she has been doing that business on a smaller scale. Now her bakery is her main business. She makes and sells bread, banana and orange cakes and lemon and apple pies. She sells them in her area and also to several pastry shops further south. She also makes birthday cakes to order.

María and her husband are both young. They have two small children and she takes care of them while she works making her pastries. Her husband works in transportation and drives a taxi in the south. With the money from this loan María will buy an industrial oven and thus increase her cake production. María's dream is to have her own pastry shop. She shows a strong desire to get ahead and is very hard-working. She is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial oven.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 63-year-old married woman. She lives in the community of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Her husband is a farmer in their community. She and her husband till their small rice farm to be able to raise their family.

With the loan coming from Community Economic Ventures Inc., she can buy fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. In the future, Erlinda hopes to have a bigger farm and more profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Liliana Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Liliana de 53 años, es originaria de Managua capital de Nicaragua pero vive en la ciudad de León, ella es casada, tiene tres hijos, ella estudio un técnico para asistente de laboratorio. Pero hace 14 años decidió dedicarse al mundo del comercio fue a los 38 años de edad que empezó hacerse comerciante, comenzó vendiendo ropa y zapatos  ambulantes. Hoy en día solo tiene una pequeña vitrina donde muestra sus productos además de los que ella vende ambulante. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería de ropa, zapatos y joyas de platas para vender, pues quiere vender fuera de León para hacer nuevos clientes, mejorar sus ventas y dar a conocer sus productos en otros departamentos del país como Chinandega donde ella considera que el comercio es bueno para vender. Su meta próxima es poner una tienda de mercadería en general en el mercado central de la ciudad de León y hacer clientes en la ciudad de Chinandega.
texts.en: Liliana, 53, is a native of the Managua, the capital city of Nicaragua, but she lives in the city of Leon.  She is married and has 3 children.  She studied to become a lab assistant, but 14 years ago she decided to devote herself to the world of commerce.  When she was 38, she started working in retail trade, selling clothing and shoes in an itinerant manner.  Today she only has a small glass case where she displays products in addition to those that she sells on the street.  She needs a loan to buy merchandise including clothing, shoes and silver jewelry to sell.  She wants to sell outside of Leon so that she can sell to new customers, improve her sales, and raise awareness of her products in other departments of the country such as Chinandega, where she thinks it would be good place to sell.  Her next goals are to have a general store in the central market of Leon, and to attract new customers in the city of Chinandega.

loans.use: to buy merchandise including clothing, shoes and silver jewelry

loans.name: Zaldy

texts.en:
Zaldy is 44 years old and married with one child to care for. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. For the past two years, Zaldy has been making his living as a motorcycle driver to help provide for his family’s daily needs. He earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

Zaldy is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to purchase tires and spare parts to keep his motorcycle in good running condition and continue his business. He has been a member of GDMPC for the past year. In the future, Zaldy hopes to increase his income with his remodeled and smooth-running motorcycle and service.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a blacksmith working in one shop. Their income is $7 per day. She has one child who is two months old. Her family lives with her mother. Every month she has to spend $35 on food, $10 on transportation, $5 on electricity and $25 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. In the future, she wants to get a small shop for husband to be a blacksmith by himself.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Djatugbé

texts.fr:
Djatugbé est une femme âgée de 43ans. Elle est marié å un transitaire. Elle a 03 enfants en charge.  
Djatugbé travaille comme revendeur de produits d’alimentation générale et de charbons de bois depuis 2005. 
Elle vend à domicile. Elle achète au Grand Marché de Lomé. 
Djatugbé a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale et des charbons.
texts.en:
Djatugbé, 43, is married to a forwarding agent and is raising three children. She has been working selling groceries and charcoal since 2005. She sells out of her home. She buys her goods at the Grand Market in Lomé. 

Djatugbé has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy grocery products and charcoal.

loans.use: to buy groceries and sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 50 years old and married with five children. She earns a living as a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for 27 years. Marlyn works hard to increase her earnings and help provide a better quality of life for her family. She earns about 10,000 PHP a month. 

Marlyn is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes her business will help her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is aged 29 and married with one child aged four. He has been in active farming for seven years and produces beans, maize, potatoes and wheat for the local market and middlemen. He earns additional income from plowing others farmers' farms.
Julius has requested a loan of 63,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional income will provide for his family's basic needs and improve their living standards. He reiterates that dairy farming is currently lucrative and he looks forward to buying two more dairy cows to earn a better income.
However, Julius notes that animal diseases are a challenge to farmers. He commends Juhudi Kilimo services and notes that they are very fast.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lophay

texts.en:
Lophay is 54 years old and is a motorbike taxi driver who earns 5 USD daily. His wife is a gardener who earns 2 USD each day. The couple has four children, two of whom are studying and two who are working in Thailand, each earning 5 USD every day. Each month, Lophay has to spend 75 USD on rent, 3.5 USD on electricity, 25 USD on school fees, and 10 USD on other expenses. 

Lophay is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy a new motorbike for his business as his current motorbike is old. In the future he has two plans: to buy a small car and continue his taxi service and to open a motorbike repair shop since he has some knowledge of engine repair.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: C 1921 Iriba Group

texts.en:
Beatha is 29 years old and married. She has one child who is 1 year old and she takes care of two people. She is a leader of this group, which is called “Iriba” in local language. This means "River" in English. She is the third person from the left side. 

Beatha sells cassava flour. She currently employs two people to help her and she has been working for four years. 

Beatha and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses and to purchase a large quantity of cassava flour to sell. With any profits from the loan, Beatha and her team would like to satisfy the basic needs of their families, reinvest in their businesses and start saving for their future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of cassava flour to resell.

loans.name: Chroep

texts.en:
Chroep raises pigs at home, while her husband, Khim is a policeman. They live in a village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1986 and have three children, one son and two daughters. 

Chroep is asking for another loan of $500 to assist in her pig farming business by buying pig feed.

loans.use: To assist in her pig farming business by buying pig feed.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is 44 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has six children who are all currently in school. For the past 14 years, Ivan has been working hard to manage his clothing shop where he sells new clothes at the local market. 

To help expand his business, Ivan is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more women's clothing. His loan will help Ivan to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Ivan hopes that in the future he will be able to open up a poultry farm.
 
Ivan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ivan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy home appliances.

loans.name: Elva Rosalía

texts.es: Elva es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad, tiene 40 años, ella es dueña de un empresa de transporte y flete además vende agregados, es madre de 2 niños, es socia de Finca Peru desde hace 11 años, ella empezó con una tienda de abarrotes y viajaba a las ferias, y cambio de negocio a la de los agregados y se pudo comprar sus carros con la ayuda de Finca y porque le enseñaron a poder ahorrar, agradece la confianza que le brindan, le ayudan a poder tener un historial crediticio bueno, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de combustible, su gran meta es poder construir su casa.
texts.en: Elva is a member of the Prosperidad community bank.  She is 40 years old and owns a transport business.  She also sells aggregates.  She is the mother of two children and has been a member of Finca Peru for 11 years.  She started out running a grocery store and traveling to street markets.  She changed business and started selling aggregates.  She was able to buy her cars with the help of Finca because they taught her to save.  She is grateful for the trust that is placed in her and for the help that she has had in establishing a good credit record.  She will invest her current loan in buying fuel.  Elva's biggest goal is to build her house.

loans.use: to buy fuel

loans.name: Maria Shirley

texts.es:
María tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío CP-2 Colera del Distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la Región Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito. Solo cuenta con de luz eléctrica.

María se dedica a la crianza de ganado porcino y aves de corral, teniendo actualmente 10 porcinos, 12 gallinas, los cuales cría y engorda  y una vez con peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en mercado local. Además cuenta con 0.5 ha de terreno que su padre le ha dado como herencia en el cual tiene sembrado limón que cosecha semanalmente. Su conviviente la apoya en las actividades que realiza. Estas actividades se han constituido como las principales fuentes de ingresos para su familia por lo que siempre se esfuerzan para sacarla adelante.

María desea brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos, asimismo desea invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de sus animales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora. Junto a su esposo se esfuerzan diariamente para progresar y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She lives in her own home which is located in the small village of CP-2 Colera, in Tambogrande district, in Piura region, four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.  The client lives in the rural part of the district and only receives electricity.

María raises pigs and farmyard birds.  She currently has 10 pigs and 12 hens which she raises and fattens.  Once they have reached an ideal size and weight, she sells them in the local market.  María also has half a hectare of land that her father gave her as an inheritance and there she grows lemons which she harvests every week.  Her partner supports her in her business activities.  These business activities have been the main sources of income for her family and so they are always working hard to make progress in them.

María would like to maintain her crops and would also like to invest in buying nutritionally-balanced feed to improve her animal production.  for this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

María is a hard-working and tenacious woman.  Together with her partner, she works hard every day to make progress and provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her livestock

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Merly has a shop that sells viands such as fried chicken, menudo (meat stew) and afritada (tomato-sauce-based stew). She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy the raw ingredients needed for making viands.
Merly has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen, 40 years old, is married and has two children.  He has operated a grocery store for eight years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business because he has been able to access financial resources easily. Stephen has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy fruits and  vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rosalie has a food shop, or "sari-sari" store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rosalie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Elias Lucas

texts.es:
El socio Elías pertenece al banco comunal NUEVA GENERACION III ,el socio tiene 58 años de edad 02 hijos y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias  a brindar el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva buen tiempo realizando su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio trabaja todos los días transportando a sus pasajeros a los distintos lugares que le solicitan, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia. 
El socio solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su carro como en el cambio de aceite.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elías, 58, belongs to Nueva Generación III Communal Bank.  He has two children and is single.

Elías divides his time between his daily activities and offering taxi service.  He spends a good amount of time at his job, which is going well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his business every day.  He works every day transporting his passengers to the various places they request.  He wants to be able to keep on working and supporting his family.

Elías is requesting the loan to perform maintenance on his car, such as changing the oil.

He's grateful for the loan and promises to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car

loans.name: Fausto

texts.en:
My name is Fausto and I sell sweet snacks, very similar to ice cream. It is a street vending business, six days a week and my earnings allow me to help my children. My plans are to buy another cart and to hire a young person to sell from it, and in this way increasing my earnings.

Mi nombre es Fausto y me dedico a vender granizados de sabores, que es muy parecido al ice cream, mi negocio es ambulante salgo a las calles a vender 6 dias a la semana y mis ganancias me ayudan ayudar a mis hijos. Mis planes es comprar otra carreta y contratar algun joven para que vendo y de esta manera mejorar mis ingresos.

loans.use:
To purchase sugar, fruit, honey, ice, glasses, condensed milk, vanilla and other items

Compra de azucar, frutas, miel, hielo, vasos, pajillas, leche condensada, vainilla y otros.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two children. She always wanted to be an entrepreneur and saw many opportunities everywhere she looked. Irina decided on a small business selling clothing and footwear for women and today she runs a vending kiosk in one of the local markets. Currently, Irina has about $4,000 of working capital in her business and she makes about $600 a month in net profit. Irina is very cheery and optimistic. Her radiant smile and ability to make her clients feel welcome at her kiosk attracts many potential customers and helps her business grow. Irina has been a client with “Nadiya Ukraine” since 2002. Irina is requesting a loan for $1,000 to open a new vending facility where she would like to begin selling shoes. She is planning to rent a facility, do all the necessary remodeling and purchase a variety of shoes, sneakers and sandals in preparation for the spring season. Irina’s business and marketing abilities in combination with financial assistance will help her to get this new venture off the ground and further increase her success and income.

Ірина – одружена, в неї двоє дітей. Вона завжди хотіла бути підприємцем, вміла бачити можливості для цього навколо. Ірина вирішила відкрити власний бізнес з продажу жіночого одягу та взуття. Зараз в неї є торгівельна точка на одному з місцевих ринків. В Ірини приблизно 4000 доларів робочого капіталу, щомісяця вона заробляє приблизно 600 доларів чистого прибутку. Ірина - дуже жвава та оптимістична. Її промениста посмішка та привітна вдача приваблюють багато потенційних покупців до її кіоску, що, в свою чергу, сприяє росту її бізнесу. Ірина співпрацює з „Надією України” з 2002 року. Ірина просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб відкрити нову торгівельну точку з продажу взуття. Вона планує орендувати приміщення, зробити необхідний ремонт та закупити різноманітне взуття, а саме, кеди та босоніжки напередодні весняного періоду. Досвід Ірини в сфері бізнесу та маркетингу у поєднанні з фінансовою підтримкою допоможе їй досягти мети, збільшити власні прибутки та зробити свій бізнес успішним.

loans.use: To open a new vending facility

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga supports herself and her twelve-year-old son with a small business selling clothing for kids and teenagers. She has operated her business for seven years and has developed a reputation as a kind, consistent, and honest entrepreneur. Before starting her own business, she worked as a manager in a cafeteria. This experience helps her today as she seeks to provide good service to her customers.

Olga has requested a loan to increase her available working capital. She will be able to use this money to purchase new inventory from suppliers which she does regularly 2 to 3 times per month. Olga’s desire is to continue working to improve the living standard for herself and her son. Eventually, she would like to have some remodeling work done to her home. Through her hard work and consistency, Olga’s business should allow her to fulfill this goal and continue to provide for herself into the future.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up her general store

loans.name: I Ketut

texts.id:
The older the better, an accurate slogan for this grandfather of 4. This 62 year old I Ketut W. is still strong and enthusiastic, although his beloved wife was called home earlier by the Lord. Although staying with the oldest son, W. does not want to be a burden to him. All his children have their own families. To support his food and daily needs, W. is dependent on the animals he raised, initialy it was cow farming. However after his wife passed away, W. had to sell his cow to pay for her funeral ceremony cost. Since 2 years ago W. change profession by raising pigs. With 2 mother pigs, W. could profit nett Rp 350,000 (about $37)/month. This income was used to pay for his daily food expenses. With a loan from DINARI for Rp 130,000 (about $150) W. wants to buy 1 other mother pig, and the rest to buy animal feed. Afterwards W. would not be afraid to shortage of his income, since sales of his baby pigs could reached Rp750,000 (about 80)/month, and with that he could fulfill his daily needs, and maybe even save a little.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Semakin tua semakin jadi, slogan ini sangat tepat di tujukan kepada kakek yang sudah mempunyai .4 orang cucu ini. Lelaki yang lahir 62 tahun silam yang bernama I Ketut W. tampak masih begitu kekar dan bersemangat walaupun istri yang di cintainya sudah lebih dahulu di panggil sang pencipta, tinggal bersama anak sulungnya W. tak mau menjadi beban anak-anaknya yang semuanya sudah memiliki keluarga sendiri. Untuk biaya makan dan kebutuhan sehari- hari W. sangat tergantung pada hasil ternak peliharaanya yang pada awalnya adalah ternak sapi. Tapi setelah di tinggal oleh istrinya, W. harus merelakan sapinya dijual untuk biaya ngaben. sejak 2 tahun lalu W. berubah profesi memelihara babi. Dgn 2 ekor induk babi saat itu W. bisa mendapat keuntungan bersih Rp 350.000 per bulan. uang inilah yg W. gunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan makan sehari hari. Dengan Pinjaman Dari DINARI sebesar Rp 1.300.000 W. membeli 1 ekor induk lagi dan sisanya di pergunakan untuk biaya pakan ternaknya. Kini W. tak kuatir lagi dengan penghasilannya karena dari hasil penjualan anak babinya sekarang yang mencapai Rp 750.000/ bln W. bisa memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari dan sisanya di tabung.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en: Tatiana operates two adjacent kiosks at an outdoor market in Buiucani, a suburb of Moldova's capital city, Chisinau. She sells clothing and accessories for women and girls, who come to her kiosks because they offer a nice selection of goods. When it’s time to restock, Tatiana makes her purchases from a wholesale warehouse that has low-priced imported and domestically-manufactured products. Tatiana would like to increase her sales by opening another booth in a different part of the market, but obtaining the necessary space is not cheap. She needs a loan of $1,150 to pay for a permit and a small piece of land located in a high-visibility, high-traffic part of the market that will attract lots of new customers. If she gets the loan, she expects to be so busy in peak season that she will need help from her daughters to tend shop.

loans.use: Working capital to expand her business and increase sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fix the roof in their school.

loans.name: Veni

texts.en:
This is 19 year-old Veni M. from Mbeya, Tanzania. She is married with one child, aged 18 months. In 2007 Veni established a french fries stall, and now requires a loan of $150 in order to purchase ingredients and equipment. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and cooking utensils for her french fries stall.

loans.name: Khojalbuvy

texts.en: Khojalbuvy M. lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 5 children.  Mrs. M. applied to the MicroInvest because she heard many successful business stories. She is engaged in the family business of  socks yam and selling. It is the business where her daughter and daughter-in-law help her. Mrs M. has serious problems with her health.  She has been engaged in this work  all her life so she is very experienced and ready to share her experience. Now Mrs. M. requests a loan of $650 for 8 months for a new kind of raw yarn purchasing.

loans.use: a new kind of raw yarn purchasing

loans.name: Chiku's Neema Group

texts.en:
Chiku is 34 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, aged 16, 14, 12, and 4. Chiku is a decorations seller, and she started her business in 2006. Every day she works from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Chiku now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing in clothes selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Doeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Doeun T., age 35, is a mother of four children, and stays at home to look after the children. She cooks food for her entire family. Meanwhile, her husband, Mr. Dosh Chea, 52, works in construction, building houses and earning $5 a day of profit.

Mr. Dosh Chea requests a loan from Kiva to purchase wood to install in the house.

loans.use: To purchase wood to fix the leaking roof.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa E. is a thirty-three-year-old business woman. She is married with three children aged 13, 10, and 6 years respectively. She sells charcoal and used clothing in a nearby community market. She is happy that her first loan worked miracles in her business and family situation since her family now enjoys improved living conditions.

She wants to use the next loan to buy more supplies of charcoal and bales of used clothes to increase her stock. She believes this will help her meet her customers' demands and allow her to increase her income for her children’s education.

Theresa belongs to the community group called Nyame Asomafo (God’s Ambassadors). Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan capital.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of charcoal and bales of used clothes

loans.name: Yalchin

texts.en: Yalchin is single. He was born in 1980. He has been in clothing sales business for 5 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town and has settled in the Fuzuli region. Now he requests a loan of $975 to buy more inventory for his business.  He promises to repay the loan in full on time.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Veronica Owembabazi ’S Group

texts.en:
Veronica, 37, is the leader of this 5-member group. She is a single mother with two children,14 and 9 years old. Both children are in school. Veronica had an accident that caused the amputation of one of her legs.

The community she lives in is semi-urban. One of her challenges is the ever-increasing house rent fees due to the influx of Sudanese war migrants. Veronica deems this as a challenge because she may be thrown out of the house if she fails to pay what these migrants can offer the landlords.

She has recently taken a loan of Shillings 500,000/= (US$ 310) .She used the loan to increase her stock and pay rent for three months. She is able to meet the family's basic needs out of the profits she makes from her business.

She is able to send her children to school, fend for her family better, and has learnt to be hard-working because of MCDT loans. She has managed to make herself a metal kiosk, thus reducing the hazards of the weather. There is a ready market for her merchandise.

One of her plans is to make this kiosk bigger to create space for a refrigerator so that she can pack ready-to-eat fruits and fruit juice for sale. She would like to buy a plot of land and build a house.

She has successfully paid back 8 loans.

loans.use: Increase Stock

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
H. Khosiyat is 32 years old. She is divorced and has two children. She is a hard-working mother struggling to feed her children and parents (who are living with her) by selling the for traditional dresses. Khosiyat has survived despite difficult circumstances thanks to her optimism and strives above all to care for her two children. Like any mother, Khosiyat is doing her best to educate her children and to make them happy.

Khosiyat has a trading place in the central market of Dushanbe city. All the fabrics are supplied from the neighboring town Istaravshan. Khosiyat is trying to have a wide range of goods to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income. Today Khosiyat feels that with more working capital her business could generate more income, so she is asking for a loan of 1000 USD with a term of 12 months to jump-start the business and raise the family's standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase new fabrics

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. sells maize, beans, and other food items at Yammoransah on the Cape Coast. Mercy has received a junior high education, is married, and has 3 children. Her husband is a carpet dealer. Mercy has been selling maize, beans, and other food items since 1993. She is responsible for paying the school fees and feeding the family. Her loan will be used to buy more maize, beans, and other food items from the farmers to be sold at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to assist her husband in building a family house.

loans.use: To buy more maize, beans, and other food items

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana tiene 34 años, es madre D. 4 hijos que son su razón D. ser y D. salir adelante en su negocio, peluquería, se dedica a  esta actividad desD. hace mucho tiempo, a razón D. haber estudiado en un centro ocupacional, este oficio.Liliana apoya mucho a su esposo, quien se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes por los diferentes caseríos del río Ucayali. Ella pertenece a un banco comunal, y gracias al apoyo que le dan invierte en su peluquería y lo demás en abarrotes, ya que es lo que más produce. Ahora necesita D. una cantidad D. dinero para alquilar un local e instalar su peluquería y desD. luego quiere incrementar el negocio D. abarrotes y brindar lo necesario a los clientes D. su esposo y así, juntos, salir adelante.
texts.en:
Liliana is 34 years old and a mother of four children that are her reason for being and to move forward in her business, a hair salon. Her career has been in hairstyling for a long time because she studied it as her primary occupation. Liliana greatly supports her husband, who has a career in selling groceries to the different farm houses around the Ucayali River. She belongs to the community bank, and thanks to the investment they have given her hair salon and subsequently, her husband’s grocery business, she has already been able to produce more income. Now she needs this loan to rent a local store to open the hair salon and also from which she could increase her grocery business. This will allow her to proviD. what is necessary to her husband’s customers, and in this way, together, they can move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a local store to open a hair salon and also from which to increase the grocery sales of her husband.

loans.name: Karen Rozana

texts.es:
La señorita Karen pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito”, ubicado en el Jr. 2 de Mayo Nº. 200, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo,  departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas. Tiene un año trabajando con el Banco Comunal.
 
En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de bebidas (gaseosas, frugos, agua mineral, yogurt y otros). En las mañanas estudia en la UNU y por las tardes se dedica a su negocio, el cual le brinda buenas ganancias.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 10 cajas de gaseosas chicas, 5 paquetes de gaseosas descartables, 6 paquetes de frugos, néctar y otros.  

Karen se siente una mujer realizada e independiente gracias a la ayuda que le brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Karen belongs to the "Mujeres de Exito"(Successful Women) Communal Bank, located in Jr. 2 de Mayo # 200, Calleria district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 22 years old and is single. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos (300 soles-Peruvian currency), Karen decided to invest it on selling carbonated beverages (sodas). She has been working with the Coomunal Bank for one year.

Currently, she sells beverages (sodas, fruit juices, mineral water, yogurt and others). In the mornings, she studies at the UNU and in the afternoons she tends to the business which gives her good earnings. With this 1700 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which will be pay in 5 months, Karen will buy 10 boxes of small sodas, 5 packages of disposable sodas, 6 packets of fruit juices, nectars, and others.

Karen feels fulfilled and independent thanks to the help that Manuela Ramos offers to her.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy carbonated beverages, fruit juices, water, etc.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a member of the Santa Rita Village Bank.  Diana is 21 years old and single. She sells a variety of adult and children’s clothing in a rented stall at the April 12th Market. She works every day from 7am to 7pm.  Diana needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy t-shirts and pants.  Diana’s dreams are to sell her wares in bulk and to have her own workshop to produce clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
 
Diana es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita. 
Diana es soltera y tiene 21 años, Diana vende ropa en un puesto alquilado del mercado 12 de abril, en donde vende ropa variada para niños, adultos, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. 
Diana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos pantalones. 
Los sueños de Diana son ser mayorista, tener un taller de producción de prendas de vestir.

loans.use: Buy t-shirts and pants to sell in the market.

loans.name: Edgardo Jose

texts.es: El señor Edgar José Palacio tiene la edad  de 40 años,  habita en el sector de la borgoña ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a sus esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante , para poder ayudarle con los gastos del hogar , don Edgar es agricultor y comerciante desde hace dieciocho años , la mayor dificultad que de le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento , los planes hacia un futuro en mejorar los cultivos para poder vender en buen precio ya que estos carecen de insumos y por tanto no hay buena producción .El solicita un financiamiento para poder comprar insumos y aplicárselos al cultivo y obtener mejores beneficios en las ventas, y a si obtendrá mejores ingresos
texts.en:
Mr. Edgar Jose Palacio is 40 years old and lives in the area of Borgoña, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife, who works as a merchant in order to help him with the household bills. Edgar has been a farmer and merchant for the past 18 years. The greatest difficulty he has encountered is the lack of financing. His future plans are to improve his crop to sell at a better price, but since he lacks supplies there is not a good crop production. He is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies to use in his cultivation, and therefore produce better profits in his sales and earn a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Christina Stoddard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies like fertilizer for his crop

loans.name: Samaya

texts.en:
Samaya M. is a very hard-working woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has five children. She works raising and feeding animals with the goal of later selling them. This activity creates feelings of satisfaction in her because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. The care that she takes to feed the animals and supply them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their population and so now she guides them into the field each day for grazing.

She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her adorable grandchildren. She wants to improve her stable stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to buy two baby calves and fodder for her animals. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Johnny

texts.es: Johnny tiene 38 años de edad, viene conviviendo cerca de 8 años con su pareja, es padre de dos hijos que son el motivo de su desvelo, esta familia vive por el momento en una casa alquilada. Desde muy pequeño ha visto trabajar a sus padres en las labores agrícolas sembrando café y frutos cítricos, y fue esta labor que les dio ciertas comodidades cuando aun vivía con sus padres. Pero ahora que su padre ya está anciano, él se hizo cargo de las chacras. Paralelo a ello, hace 6 meses exactamente viene trabajando con un motocarro alquilado haciendo servicio de transporte de pasajeros, iniciando su labor a las 6.00am hasta 11.00pm de la noche, donde obtiene neto la suma 40 soles diarios. En el poco tiempo que viene trabajando con la moto se ha dado cuenta que  le agrada este tipo de trabajo, inclusive ha pensando comprase una propia, porque le sería más rentable. Y sumando a esto las ganancias obtenidas por sus cultivos, sabe que mejorará considerablemente su situación económica. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, tiene muchas expectativas positivas del trabajo en su banco comunal, el resto de los integrantes lo han nombrado secretario y él recibió el cargo con mucho entusiasmo, espera no defraudar a sus compañeros, ni a los que confían en su trabajo. El dinero que solicita es para el pago del alquiler de la moto por 4 meses adelantados, y evitar que lo alquilen a otra persona; el resto del dinero es para la compra de fertilizantes de para sus cultivos de cítricos.
texts.en:
Johnny is 38 years old, has lived nearly 8 years with his partner, and is the father of 2 children who are the motivation for his efforts. The family lives, for the moment, in a rented home. Since he was very young, Johnny has seen his parents working as farmers, growing coffee and citrus fruits, and it is this work which has given his parents the few comforts they currently have. Now that his father is older, Johnny is in charge of the fields. At the same time, for the past six months exactly, he has been using a rented motorized rickshaw to chauffeur passengers. He begins this work at 6 in the morning and works until 11 at night, making a net 40 soles a day. In the short time he has been driving he has realized he enjoys this kind of work, and has thought of buying a rickshaw of his own, as it would be mO. profitable. Adding to this the profits from the crops, he knows that he will be able to significantly improve his economic situation. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he has many positive expectations about working with a communal bank. The other members have named him secretary, and he accepted the post with a great deal of enthusiasm. He hopes not to disappoint his co-members or those who trust in his work. He is requesting the loan in order to pay the rent on the rickshaw for the next four months, to avoid it being rented to another person. The rest of the money will be used to buy fertilizers for his citrus plants.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Advance payment of rent for motorized rickshaw used for work

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita tiene 25 años, vive con su pareja en su casa, aún no tienen hijos. Se dedica esforzadamente a la venta de zapatos solo para damas, estos calzados los lleva a vender por las distintas zonas de su localidad, y los deja al crédito o al contado. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años atrás y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es tratar bien a sus clientes y sobre todo conocer varios lugares. Anita cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien la ayuda a vender y esto le genera muchos más ingresos. En el futuro quiere poner una zapatería solo para damas. Es la primera vez recibe un crédito de MFP, le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal porque le brindó la oportunidad que otros no le dieron. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un local donde podrá exhibir y guardar sus zapatos adecuadamente, y sobre todo dará una mejor acogida sus clientes.
texts.en:
Anita is 25 years old and lives with her boyfriend in their house: they don't have any children yet. She devotes her time to selling women's shoes, which she takes to sell in different areas in her region, making sales on credit or in cash. She started this business three years ago and it is going very well. What she likes about this work is providing good service to her customers and above all getting to know different places. Anita depends on the support of her partner who helps her with sales and this helps generate much more income. In the future she wants to set-up a ladies' shoe-shop . This is the first time she has received a credit from MFP, and she likes working with the community bank because they have provided her with opportunity that others haven't. With the money she's asked for she will be commission the construction of a site where she can show and store her shoes adequately, and above all give a better welcome to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a site for her business

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.ru:
Садриддин  работает в магазине уже более 5 лет. Он зарабатывает что бы купить себе дом и переехать туда. Он до сих пор  живет с родителями и ему хочется  отделиться, так как у него есть своя семья, и растут дети. 
Брат Садриддина взял в партнеры, и пол товара привозит Садриддин сам. Сейчас магазин перестраивают   и переносят ближе к дороге. Тем самым они хотят повысить свою прибыль. 
Он благодарен КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Sadriddin has been working in a store for more than 5 years. He is earning money so that he can purchase himself a house and move there. He still lives with his parents and would like to separate as he has his own family and the children are growing. Sadriddin’s brother took him on as a partner and Sadriddin brings half of the products himself. Right now they are remodeling their store and moving it closer to the road. They are doing this because they want to increase their profits. He is grateful to KIVA for its support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business development

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal N., 37, and her husband, Mr. Sakhoeun EE, 41, who live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh were married in 1997 and have two children: one son who is in school and one young daughter.

Sophal has been a silk weaver for ten years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. Mr. Sakhoeun EE has been a farmer for ten years as well. Sophal is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase silk material, to set up a loom and to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk material, to set up a loom, and to repair her house.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia K. is married with two children. For six years, she has worked as a trader selling fried fish. She also prepares food for sale in Siwdo. Her husband is employed as a farmer. Afia uses her income to pay for the various expenses of her family such as school fees and utility bills.

Afia will use this loan to purchase additional oil, fish and other foodstuffs for cooking and selling. She plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her trade.

loans.use: To purchase additional oil, fish and other foodstuffs for cooking and selling

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Thực Lê Thị, 46 years old, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has three adult-aged children. Thực owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising ducks for sale. Thực has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Thực joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Thực has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

Thực is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase ducklings to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the third loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Thực plans to use the additional revenue that the loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase ducklings to raise and sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience plants pineapples, peppers and plantain on her farm. She is 46 years old and married with two children. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more pineapple suckers to plant. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more pineapple suckers to plant

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny M. is requesting PHP7,000 as additional working capital for her buy and sell slippers business. She is 29 years old and very much dedicated to her chosen business. She also manages to raise pigs aside from her buy and sell business. She hopes that the loan she plans to borrow will be a big help towards the development of her business in the future. Jenny is married to Bryan M. who works as a casual government employee in their town. They are blessed with two children: Melchie and Shaia Renzo. Jenny dreams of having her business stall someday in their town proper and becoming successful in her business endeavor.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Hermen Abed

texts.es:
el señor Hermen Abed N. Zuniga tiene 31 años de edad, es vecino del barrio la ceibita, esta casado con la señora Jessi Espinal Aguilar,  tienen tres hijos estan en la escuela.
ella se dedica a cuidar a los niños y atender la casa, el se dedica a la carpinteria, tiene un taller en su casa de habitacion, el fabrica muebles como ser: juegos de comedor, puertas, ventanas,
sillas, camas, chineros, comodas y todo lo relacionado con la carpinteria.
tiene su negocio desde hace 02 años el local es propio y necesita el crédito para comprar madera, sellador, barnis,y clavos. ya que desea trabajar con un contrato de fabricar chineros para una casa comercial y asi podra tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Hermen Abed N. Zúñiga, 31, lives in the Ceibita neighborhood. He is married to Jessi Espinal Aguilar. They have three children who go to school. She takes care of the children and the house. He is a carpenter. He has his shop in his house. He makes furniture like dining room sets, doors, windows, chairs, beds, china cupboards, dressers, and everything that has to do with carpentry. He has had this business for two years, and the place is his own. He needs a loan to buy wood, sealant, varnish, and nails. He wants to work with a contract to make china cabinets for a commercial house. That way he will be able to have greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood, paint, varnish, sealant, and nails.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
After overcoming many hardships, including the loss of her husband to gun violence in 2002, Valerie has finally achieved her long-time dream of owning her own business.

Valerie is the owner of SPA-bulous! A Spa Retreat for FA-bulous Women! in Hayward, CA. SPA-bulous! is a place for women to rejuvenate themselves and also receive education on personal well-being. Valerie has a passion for helping women and keeps the spa open in the evening and weekends to give working mothers access to her services. In addition, SPA-bulous! donates free services to fundraisers for breast cancer, domestic violence, and other charities close to Valerie’s heart.

A single mother, Valerie continues to raise her three-year-old son, work a full time job, and run her business, while trying to complete her bachelor’s degree this fall. She also mentors other single mothers to stay motivated and keep their dream alive.

A $3,000 loan will allow Valerie to replace broken equipment at her spa, such as a steamer and facial bed.

loans.use: Replacement equipment for spa services

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort O. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through primary. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Comfort sells bags of maize and dried fish at Nkontrodo, Elmina, which she has done since 2001. She uses her income to pay bills. She will use the loan to buy more of the food supplies for resale.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to build a house so she has started saving towards it.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies for resale

loans.name: Bengoma #3 Group

texts.en:
Bengoma #3 is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Musa K., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia. Musa is married with 2 kids, age 1 and 3. Musa is 27 years old, and was 3 years old when he was orphaned. He lives in nearby Borkeza Town.  

Musa runs a soap production business, both producing and selling it in the Borkeza market. He has been running his business for 3 years, and with the loan he will purchase raw materials (custy soda, fuel, palm oil, etc) to grow inventory in order to meet demand. Musa is successful because of excellent products and customer service. With the profits he will build a permanent shop in town and save for his children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for soap production.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Driving a motor taxi is the daily work of 56-year-old Chen S.. In addition, Chen S. also buys fresh fish in bulk for his wife to retail at the busy local  market. This couple typically earns around US $5 a day. Chen S. has been blessed with six children: one of them is married and the others are single. To help cover the family’s expense, one of the children works in a hotel. Chen S. needs a loan of US $1000 which he will use to improve the fish business. The rest will be used to begin selling cooking supplies from home.

loans.use: To improve a fish selling business and to begin selling cooking supplies

loans.name: Khien

texts.en: Mrs. Khien D. is a widow in Romeat village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1 hectare field to cultivate rice. She now has a problem with this farming because she does not have the ability to purchase fertilizers to support the field, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field and make her crops more productive. She has two children, one of whom is a farmer and the other is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to support the field and make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: A. Sylvie est née le 26-09-1973 et vit depuis dix huit ans au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à KPONDEHOU Cosme, un affairiste, Sylvie est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Sylvie et Cosme supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Après avoir arrêté les études au secondaire, Sylvie s’est mise depuis seize ans dans la vente de maïs, du haricot et de la farine de manioc. En effet, Sylvie s’approvisionne aux marchés de Houègbo et de Glazoué, marchés des produits vivriers au Bénin. Sylvie est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a obtenu antérieurement trois crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés à ALIDé. Pour accroître et diversifier son activité, Sylvie sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé afin de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
A. Sylvie was born on September, 26, 1973. For 18 years, she has been living in the Cadjèhoun district in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Married to KPONDEHOU Cosme, a wheeler-dealer, she is the mother of two children who are in school. Sylvie and Cosme together support the family. After having halted her studies in secondary school, Sylvie started selling corn, beans, and cassava flour sixteen years ago. Basically, she stocks up at the marketplace of Houègbo and Glazoué, which sells staple foods in Benin. She is a former ALIDé client who obtained three loans before, which she repaid to ALIDé. To grow and diversify her business, Sylvie is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé in order to cope better with customer demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, beans, and cassava flour

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 46-year-old married woman living with her husband and her three children. In 2005, she decided to work as a tailor to support her husband with the household expenses after having twenty-five years of experience in this field.

Today, Aida is requesting $1,000 to purchase a new sewing machine to be able to support the demands of her clients.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni R. is currently in the business of selling dried fish in the market and is requesting a loan to stock other items like onions, tomatoes, etc., for sale.

Poni is 29 years-old and married. Her husband is a soldier. She has 2 children who go to school. With the extra income from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock additional items like onions, tomatoes, etc., for sale

loans.name: Wani

texts.en:
Wani G. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol. She is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials to make alcohol to sell.  Wani is 28 years old and is married to a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar and restaurant in the trading centre.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more brewing materials

loans.name: Geronima Dominga

texts.es: Doña Geronima G. tiene 56 años de edad, es casada de oficios Tejedora, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres”, habita junto  con su esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un pequeño Taller, de 2 Telares llevan 12 años ya  laborar   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xecaja del Cantón Poxlajuj del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Mrs. Geronima Gutierrez is 56 years old, married, and is a seamstress specializing in “Elaboration of Typical Styles for Women.” She lives with her husband and the two dedicate themselves to the same trade. They have a small shop, and for the last 12 years have worked in 2 shops. They live in Paraje Xecaja in Poxlajunj Canton, Department of Totonicapan, Guatemala.

Recently, demand from their customers has increased, but the economic conditions in which they find themselves are insufficient to increase their capital. For that reason, they approached the ASDIR Association to solicit a loan, with the intention of buying primary materials and in this way, to be able to increase sales. They also hope to advance their family and enjoy better conditions of life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY PRIMARY MATERIALS FOR THE PRODUCTION OF ARTESANRY

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Mrs. C., age 35, is a good mother caring for five children. Her one grown son has a job, buying and selling used goods, while the remaining four attend school. C. has a store in front of a garment factory where she sells a variety of food to the sewing workers or passers-by. She normally starts selling her items in the morning and finishes in the late evening. She is generating approximately $3 income per day to help solve her family’s problems.

Another source of family income is from her husband’s taxi service. C. will be using her loan to repair her old house which frequently needs repairs.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn P. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Jocelyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-one years and earns approximately 4,600 PHP a month. In 2005, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Netrea Thoen Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Netrea T. is a village bank president who has been selected by seventeen members, all of whom will use the loan for a different purpose. This village bank loan will go to Akreiy Ksat village in Kandal province. Mrs. Netrea T. is a beautician in the village, and her husband, Mr. Nara Nuon, is a cow middleman. They can earn less money; however this family tries to work hard with their career. So in order to improve living conditions for their family, Mrs. Netrea T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more cosmetic supplies for providing beauty services. She is a mother of a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic supplies for providing beauty services

loans.name: Civelina

texts.en:
Livelina D. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 62 years old. Livelina is married and has 8 adult children. Livelina owns & operates a piggery. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Livelina has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month (about $76 US) for these activities.

In 2010, Livelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Livelina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. This loan will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: To make a living in Lagos state, Nigeria. Idowu sells mouth watery Nigerian cooked foods and drinks. She is a hard working woman and she is so determined to excel in her business and family life. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstufs to cook and sell. She is 35 years old and married with a child. Her child is 2 years old. Her husband is a business man and he also supports their home.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstufs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma R. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Elma owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling ready-to-wear items like shoes, shirts and other items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Elma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Elma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Esperanza X Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama esperanza x por que esperan mucho de si mismas, esta ubicado en la colonia arboledas de loma bella en el estado de Puebla en México el grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes.
Ana Isabel Vázquez peña es la presidenta del grupo tiene 39 años estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria es comerciante y tiene en total 3 hijos (dos mujeres y un varón) ella se dedica a la venta de comida que inicio hace 5 años solicita el préstamo para la venta de la misma, sus clientes opinan que la señora tiene un buen sazón y trato agradable.
Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente bastante contenta quiere este crédito para invertir en sus negocio también espera mejorar su calidad de vida.
Lucia S. C. es otra integrante de este grupo tiene 41 años estudio hasta el 3 año de secundaria es casada y tiene dos hijos ambas mujeres, ella se dedica a las manualidades que inicio hace 4 años solicita el préstamo para comprar fieltro sus clientes en la mayoría mujeres la buscan muchas por sus artesanías al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy feliz quiere este préstamo para invertir en sus negocio también espera superarse con esta actividad.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son.
María Georgina Águila Hernández vende comida
Socorro C. S. vende comida
Beatriz Adriana T. T. vende  carteras y bolsas dama
Juana Rosa T. M. vende plásticos o toperware
Andrea Vázquez C. vende pan
Leticia Vázquez Sánchez perfumes originales
María  del Roció O. C. vende lencería
María Isabel Vázquez Peña vende comida
Paulina Martínez Vázquez vende pan
Laura Vázquez Peña vende calzado y blancos
texts.en:
This group calls itself Esperanza X (Hope X) because they expect much of themselves. They are located in the Arboledas de Loma Bella community in the state of Puebla. The group is composed of 11 members. Ana Isabel, the group's president, is 39 years old and studied through the 3rd year of secondary. She has 3 children (2 girls and a boy). She has sold meals for the past 5 years and is requesting a loan to advance her business. Her customers think she offers good flavors and agreeable treatment. As she solicits this loan she feels quite content and wants to invest the money in her business in hopes of improving her quality of life. Lucia is another member of this group. She is 41 years old and studied up to the 3rd year of secondary. She is married and has 2 girls. For the last 4 years she has dedicated herself to handicrafts. She requests a loan to buy felt. Her customers, in the majority women, frequently ask for it for their artisan work. She felt very happy upon requesting this loan to invest in her business. Also, she hoped to advance by means of this activity. The other members of the group are: María Georgina who sells meals Socorro who sells meals Beatriz Adriana who sells wallets & purses Juana Rosa who sells plastic items and tupperware Andrea who sells bread Leticia who sells original perfume María del Roció who sells dry goods María Isabel who sells meals Paulina who sells bread Laura who sells shoes and pillows

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INVESTING IN THEIR BUSINESSES, INCLUDING PREPARING MEALS AND SELLING FELT

loans.name: Vernec

texts.en:
Vernec D. is from the village of Luz, Banzon Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. He is 30 years old. Vernec is single. To make a living, Vernec owns & operates a business buying and selling green bananas in the local community. Vernec has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vernec joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Vernec is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional green bananas to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Vernec from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Fretzel Liza

texts.en:
Fretzel Liza B., aged 39, is from the city of Lawa-an Banonong. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Fretzel Liza owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Fretzel Liza has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP average per month.

In 2008, Fretzel Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Fretzel Liza is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to operate a hog-raising business. This will be the fourth loan she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:
