Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To operate a hog-raising business

loans.name: Janeffar

texts.en: Janeffar is 36 years old, married, and has four children.  She used to sell polythene bags for a living, but has been selling shoes for the past ten years. Her husband sells clothes, and the couple also farms to boost their income.  Janeffar works hard to provide for her children’s education, and her dream is to see them through the university level.  She is an active member of Ngumbau group, part of Faulu Kenya, and she pays her weekly dues consistently.  She also attends the weekly group meetings regularly.  Therefore, her group members have faith in her, and they have guaranteed her a loan of KES 25,000, which she plans to use to buy a variety of shoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy a variety of shoes

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim Y. owns a boutique in a market near her home in Multan, Pakistan. She started this business because her husband’s income was not enough to cover the basic needs of the family. She has been doing this work for the last six years. She creates and sells stitched and embroidered clothing in her boutique which she prepares with the help of her daughters. They all work hard to show their work in all its variety to attract more customers.  

As her boutique is placed in the market, she faces high competition with other clothing shops. For this reason she always needs variety in her clothes so that the customers come to her.

She has applied for a loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institution in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) and will invest the capital in her boutique. This will help her to buy required materials in bulk such as fabric, thread and sketches and will increase her income. 

Note: "Shamim is showing her embroidery work in this picture".

loans.use: Purchase materials for making clothing to display and sell in her boutique

loans.name: Progreso Y Conciliacion 1,2 Group

texts.en: Andrea is the coordinator of her group Progreso y Conciliacion 1,2 ("Progress and Conciliation"), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are a free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. Running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and two children. Andrea is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to buy different types of clothes, from pants to skirts and others. She will reinvest the profits in her business. She wants to have a clothing shop or a boutique. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes (pants, shirts, shoes)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is from the village of  Gingoog City. She is 44 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nhik

texts.en:
Nhik V. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2 per day.

Nhik V.’s husband died of senility years ago. She currently has four children, two of whom are married while the other two are single. To help solve her family’s financial crisis, three of her children are employed.

Nhik V. lacks the money to grow rice crops during the coming farming season; this is why she has applied for a $300 loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To grow rice crops

loans.name: Creselda

texts.en:
Creselda V. is from the village of Gata Diot Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. Creselda owns and operates a transportation business which provides "habal-habal" (a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers) services. Creselda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

In 2010, Creselda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Creselda is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Creselda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle

loans.name: Vann's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vann T. is a 25-year-old married woman who was selected as the leader of this group by its four members. The members are located in Samraong K'aer village, Kandal province, and they will each use their part of the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Vann T. and her husband, Mr. So TH., are fishermen in the local village and are able to earn a small income to support their family. They have two children, aged 3 and 7. Their family house does not have electricity, so Vann TH. decided to ask for a loan to buy a battery to light the house at night.

loans.use: To buy a battery to light her house at night

loans.name: Ikromidin

texts.ru: Калонов Икромидин житель города Турсунзаде. Возраст, 42 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Икромидин имеет средне - специальное образование. Работает по специальности. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно – рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Ikromidin K. is a resident of Tursun-zoda. He is 42 years old, married, and has four children. His wife is a housewife. Ikromidin has a vocational education. He works in his profession. Additionally, he works in animal husbandry. He raises cattle for resale. He has been doing this work for twenty years. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man and the father of 5 school-aged children. He is an experienced construction worker. He is especially talented at completing woodwork and gypsum board projects. He has been doing this for the past 12 years. He works with some entrepreneurs and constructs things for the clients. Today, he wants to borrow $1200 from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. in order to purchase the construction supplies needed for his newest project.

loans.use: purchasing construction supplies

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Ros S., 48, grows vegetables, and catches and sells fish at the local market of his Kandal province. He typically makes US$3 of profit each day, while his wife stays at home looking after their four children. Two of the children are in school and the two others are employed as garment factory workers. Ros S. is asking for a loan of US$700 to purchase one boat and grow sugar cane.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and plant sugar cane.

loans.name: Tubula

texts.en:
Tubula M. is 32 years old.  He is a farmer and supports six people in his family. He is married to Nailepu M. and has children aged between 4 months and 10 years. Nailepu is a house wife and she helps Tubula in his farming activity.

Tubula does wheat farming which he has been doing for the last seven  years.  This will be his second loan and he is planning to spend twenty thousand KES to buy chemical and fertilizer, and forty thousand KES to spray his wheat farm.

He is planning to use the anticipated profit from his farming to expand his farming activity by leasing a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production.  

His hopes and dream is that he will become a large scale farmer, owning a bigger piece of land and be financially stable to support his family

loans.use: To buy fertilizer/spray for wheat farm.

loans.name: Avazjon

texts.ru: Билолов Авазчон проживает в районе Восеъ. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Работает на центральном рынке района. Арендует торговую точку, где продает продукты питания. В этой области уже 3 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Avazjon B. lives in the Vosey region. He is 26-years-old, married and is the father of an infant. He completed secondary school. 

He works in the central market of the region. He runs a market stall, where he sells food products. He has worked in this area for three years. His loan is to be used for increasing inventory.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina F. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 33 years old and married. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gina works hard to build her business and have a stable income.
Gina joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gina is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos S. Jr. is from the village of Maluno Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela. He is 30 years old. Carlos is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Carlos owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Carlos has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carlos joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carlos is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Carlos from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Yenny María

texts.es: La señora Yenny  María G. B. sigue elaborando prendas de vestir y artesanías en su casa ubicada en el municipio de San Jacinto, departamento de Bolívar.  Ya canceló su anterior Credikiva con gran puntualidad gracias al cual logró aumentar sus ventas, sus utilidades y empezar a construir su vivienda para vivir con su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Con el actual préstamo planea comprar telas, hilos y  accesorios. En un futuro no muy lejano piensa comprar una moderna máquina de coser para darle un mejor acabado a las prendas de vestir  y reemplazar la que tiene actualmente. La señora Yenny le manda un saludo muy especial a todos sus financiadores de Kiva, deseándoles mucha salud y prosperidad en compañía de sus familiares y agradeciéndoles la generosidad de ayudar a personas humildes y trabajadoras en los más apartados confines de la tierra. Para conocer la anterior presentación de la microempresaria, pueden acceder a través del siguiente link:																								http://www.kiva.org/lend/180569
texts.en:
Yenny María G. B. makes clothes and handicrafts in her home which is located in the town of San Jacinto, in Bolívar department.  She repaid her previous Kiva loan on time and, thanks to that loan, she has managed to increase her sales and profits and has begun to build a home for herself, her husband and her small son to live in.

Yenny plans to use her current loan to buy fabric, threads and accessories.  In the not-so-distant future she plans to buy a modern sewing machine so that she can do a better job of finishing off the clothes she makes and replace her current machine.

Yenny sends a special greeting to all Kiva lenders.  She wishes them and their family members good health and prosperity, and thanks them for their generosity in helping humble and hard-working people in the most far-flung places on earth.  If you would like to read the previous description of this small businesswoman and her business, you can access this through the following link: http://www.kiva.org/lend/180569

loans.use: To buy fabric, threads and accessories

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertja es madre de familia de 63 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola y comercial que se encuentra situada en la región de Lambayeque, a 45 minutos de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con algunos animales menores, los cuales cría en su domicilio. Específicamente cuenta con chivos, cuyes, pavos, patos, gallinas, chanchos, etc., los que alimenta de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando estos animales ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Los ingresos que el obtiene de esta actividad son la principal fuente ingreso con la que sostiene la economía de su familia.

Bertha desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado, de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta y pueda aumentar sus ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Bertja is the mother of a family. She is 63 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Mochumi district, an agricultural and commercial area that is located in the Lambayeque region, a 45-minute walk from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She has some young animals that she cares for in her home. Specifically, she has goats, guinea pigs, turkeys, ducks, hens, pigs, etc., who she feeds grains and natural grasses. When these animals reach a good level of development, she sells them to the general public and to businesses that visit the area she lives in. The revenue she generates from this business is her main form of income that sustains her family economically. 

Bertha wants to grow her business by buying more animals and balanced feed so she can satisfy demand and increase her revenue. Therefore, she has requested this loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 nuevos soles, which will help her meet her goal.

loans.use: Purchase more animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: El Sr. Manuel Q. es originario del municipio de El Sauce, es un pequeño Agricultor y Ganadero que se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 26 años. Es casado y solamente depende de él su esposa ya que sus hijos trabajan y son independientes. Tiene tres años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado cuatro créditos para la compra de ganado el que le ha permitido aumentar su inventario de animales y mejorar el nivel de vida de su esposa y sus  hijos. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de dos bueyes con el fin seguir aumentando su hato ganadero.
texts.en: Mr. Manuel Q. is originally from the municipality of El Sauce. He is a small-scale agriculturist and farmer who have 26 years' experience in the field. He is married but his only dependent is his wife. His children are employed and they are independent. He has worked with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for three years and he has accessed four past loans. He has purchased livestock with his loans and it has increased his inventory, thereby improving the quality of life for his wife and children. The loan he requests is to purchase two bulls, with the goal of continually increasing his herd.

loans.use: To purchase two bulls.

loans.name: Orlando Rafael

texts.es:
Orlando casado, su esposa de ocupación comerciante, tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropas, electrodomésticos y artículos del hogar. Proyectos para corto plazo la compra del local, convertirse en distribuidores y también el mejoramiento de su vivienda. Iniciaron con esfuerzo propios, se le ha presentado al dificulta de falta de financiamientos.   Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y condición de vida. 
El préstamo que solicitad será invertido en la compra de mercadería como: ropas de dama, caballero, niños, artículos escolares, productos para el hogar como cuadros, adornos, platos entre otros. Obteniendo un incremento de ventas e igual de ganancia.
texts.en:
Orlando is married. He and his wife are merchants and have their own business selling clothing, electric household appliances and basic home items. Their goals are to buy their working space, become distributors and upgrade their house. They started their business without any assistance but have had some difficulty with finances. They are grateful with the finance company for the support which will allow them to improve their living conditions and business.   

The loan will be utilized to buy general merchandise like clothing for women, men and children, school supplies, household items, pictures, knick-knacks and dishes. This would help them to increase sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Eradio

texts.es:
Eradio tiene 66 años de edad, es soltero y tiene hijos ya independientes. Vive en casa propia y humilde de adobe de un piso en el distrito de La Victoria, unos treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Desde hace más de 20 años, cuenta con una panadería en su propio domicilio donde tiene un horno artesanal. Eradio vende sus alimentos diariamente y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Desea invertir parte de su crédito de 800 nuevos soles en unos arreglos a su horno y en la compra de insumos que ayudará aumentar la producción de su pan. También desea usar una parte para solventar gastos escolares para sus nietos. Eradio es muy trabajador y responsable. Tiene buenas ideas para continuar a crecer su negocio y les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Eradio is 66 years old, single, and has children who are already grown up.  He lives in his own home which is a modest, one-storey, adobe house located in La Victoria district, thirty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than 20 years, Eradio has had a bakery in his home where he has an artisanal oven.  Eradio sells his products daily and has an established customer base.  He would like to invest part of his loan for 800 Peruvian soles in making some repairs to his oven and in buying supplies that will help him to increase his bread production.  He would also like to use part of his loan money to cover his grandchildren's school expenses.

Eradio is a very hard-working and responsible man.  He has good ideas of how to continue growing his business and he is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support in helping him achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fix his oven

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and married with six children. One child is in school. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a ready to wear (RTW) clothing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of RTW.

Teresita has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as t-shirts, blouses, shorts, pants, and underwear. Teresita also earns income from a junk shop.

In the future, Teresita would like to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase more Ready to Wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Ndagire

texts.en:
Ndagire N. is 45 years old and lives in the town of GABA in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is divorced and has four children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Ndagire has a business selling dried fish, which she has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Ndagire has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more fish for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ndagire hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her children.  In the future, Ndagire hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Nury Yeny

texts.es:
Nury es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está separada y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.  Nury tiene grado de instrucción  educación superior técnico.
Trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará andamios, un saco de arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, galletas, golosinas, gaseosas, etc.  Ella recibe el apoyo de su hermana quien la apoya en el negocio.
Su sueño es ejercer su carrera y poner un negocio de perfumería.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y el intercambio de palabras con las socias.
texts.en:
Nury is a member of the communal bank "Las Retamas", which is located in the Puno District, in the province and department of Puno.  She is 30 years old, separated and has two school-aged children.  Nury has a higher technical level of education.

She has been in the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  Her first loan was for 300 PEN which she used in her grocery store business.

She plans to use the new loan, in the amount of 2,000 PEN, to buy scaffolding, a sack of rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cookies, sweets, sodas, etc.  Her sister helps her run the store.

Her dream is to work in her professional field and to set up a perfume shop.  What she likes about the communal bank is its punctuality and converations with the other members.

loans.use: To buy scaffolding, rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Akua Mawusse

texts.fr: Revendeuse de bijoux depuis 2008 et mariée à un comptable, Akua est mère de 02enfants et elle a 37ans.son activité se déroule au grand marché de Lomé, lieu où elle s’approvisionne également. Elle est à son premier crédit et elle est déterminée à accroitre son bénéfice, et ce prêt va lui servir  à augmenter son stock pour accroître son bénéfice  et aider son mari dans les tâches au quotidien du ménage.
texts.en: Akua has been selling jewelry since 2008. She is married to an accountant, is the mother of two children and is 37 years old. She runs her business at the great market in Lomé, where she also gets her supplies. This is her first loan and she is convinced that it will help her to increase her profit. She will use the loan to expand her inventory and thus earn more money. She will help her husband with daily household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy jewelry.

loans.name: Primero De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PRIMERO DE MAYO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Urubamba, Departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Eufracia 38 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos;  La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar; la socia trabaja ayudando a su conyugue en la carpintería que él tiene, la socia apoya a su pareja en cuanto a los acabados ella barniza, pule los trabajos ya terminados, también se encarga de lijar, poner perillas, accesorios a los diferentes muebles. La socia también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores así como aves de corral (gallinas, pollos), cuyes y chanchitos. La socia vende los animalitos cuando estos alcanzan su periodo de madures. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores y así incrementar sus ventas.

Los socios se dedican a la crianza de animales menores; a la venta de helados, a la atención de una tienda de abarrotes, a la venta de comidas, a la venta de verduras.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank "PRIMERO DE MAYO" [First of May]. The partner lives in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.

The member is Eufracia. She is 38 years old. She lives with her partner and has four children. She alternates her activities of the home. She works helping her spouse in the carpentry workshop that he has. She supports her partner by varnishing and polishing jobs that are already finished. She also deals with sanding and putting knobs and accessories on different forms of furniture. She also raises young animals like farm-yard birds (chickens), guinea pigs, and pigs. She sells the small animals when they reach maturity. She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of young animals and in this way increase her sales.

The partners raise young animals, sell ice-cream, have a grocery store, sell food, and sell vegetables.

Eufracia values and and is infinitely grateful for the loan that they will grant her. In this way she will be able to improve her quality of life. She promises to follow through with the payment of her dues in the established location.

loans.use: to buy young animals and increase their sales.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha, de 45 años, es una mujer inteligente y trabajadora, esta casada con Juan, de 46 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos, Sandro de 12 y Lisandra de 9 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la selva central (comunidad nativa Centro Pumpuriani). Con la sonrisa que la caracteriza, ella siempre aprendió a salir adelante; hace 25 años que se dedica a la siembra de café, maíz híbrido (llamados polenta), plátanos, palta y yuca; en todo este tiempo logró adquirir 9 terrenos de cultivo. Ella siembra en grandes cantidades y por temporadas; en el mes de setiembre sembrará maíz y yuca, en mes de diciembre café y en verano cítricos; es así que ya tiene planeado sus próximos cultivos; los cuales depende del tiempo de mayor demanda de los productos en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta es sembrar, cuidar su cultivo y venderlo a los comerciantes que llegan cada fin de semana a su comunidad nativa. Más se siente algo inestable, ya que hace algunos meses se quemó sus plantaciones de plátanos, perdiendo todo sus sembríos, pero no la desanima; al contrario busca la manera de salir adelante; pues sembró nuevos plantitas de plátanos con los que espera obtener un buen fruto nuevo. Por ahora prioriza juntar el capital necesario para poder construir su casa con un material más resistente y con ello darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Abejitas de Pumpuriani” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde está contenta de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Bertha de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de plátanos, yuca y maíz que muy pronto cosechará. Asimismo dará el primer paso en el mejoramiento de su casita con la compra de materiales como ladrillos y calaminas.
texts.en:
Bertha, 45, is an intelligent and hardworking woman. She is married to Juan, 46, and they have 8 children, although only 2 of them live with their parents: Sandro, aged 12, and Lisandra, aged 9. They live in their own home, located in the central forest in the native community of Centro Pumpuriani. With her characteristic smile, she has always managed to get ahead. For 25 years she has sold coffee, corn (polenta), bananas, avocados and cassava, and over time she has managed to buy 9 plots of land. She sows in large quantities and depending on the season. She will sow corn and cassava in September, coffee in December and citrus fruits in the Summer. She has already planned her next crops, which will depend on the seasonality of the product demand in the marketplace. 

What she enjoys the most is sowing, tending to her crops and selling them to the traders that arrive every week-end to her native community. Her current situation is slightly unstable, as a few months ago her banana plants caught fire and she lost the whole crop, but she does not let this discourage her. On the contrary, she is looking at other ways of getting ahead, and she has already sown young banana plants which she hopes will give good fruits. At the moment her priority is to save up enough capital to build her house in a more resistant material, which will help her provide her children with a better quality of life. 

She is a member of the "Abejitas de Pumpuriani" ("Pumpuriani's Little Bees") communal bank and this is her fifth loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she will have the necessary financial backing to achieve her goals. Once more, she is committed to repaying the loan as she's done in the past. She also enjoys being part of a community bank because all other members are responsible and very supportive individuals. If she gets your support, Bertha will invest the money in the purchase of several bags of organic compost to distribute it amongst her crops of bananas, cassava and corn, which she will harvest very soon. She will also take the first steps to improve her home, with the purchase of bricks and corrugated iron.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic compost and materials to build her home.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas, 56 years old, is already a widow. She has five children. She has been into rice farming business for 25 years.

Aside from rice farming, she has also ventured into hog raising. She earns enough income by selling pigs. Her average income from farming and raising hogs is 15000 PHP per month.

Felicitas lives in the community of Sto. Nino South Cotabato. She needs a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, she hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Margarita Maria

texts.es:
Margarita María nació en la ciudad de Puno (Perú) y tiene 57 años de edad. Actualmente, Margarita María vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco junto con tres hijos. Margarita María es técnica en administración y trabaja en la biblioteca de la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Margarita María requiere el préstamo para uso personal y específicamente para viajar a la ciudad de Paucartambo. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoq Allpa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Margarita Maria was born in the city of Puno (Peru), and is 57 years old.  Now Margarita Maria lives in the beautiful city of Cusco with her three children.  Margarita Maria has a degree in administration and works in the library of the San Antonio Abad del Cusco National University.  She has been doing this work for 3 years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At this time Margarita Maria needs a loan for personal use, specifically, to finance a trip to the city of Paucartambo.  She is a responsible and hardworking person who, because of these qualities, was invited by her friends to join the communal bank "Mosoq Allpa" in the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to travel to the city of Paucartambo

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children.
 
Jocelyn has a retail shop that sells bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional bananas and coconuts.

Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas and coconuts.

loans.name: Venilda

texts.en:
Venilda is 47 years old and is married to a policeman. The couple has been blessed with six children. Two of her children have finished college already. Unfortunately, they are not employed yet. One of them is currently studying for a board exam. Though her husband is a government employee, they still experience financial problems due to her children being students.

Venilda is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy new tires for her transport motorcycle. She is grateful because the profit she generates from her business is useful for their daily needs. Venilda hopes to save money for the education of her children. She is hoping that her children can finish their schooling someday.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her transport motorcycle

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son D. la cuidad D. Caacupé. Son muy trabajadoras, y unidas, realizan actividades diversas como grupo, D. eso modo fomentar la integración D. todas las miembros del comité. 
Las Señoras están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya, porque gracias a la institución pueden acceder a constantes capacitaciones, y ahora también capacitaciones para con sus hijos; con eso enriquecen sus conocimientos y ayudan al sustento D. sus hogares. El comité acaba D. culminar el ciclo número 16
La presidenta, la Señora Florentina vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la costura. Gracias a su trabajo se hizo conocida por todo el barrio, con el mismo ha podido formarse una cantidad definida D. clientes, los cuales siempre solicitan su trabajo. Comenta que todo lo que realiza es por sus hijos y por su hogar, ya que D. esa forma genera ingresos que son útiles a la hora D. paliar los gastos D. la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas, hilos, y agujas, que son indispensables para el ejercicio D. su profesión. Ella está muy esperanzada en el crédito, ya que le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The women in this committee are from the city of Caacupé. They are very hardworking and together. They carry out different group activities thus encouraging the integration of all the committee members.

The ladies are very grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya because thanks to this institution they have access to constant training and now, training for their children as well. Through this they are enriching their knowledge and helping to maintain their households.The committee has just completed its 16th loan.

The president, Florentina, lives with her husband and children. She sews for a living. Through her work she has become well known in the neighbourhood, something which has also helped her to develop a steady customer base, who always request her services. She says that everything she does is for her children and her household. Making an income in this way helps to alleviate the household expenses. 

She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, thread and needles all of which are essential in her profession. She very much hopes to receive the loan as it would a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy material, thread and needles for use in the sewing workshop.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a hardworking, 28 year old businessman. He is married and blessed with a six-month old child. For the last four years, he has been selling phones and their accessories to make a living. Over the next five years he wants to expand his business. His dream is to become a leading distributor of phones in his whole region. Boniface is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy phones and accessories. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has acquired business management skills.

loans.use: to buy phones and accessories.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta keeps livestock and cultivates land. She would like to cultivate more land. With the requested loan Julieta plans to purchase fertilizer and fodder. With the loan's help Julieta will cultivate the land successfully, get a good harvest and increase her income. This will allow her to insure sustainable living conditions for her family. Julieta lives together with her son and mother-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and fodder.

loans.name: Thonarith

texts.en:
Thonarith, 46, resides with his wife in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Thonarith is a skillful fisherman, earning an income of USD 10 per day. When he is not fishing, he grows rice and raise pigs to generate more income. 

Each month, the family has to spend USD 100 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. Thonarith is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family use.

loans.name: 02.06.06 Đông Sơn Thanh Hoá Group

texts.en:
Quỳnh is 58 years old. She is married and has two children.

Quỳnh is the group leader of the 06 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Quỳnh supports one dependent with her business in Thanh Hoá city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Quỳnh has a retail business selling clothes. Quỳnh has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Quỳnh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

This is Quỳnh first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. In the future, Quỳnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Ghalia

texts.en:
Ghalia is a 52-year-old hard-working woman who, with her husband, Khalil built a barn in their backyard a long time ago. In the barn they have a large number of goats that they bring from outside Jordan and sell them at the market. They are now well known among their competitors with their trading business, which has been growing greatly year after year. Even their sons are now in the business helping their old parents.

Now Ghalia has applied for a loan under her name to buy more goats to be prepared for the next Islamic holiday orders which will be next month. In this Islamic holiday the orders become very high, requesting sheep, cow, and goat meat.

Since Ghalia is a conservative person, her husband Khalil has agreed to appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more goats and prepare for the upcoming holiday orders.

loans.name: Dalaibaatar

texts.en: Mr. Dalaibaatar, 39, is a driver of a minivan used for passenger transportation around the district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been doing his business during the past decade and always has a lot of passengers. Recently, he has bought a new minivan from his friend, but still he could not cover his car payment. Changing his minivan for a new one is very beneficial for his business earnings, and he can provide more secure and comfortable service to his passengers. Therefore, the loan Dalaibaatar is taking will be dedicated to covering the payment of his new minivan.

loans.use: To cover the payment of his new minivan.

loans.name: Olga Lucía

texts.es:
Desde hace algunos años Olga se dedica a la venta de mercancía por catálogo lo que le permite trabajar desde su casa y dedicarse a los oficios propios del hogar así como a pequeño hijo, así esta emprendedora también contribuye a cubrir los gastos del hogar. 

Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para pagar algunas facturas pendientes y comprar mercancía para el mes de diciembre pues es una época en la que necesita mayor cantidad de productos.
texts.en:
Olga has been selling merchandise through catalogs for some years.  This allows her to work from home and take care of her housework, as well as her young son.  In this way, this entrepreneur contributes towards covering her household expenses.

Olga currently needs a loan to pay some pending bills and to buy merchandise for the month of December as this is a time of year when she needs a larger quantity of products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and pay some bills

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Rut de 22 años de edad casado con Yuri de 27 años fruto de aquella relación tienen 2 hermosos hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Puerto Amargura del distrito de LLochegua. Rut recuerda que hace 3 años estaba en el mercado en el que todo era negocio de abarrotes, librería, artículos en general, zapatería y carnicería. Ante ello aprovechó en abrir una tienda de ropa, en efecto comenzó a vender dicha mercadería, a tal punto que sus clientes se quedaban con las ganas de hacerle alguna solicitud. Es así que cada quincena se va a la ciudad de Lima a comprar más ropa con la finalidad de reducir costos, además trae ropa de vanguardia para todo  los generos. A pesar de que su negocio le está resultando rentable, desea abrir un negocio en la avenida principal de su localidad, con la finalidad de que pueda vender variedad de prendas para todo el publico en general. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su querido esposo. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará más prendas de vestir para venderlos.
texts.en: Ruth, 22, is married to Yuri, 27 and they have two beautiful children.  They live in their own house located in Puerto Amargura in Llochegua District.  Ruth remembers that three years ago she was in the market and all that was available were groceries, stationery, general merchandise, shoes and meat.  In face of that, she decided to open a clothing store and started, in fact, to sell that merchandise to such an extent that her customers remained behind to place specific orders with her.  This led to her going to Lima every two weeks to buy more clothes to reduce costs plus she brings cutting-edge clothes for both genders.  Even though her business is profitable she wants to open a store on her town’s main street to sell a variety of clothes to the general public.  Generally she works alone but sometimes her beloved husband helps her.  This will be her first loan with MFP so she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the 1500 new soles to buy more articles of clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: María Margarita tiene 57 años, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 26 años que tiene este medio de vida, ella es una persona responsable tiene 4 hijos que ya trabajan de manera independiente. Inicio por la necesidad de proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de calzado, perfumes, polvos, sabanas, ropa en general entre otros. Ella sueña con mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: María Margarita is 57 years old and sells general merchandise.  She’s been earning a living this way for more than 26 years.  She is a responsible lady with four children who works independently.  She began because she needed to provide the necessary income for her family.  She will use the money to buy perfumes, powders, sheets, and general clothing among other things.  She dreams of a better quality of life..

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Bashisha, who is in his late 40's, is a widower with three children. He has run a chips and chicken selling business for the past twenty years. This is his fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania and he has successfully paid back all his previous loans. 

He used his previous loan to increase his business stock and pay school fees and other household expenses. Now he wants this loan to purchase more stock for his business. He dreams of becoming an international businessman.

Bashisha will share this loan with the "Mshikamano" Group. This group has 19 members and will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase his stock of chips and chicken

loans.name: Nelcy

texts.en:
Nelcy, 36 years old, is married and has 2 children. Nelcy works hard to provide for her family. She has operated a variety store in the Philippines for 4 years and also earns an income from rope making. Nelcy has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Nelcy has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Yatoufa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1955 à Nèbabougou Préfecture de Sikasso, Monsieur  Yatoufa est polygame avec deux épouses et père de neuf enfants. Il réside avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, il s’est vite initié il y environ six années aux activités vente de bois de construction qu’il achète dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso. 
Nanti d’une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et reçoit beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son deuxième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de ses clients, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Ce deuxième crédit servira à acheter, 300 planches de bois de constructions dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso.
Avec ce deuxième prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité principale.
texts.en:
Yatoufa was born around 1955 in Nèbabougou in Sikasso prefecture; he is polygamous with two wives and he is father to nine children. He lives with his two wives and his children in Sanoubougou 1, one of the working-class districts of Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). 

He was not lucky enough to go to school, and having tried several activities without success, he rapidly launched himself six years ago into selling timber for construction; he buys the wood in towns surrounding Sikasso. Having acquired such experience in this field, he now enjoys a good reputation and gets a lot of orders; however he does not have sufficient resources to satisfy all this demand. He thus decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program, and is on his second loan, which will enable him to increase his business so that he can respond better to customer demand. His previous loan has been repaid in full. 

This second loan will be used to buy 300 planks of construction timber in the towns surrounding Sikasso. Thanks to this loan, he expets to make a monthly profit of 250,000 FCFA. With these profits he is expecting to cover the bulk of his expenses, those of his family and also pay the interest on his loan; the balance will be invested in his main activity.

loans.use: to buy timber for building

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man and has two children, a son and a daughter. He describes himself as social and honest.

For the past six years John has run a green grocery where he sells vegetables and fruits such as oranges, onions, kale, etc. His business draws both repeat and new customers. The high cost of fruits and vegetables is his biggest challenge.

John has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from SMEP, which he will use to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

John’s hope is to venture into a new retail shop business within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a resident of rural Kashari in Mbarara District. He has four children and two other dependents, all in school. 

He started farming some 20 years back but could not yield much because of the poor methods he was using. That is when he got to know Ugafode microfinance and acquired a loan of UGX 1,000,000, which helped his farming business grow. Because of Moses' hard work, his business continued expanding. And now he is requesting a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to diversify his farming business by hiring labourers to till the land and plant more of the vegetables that are in high demand in the town centre.

loans.use: To hire labour and buy seeds.

loans.name: Balabeyim Baylar Giz

texts.en:
Balabeyim is an old internally displaced person (IDP) who is the mother of one child. Her family\'s living condition is not very good. The family income is rather limited.

Since 2000, Balabeyim has supported her family by working as a cook in her small business. Actually, she is very communicative person who loves people and accepts them as they are. In her view, cooking is some kind of art which reflects the feelings and mood of a cook. She likes international cousine but national dishes such as dolma, plov, khingal are her favourite ones.

Now, she needs a loan of $600 to further develop her business, to buy new kitchen appliances, to increse her incomes via diversifying the menu and attracting more clients.

loans.use: To buy kitchen appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is married and has two children, of 12 and 10 years old. To buy her house, a mortgage was extended to her husband that is automatically deducted from his paycheck. The caused her disposable income to go down, and to fulfill the daily household needs became ever more difficult. Faced with this, Gabriela decided to start her own business with the sale of cosmetics. Luckily, her business is doing well and due to her open character and ability to relate to other people, her client based has multiplied.

She now needs a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to satisfy customer requests. She commits to repaying the loan in a period of 3 to 6 months.

Right now is the right time to help those who need it most. So please help Gabriela; she and her family are sincerely thankful!

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Gabriela es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 12 y 10 años de edad. Para adquirir su casa le otorgaron un crédito a su esposo y le descuentan los pagos en la nómina, así comenzaron a tener menores ingresos y sobrellevar las obligaciones de la casa se tornó más difícil, ante esta situación Gabriela decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos, afortunadamente le ha ido bien en su negocio y gracias a su carácter y facilidad de relacionarse con los demás, sus clientes se han multiplicado.

Ahora requiere de un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses.

Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Gabriela, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Muyasar

texts.en:
H. Muyasar has been engaged in business since 1996. She is married and has 2 children. Her place of business is located on the first floor of Panjshanbe market.

Muaysar receives her products from chicken farms; she gets in about 4800 eggs every three days. She sells the eggs quickly, because her place is always very popular but her real problem at the moment is the condition of her sales area. She crushes about 100 eggs here every day.

H. wants to rent a stall in the corner of the market, where she would be able to sell her eggs without losses. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of US$ 900.

loans.use: Renting a stall to sell her eggs from

loans.name: Faafouina

texts.en: Faafouina is a young mother of 25 years of age, married with 1 child. She is living with her parents, and her husband works with one of the companies in the town area. Her husband's weekly salary is not sufficient to support all of them. She decided to join SPBD so she could do something of her own. She has always been interested in a vegetable garden. She thought of trying a cabbage farm due to the size of land they are using. She used her first loan to buy fertilizers and cabbage seeds. In the future, she plans to have her own small market in front her home.

loans.use: To start her cabbage farm

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda D. Pinto is the single mother of 3-year-old daughter Jazmin.  They live in Luque, Paraguay. She has been a client of the Fundación Paraguaya since 2002 when she was granted a loan of Gs. 800.000 or the equivalent of $160. Before opening her store she was a shopkeeper at a store selling Korean goods. With her money she bought a sizable space in a large local market in Asunción.  From here she sells wallets, purses, jewelry and accessories. She has had this space for two years and invested much time and money into maintaining it well. Nilda is a born fighter and her indomitable spirit has brought her success. Also, thanks to the help of the Foundation, Nilda was able to buy a car as well as build her own house in Luque, an area just outside of the Capital. Nilda continues to move forward. Since January 2007 she has been able to open another branch of her store in Luque, closer to her home. Now she is seeking a new loan in order to purchase large quantities of merchandise, which includes wallets, purses and jewelry.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE FOR HER SHOP, SUCH AS WALLETS, PURSES, JEWELRY AND ACCESSORIES

loans.name: Sakit

texts.en: Sakit (his father is pictured) is 36 years old, married and has 2 children.  He has run his farming business for 7 years.  D.'s family lives in the Salyan region in the village of Yenikand.  Now, he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a plot of land for improving his farming business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for improving his business

loans.name: Thi Son

texts.vi:
Ms Sơn tends a kiosk at the market selling grocery and take out food. She applies to Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) for a loan which would be invested in expanding her kiosk and buy food ingredients.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Sơn chuyên bán hàng tap hoá và một số đồ ăn sẵn như đậu rán, thịt rán, nem rán... Số tiền vay của Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binh Minh cdc sẽ giúp chị Sơn nâng cấp kiốt của mình và mua nguyên liệu làm thức ăn.

loans.use: Expand her kiosk, buy ingredients

loans.name: Prem Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Prem Kumari M. is a 38 year old woman who lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with her husband, a son and a daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 6 and her son is in grade 2. Her husband, Rabindra M. and herself make traditional idols. In Nepal, idol making work is very famous and the demand for idols is increasing. So they need money to buy raw materials to make traditional idols to meet the demand of idols.

So she seeks a Rs 15000 loan to buy raw materials for making traditional idols like gold, wax, silver, etc. for her work.

She wants to invest and spend her money to ensure a better education for her children and uplift the standard of living in her family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a divorced woman with 2 children, aged 15 and 7. She also takes care of 2 other people, aged 58 and 53. Rehema owns a small construction store, which she started in 2002. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Rehema now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Tusiga

texts.en: Tusiga L., 45, is married to a taxi driver. The couple has five children. Tusiga would like to receive a loan to be able to purchase paint, a battery, and 3 tires for her husband’s taxi. He has been a taxi driver for over two years now and works six days a week. Tusiga and her husband expect that the loan would generate 200 Tala (~US$80) per week in net cash flow.

loans.use: Purchase paint, a battery, and three tires

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary C. is a fifty-five year old widowed mother of three children aged 16, 9 and 4 years old respectively. She is a focused business woman who works hard to provide for her family. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. She deems it an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her stock of goods available for sale. Mary belongs to the community group called Shepherd Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en: Alisher U. was born in 1977 in Asht, Tajikistan, and is married with two children.  He works in the commercial services sector, and has a trade outlet in the local bazaar selling a variety of food products, including meats, flour, sugar, and vegetable oil.  By working directly with suppliers, Alisher is able to offer highly competitive prices to his customers.  He now wants to increase his inventory by importing more goods at a time, and has therefore requested a loan of $1,200 for ten months.

loans.use: To import larger quantities of goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in a great variety of beauty products to replenish a small business.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea C. is a farmer in Takul Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Phalla Sok, sells vegetables for a living and also helps his wife farm when he has time. Because his business is doing well, he would like to expand it. That is why Mrs. Kea C. has decided to apply for a loan to buy a motorbike which he can use to carry vegetables door-to-door for resale. Previously, Mrs. Kea C. obtained a loan from TPC (Thaneakea Phum Cambodia, Ltd) to grow vegetables and paid it back successfully.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to carry vegetables door-to-door for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith O. sells fruits like mangoes, paw paw, banana, and so on. She has been in this business since 1998. Judith is 47 years old and married with six children and lives in Lagos state.

Judith needs a loan amount of $450 to purchase fruits for sale.

loans.use: To buy fruits for her stall.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: Natividad tiene 36 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una línea cosmética muy reconocida a nivel nacional, su dedicación a esta actividad es debido a sus tres hijos, quienes estudian, su esposo Eduardo siempre está de acuerdo con el negocio de su Nati, como él la llama. Ambos decidieron trabajar duro para dar  a sus hijos lo necesario. Natividad quiere seguir prosperando en su negocio y también desea comprar una vitrina para poder mostrar sus productos, adicionalmente, vende pescado en un puesto del mercado de su localidad.El dinero que solicita será invertido en la mejora e implementación de su negocio. Ayudemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación lucha por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Natividad is 36 years old, and she works selling cosmetics of a well known trademark. Her work ethic is inspired by her children, all of whom are currently studying. Eduardo is always supportive of Nati's business, as he likes to call her. They have both worked very hard to give their children everything they need. Natividad wants her business to grow, and for this purpose she wants to buy a display window for all her products. The loan will be invested in the improvement of her business. `

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of pcosmetics she sells and purchase a display window for exhibiting her products.

loans.name: Mirsa

texts.es:
La señora Mirsa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Éxito”, ubicado en el Jr. Emilio Tipto Nº 115 “San Fernando”, distrito de Manantay, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en su taller de tapicería “Tapicero”. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la infraestructura de su taller de tapicería.

En la actualidad cuenta con su taller y con la ayuda de su esposo. Abre su taller a las 8 a.m. y cierra a las 8 p.m. Verifica y administra los movimientos de su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 5 rollos de marroquín “tolderas” de diferentes colores.

Mirsa se siente feliz trabajando con Manuela Ramos porque ha logrado sobresalir y tiene el deseo de ampliar más su negocio con la ayuda del Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Señora Mirsa belongs to the communal bank called " Successful Women", located in the district of Manantay in the city of Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She's 45 years old. She's the mother of 3 children who still depend on her financially. She's married and her husband works as a tapestry maker and has his own shop. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in the renovation of the tapestry shop. She currently works in the shop with the help of her husband. They open the shop at 8 in the morning and they close it at 8 in the evening. She controls and administrates the business. With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will purchase 5 rolls of vinyl of different colors. Mirsa is very happy with Manuela Ramos because she has been able to move ahead and she wishes to grow her business with the help of the Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vinyl of different colors

loans.name: Mrs. Sreang Seum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of nine members, is located in the Thmor Da village in Kampong Cham Province. The loan will be used for many different purposes. Mrs. Sreang S. has been selected by the members as the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Keit Soer, is a fisherman. Mrs. Sreang S. is requesting a loan to buy fishnets to support her husband's business. She is 33 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, three are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

This is a village bank consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on KIVA.

loans.use: To purchase fishnets to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 44 años, está casada con Mario de 53 años, tiene dos hijos, Juan de 20 y Dante de 13 años. Se dedica a la atención en su peluquería desde hace un año en que puso su negocio, ya que anteriormente trabajaba en el salón de una amiga, donde aprendió todo lo que necesitaba para poner su propio negocio. Lo que le gusta a Angélica de su trabajo es el rol de consejera que cumple con sus clientas, las cuales mientras se realizan los peinados, cortes, ondulaciones, etc., le cuentan a sus problemas  pidiéndole sus consejos. El negocio va creciendo poco a poco y en base a mucho esfuerzo y dedicación esta arrojando sus primeras ganancias, es por eso que ella necesita de nuestro apoyo para lograr todas sus metas. Angélica se encuentra en su segundo préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de instrumentos y productos para mejorar la atención de su peluquería.
texts.en:
Angelica is 44 years old, married to Mario, who is 53 years old. They have two children, Juan, 20 and Dante, 13. One year ago, she started her own hair salon, where she works today. Before that she worked in a friend’s salon where she learned everything she needed to start her own business. What Angelica likes about her job is the counseling role she plays with her clients. While she cuts, styles and perms their hair, they often tell her their problems and ask for advice. Her business is slowly growing and based on a lot of hard work and dedication she is seeing her first earnings. Because of this she needs our help to achieve all of her goals. Angelica is in her second loan cycle with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the loan money she will buy more supplies and products to improve the service at her salon.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda A. sells sarongs, clothes, and underwear. She sells out of her home to people in her community. Linda lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more clothes, sarongs and underwear to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Karim S. est un célibataire de 24 ans, il réside  à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur S. a mené plusieurs activités sans succès. Il  décida alors de s’initier au commerce d’articles divers dans  une boutique devant sa maison d’habitation. Il mène cette activité d’achat et de vente des articles divers (Cigarette, bonbon, allumette, Cheew Gum, lait en poudre, Thé, sucre, savon, etc) il y a maintenant trois (03) ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité par sa clienèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant trois (03) mois avec qui il  est à son premier prêt individuel.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 2 cartouches de Cigarettes , 2 carton du thé, 1 sac du sucre, 3 cartons de savon,  5 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquet de Cheew Gum, 20 paquets d’allumette, 10 sacs de riz, etc.
 Il sapprovisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de la place avant de les revendre.Monsieur S. vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée de jeunes et de voisins.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales au niveau de son village et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Karim S., 24, is single and lives in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. S. tried out several businesses without success. He then decided to get into selling various items in a little shop in front of his house. He has had this little shop (selling cigarettes, bonbons, matches, chewing gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, etc.) for three years now. He is much in demand by his clientele because of the good quality of his merchandise.

In order to satisfy his ever-growing clientele, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three months ago, and he is on his first individual loan. With this first loan he intends to buy 2 cartons of cigarettes, 2 cases of tea, 1 sack of sugar, 3 cartons of soap, 5 packs of bonbons, 10 packs of chewing gum, 20 packs of matches, 10 sacks of rice, etc.

He does his buying from wholesalers and sells retail. Mr. S. sells for cash or on credit to a clientele composed of young people and neighbors. With this loan he expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to increase his working capital, contribute to supporting his family back in the village, and paying the interest on the loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Mrs. B., has been a PMPC member for more than three years. She started her business (Sari-Sari--convenience--Store) out of her own pocket as her initial capital. She displayed her items for sale right inside her house. When she became a Paglaum member, she infused additional capital, taken from her loan through the cooperative. Now she’s on her 7th loan cycle and is asking to be granted a loan amounting to P 10,000.

She is planning that the store will have its own building so it will be separate from her home. She hopes that their financial status will grow, thru the help of the business.

Above all, she is so thankful for the trust Paglaum gave her, that she’s able to avail herself of the credit services of PMPC. And because of that, she tries her very best to cope with her responsibilities as a Paglaum member, being religious in paying amortizations on time, as well as the weekly savings and share capital and attending meetings regularly.

loans.use: for purchase of additional materials such corn, rice and other food products

loans.name: Amlan

texts.fr: Mme Amlan A. est née en 1950 à adétikopé, mariée avec onze(11) enfants en charge. C'est de son petit commerce de fruits (orange, mandarine ...) qu'elle s'occupe tant bien que mal des charges du ménage. Mais elle manque cruellement de fond de commerce pour augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. Elle sollicite donc un financement pour disposer de fonds nécessaire et s'approvisionner régulièrement. Les revenus  tirés de ses activités l'aideront à subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Amlan A. was born in 1950 in Adétikopé, is married and has eleven children. It is her small fruit business (selling oranges, mandarins, etc.) that, with great difficulty, allows her to manage the household. But she is lacking the funds to be able to increase her sales. She is, therefore, soliciting a loan to be able to have enough funds to regularly restock her supply. Her revenues from this business will help her manage the needs of the household.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit sales

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty T. currently sells onions and is requesting a loan to buy cooking oil and onions to sell. Betty is 25 years old and is single. Betty does not have children, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop. In 2007 BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil and onions to sell

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte O. is married with three children and received an education through primary school. Since 1999 she has worked as a petty trader selling secondhand clothing at Shama Junction. While Charlotte works as a trader, her husband is employed as a fisherman. Charlotte uses her income to pay for her family’s water bill.

Charlotte will use the loan to purchase additional clothing to sell. With her newly gained profits, she plans to reinvest in her business to continue the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Cham Tran Thi  is fifty-three years old and lives in the town of Quang Xuong.  She is married and has five grown children.  To make a living, Cham owns and operates a business raising a variety of seafood for sale.  Cham earns approximately $115 a month from these activities.

In 2003, Cham joined the Kiva field partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services that would give her the ability to engage in business activities so as to improve her living situation. Cham has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund.  These loans were used to invest in expanding her business.  Cham is now requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  This will be her seventh loan from TYM Fund.  Cham plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to maximize her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en: Matthew is 48 years old and he is married with eight children. He has a farm where he plants maize, plantain and pineapples. He is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more plantain suckers to plant. Matthew sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plantain suckers to plant

loans.name: Divine

texts.en:
Divine E. is from the village of GK, Santiago, Iligan, City. She is 33 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Divine owns and operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Divine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the food she sells. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make the food she sells.

location.town: GK, Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La Señora Isabel vive con su esposo y su pequeño nieto, tiene una tienda D. abarrotes la cual le permite generar ingresos y podele ayudar a su esposo con los gastos D. la familia, ya que su esposo trabaja como chofer asalariado y no tienen aún una vivienda propia, el prestamo lo invetíra en la compra D. mercadería que le va permitir surtir mas su tienda y poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel lives with her husband and her little grandson. She has a grocery store that allows her to generate income, and she can help her husband with the family expenses. Since her husband works as a wage-earning driver, and they do not have their own home, she will invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise, which will allow her to supply her store more and improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of groceries for her store (rice, pasta, flour, oil, etc)

loans.name: Josephin

texts.en:
Josephin E. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 31 years old. Josephin is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephin owns and operates a hog-raising business. Josephin has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Josephin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
