Josephin has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Josephin is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Josephin's 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nana Ekua

texts.en: Nana Ekua E. sells 'kenkey' (staple dish similar to a sourdough dumpling) at Elmina. Nana Ekua has received no formal education.  She is a single parent and has 5 dependents. Nana Ekua has been selling 'kenkey' since 1986. She is responsible for paying bills. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients for the preparation of the 'kenkey' for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of the kenkey

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie G. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de ALWAR  dont elle est responsable d'un groupe de solidarité "TACKO" Avec son prêt elle développe un petit commerce de jus de citron et d'huile de palme. Les profits générés de son activité lui permettent de participer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Marie G. is a 50-year-old woman who is a widow and the mother of four children.  She is a member of Banc Villageois de ALWAR where she is the manager of the solidarity group "TACKO".  With her loan, she's developing a small business for lemon juice and palm oil.  The profits generated from her business will allow her to help cover family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her business

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.en:
A. Inoyat is 45 years old. She is married and has two children. Inoyat has dedicated herself to the sale of eggs at Tursunzade’s egg market for the past 16 years. In order to support her husband with household expenses she decided to invest her small amount of savings to this kind of business. Inoyat started her business with a small investment in merchandise. However, due to high competition, she has been acquiring greater amounts of eggs which has helped increase her earnings, albeit very slowly. Her plans are to invest more in her business through the purchase of additional product to sell. That is the reason that Inoyat applied for a loan of 3000 Somoni. With your support, you can improve the quality of life for Inoyat and her family and help their business grow and prosper.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the eggs for expanding the business.

loans.name: Cristhiam Valeska

texts.es: La joven Cristhiam B. de 30 años de edad, soltera  reside con sus padres  en barrio Máximo Jerez en la capital de Managua, joven emprendedora tiene su propio negocio una pequeña ferretería donde vende variedad de productos de calidad accesible al bolsillo del cliente. Este negocio lo inicio en sociedad con su hermano, pero luego le compro su parte, el cual administra sola. Desde hace cuatro años, Este es su primer ciclo en Afodenic y lo hizo con el propósito de invertir en productos de mayor rotación, como: zinc, perlinez, golosos, bidones de pintura en variedad de colores ya que estos meses se vende mucho por los tiempos de navidad. Se siente contenta por el financiamiento ya que lograra captar clientes nuevos, como mejorar las ventas al vender lo que el cliente demanda, también por la taza de interés baja que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Young woman Cristhiam B. is 30 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the Máximo Jerez neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is a young entrepreneur who has her own business in a small hardware store where she sells a variety of quality products that are affordable for her customers. She started this business in partnership with her brother, but later she bought his share of it, and she has run it by herself for four years. This is her first loan with Afodenic and she did it with the purpose of investing in a better rotation of products such as zinc, beams, sweets, and color paint barrels since in these months they are sold a lot because of the Christmas season. She is content with the financing since she will be able to obtain new customers and be able to increase her sales along with her customers’ demand. She is also grateful for the low interest rate that the institution offers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc, beams, and paint barrels

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial/farming community in the Brong Ahafo Region called Goaso.

Margaret is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She also hawks to sell it in her community. Margaret buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Las Colmenas #1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Hilcia is the group coordinator of Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Las Colmenas.  Her story is representative of the others in her group and more generally of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients. Hilcia is a single mother of two who lives in the Samana province of the Dominican Republic.  She lives in a rented house that has unreliable access to running water (not potable) and electricity. 

This will be Hilcia's first loan with Esperanza.  She plans to use it to start a retail business selling clothing.  She will purchase pants, blouses and skirts to sell out of her home to the others in her community. 

Hilcia wants to use the profits from her business to help improve the living conditions for her family.  She will be able to buy clothes, shoes, and books for her children so they can attend school.  She hopes to be able to save enough money to purchase a computer and someday to purchase her own house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses, and skirts to resell

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mean N. was born in 1967 and is a good father to four children. One of them is married, and the other three are single; all are living together in the family home. To help support the family, three of the children are working in a variety of occupations. Mean N. is a motorbike taxi driver who earns around $4 a day for his services. His wife appears in the picture. She owns a store where she sells different kinds of produce items, including vegetables, meats, and some other groceries. Mean N. is requesting a loan to help increase his savings in order to build a new house for his married child to live in.

loans.use: to build a new house for his married child to live in

loans.name: Olugbemiro

texts.en:
Olugbemiro sells textbooks at retail prices to his customers in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. He has been in this business for four years and he hopes to own a bookshop in the future.

Olugbemiro is 42 years old and married with a child. His wife is a civil servant. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more textbooks to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Khaldoun

texts.en:
Khaldoun is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Khaldoun has been working in agriculture since 1998. He plants olives; afterward he is able to make oil or to sell his olives. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay for the harvesting of his olives. This is the first time that Khaldoun has requested a loan.

Khaldoun is special in his work because he does his best to produce the best quality of olives and oil. His clients are people from his region, as well as people from different regions. When he first started his business, he didn’t produce as much as he does today. Khaldoun got into this business because he took on his family’s business. In the future, he plans to keep on expanding his work by producing more.

loans.use: To pay for the harvesting of his olives.

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Mrs. Bin P., 38 years old, stays at home to build traditional rattan baskets for sale. She spends a few days finishing a set of rattan and is able to earn around $3 per day. She has given birth to five children, two of whom are employed. The other three attend school. 

She also relies on the income from her husband. He is a domestic animal trader. He buys oxen or horses at reasonable prices to resell at a profit, earning an average $5 a day. Bin P. saw that the animal sale business brings a good income for her family, so she hopes to enlarge the business by requesting a loan from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: To enlarge the animal sale business.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Tho S., 22, is a professional silk scarf weaver, making US$3 a day in the Takeo province. She is married and has one child living at home. Her husband, Yong Touch, makes approximately US$3 a day, working as a construction worker. Tho S. would like a loan of US$400 to purchase more silk so that she can weave more scarves.

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Yor

texts.en: Mrs. Yor S. is a villager from Ta Ou Khang Cheung Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Pich Ben, are farmers who try to work hard to support their family. Although they try to work hard, they still do not earn enough to support her family. To improve their living conditions, Mrs. Yor S. is asking for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. Mrs. Yor S. is the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start breeding business.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is a 32-year-old married man with two children in school.  He has been running a laundry shop for ten years.  He gained experience in this business because he formerly worked in a laundry.  His wife operates a cereals shop.  He wants to take out a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase a washing machine, irons and two ironing stands.  He hopes to succeed in his business and open up another one.  He also dreams of buying a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine, irons and ironing stands

loans.name: Twegate A Kyanshama Dorothy Group

texts.en:
K. Dorothy is thirty-three years old and is a married woman blessed with four children of whom two are going to school.

Dorothy is a farmer and has been in farming for over five years. She is using the loan to invest in her farm for a better harvest.

Dorothy is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To invest in her farm

loans.name: Simean

texts.en:
Mr. Simean C., 48 and his wife, Mrs. Chantha Soy, 41, have been married since 1988. They have six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of them are married and are garment factory workers, two attend school, and another one stays at home. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. Simean was not in the photo, his wife is available instead. 

Simean is a construction worker. His wife stays at home and does housework. He is in the process of building a new house, but it is not finished yet. So, he is requesting his first loan of $500 to finish building his house.

loans.use: To finish building the house where he lives.

loans.name: Mrs. Ngaeth Kol Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan from Tep Archun village in Kandal province consists of 10 members, who will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Ngaeth K. was selected by the other members as the village bank president.  She is a mother of five children; one is a chef, while the others are attending a local public school.  Her husband is also a chef, while she is a farmer who owns more than 2 hectares of land on which she grows crops that she sells to support her family. She has some problems with her crop field because the soil is infertile and it is far from an irrigation system. Thus, she has decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and vegetable seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda M. is from the town of Talibon. She is 28 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Roda makes and sells "halo-halo", a popular Filipino dessert and also cooks other foods that she sells in her community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years. 

In 2004, Roda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Roda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients and additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mame Saye

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Saye Dramé s'active dans le commerce depuis 20 ans. Elle vend du poisson fumé, s'ché, des pâtes d'arachide et du Bissap au marché Grand Thiès.
Veuve à son état, cette dame souhaitait accroitre son activité. Ainsi, elle sollicite un prêt de 200 000  FCFA pour s'approvisionner en marchandises et diversifier également ses produits de vente. En plus de ce qu'elle vend, elle se lancer dans la vente du mil et du niébé ou haricot local.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Saye Dramé has been carrying out commercial activities for the past 20 years. She sells smoked and dried fish, groundnut paste (unsweetened peanut butter) and bissap (dried hibiscus flowers) at the Grand Thiès market. She is a widow and would like to expand her business. She is requesting a loan for 200,000 FCFA to acquire merchandise and also to diversify the products she sells. In addition to her current business, she wants to start selling millet and niébé (a local bean).

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: resupply merchandise

loans.name: Mrs. Sanh Bor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people make up this village bank loan in Toul Sala village in Kandal province. All the members will use their portions of the loan for different purposes with the goal of improving their businesses.

Mrs. Sanh B., age 48, was selected as the group loan leader by her fellow loan members. She is a farmer and owns a small piece of land on which to cultivate rice, which she sells to support her family. Since her farming endeavor is going well, she wants to expand. Therefore, to improve production, Mrs. Sanh B. is applying for a loan in order to buy another small piece of land for growing rice. 

Her husband, Mr. U Soeurng, is a fisherman. They have five children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory. The younger two are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a small piece of land for growing rice

loans.name: Rocío Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rocío del Carmen V. tiene 31 años. Es casada y vive con su marido y 3 hijos, Morelia (11), Dixon (4) y su bebe de 7 meses, en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

Rocío es una socia de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa, que está ubicada a una hora y media del cantón Chillanes.  Son 18 socios en total, que en la mayoridad tienen sus propios negocios. Esto es el primer  préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Rocío compra y vende pollos. Realiza sus compras en Bucay. 
Solicita el préstamo para su negocio de pollos. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio
texts.en:
Rocío del Carmen V. is 31 years old. She is married and has three children; Morelia 11, Dixon 4, and her 7 month old baby. She lives with her family in Chillanes Canton in the province of Bolivar. Rocio is a member of the rural communal bank “Santa Rosa” which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes Canton. There are 18 members in total and the majority have their own businesses. This is the first loan that she is taking out with Cooperativa San José. Rocio buys and sells chickens. She makes her purchases in Bucay. She is requesting the loan for her chicken business. Her dream is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chicken business

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik T. was born in 1966 and is married with three children. She lives in Ijevan city and, since 2007, she has been engaged in selling fruits and vegetables. Her husband and one of her sons help her in this business and, thanks to the income from the business, they have supported their family, bought necessary furniture for their home, and bought a small car for delivering fruits and vegetables.

Now Hasmik and her family intend to increase their business, so they need bigger vehicle for delivery. They already sold their small car, but the proceeds from the car’s sale isn't enough to buy a delivery truck. So they need a 350,000 AMD loan to add to the sale proceeds to buy a delivery truck. This truck will allow them to bring more fruits and vegetables from villages to their business place in Ijevan city.

loans.use: To buy a delivery truck for her business

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel M. is from the village of Arevshat in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is an honest hardworking person with 20 years of experience in farming.  Samvel is married with three children.  He has two daughters (10 and 11 years old) and a 7-year-old son. 

Samvel wishes some day to save enough funds to renovate the family house.  He is seeking a loan to purchase fertilizers to expand his vegetable growing business.  With the loan, Samvel expect to increase the family income by 25%.  Both Samvel and his wife like living in Arevshat because they are close to all their friends and extended family.  In addition to supporting his family, Samvel also helps his sick aunt with vegetables grown on his farm.  He expects success in his business due to his skills and the good quality of his farmland.

loans.use: fertilizers

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida F. is a single woman who lives in Prk. 2, Brgy. Inalad, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a general (sari-sari) store.  Aida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Aida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7000, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th cycle cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10000, which she intends to use to buy more stocks and basic commodities to sell in her general store so that she could continue to save up for the future, improve her living conditions, and have more opportunities for expansion. Aida F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: more merchandise and stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sonia Isabel

texts.es: Sonia Isabel P. O. de 46 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, ubicado al oriente del país, ella es una señora muy responsable y trabajadora  la  cual cuenta con muy buenos valores, razón por la que es muy respetada y querida. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante, manera a través de la cual aporta a su hogar, así mismo vive junto a dos hijos menores  de edad. Sonia brinda el apoyo financiero necesario a su esposo, a través de una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual les permite contar con una vida estable, en la cual pueden suplir  las necesidades de sus hijos con muchos esfuerzos de todo lo necesario. Sonia solicita un préstamo a través del cual le pueda brindar la ayuda necesario a su esposo, surtiendo más la tienda con productos como: medicinas, bebidas, pan, golosinas y otros más, así de esta forma ella espera obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sonia Isabel P. O. is 46 years old. She lives in the departament of Usulután, located in the eastern region of the country, She is a very responsible and hard working woman who has very good values. For this reason, she is very respected and well liked. She lives with her husband who works as a merchant, which is how he supports the family. She also lives with her two minor children. Sonia helps her husband financially through a perishable products and basic necessities store. This allows them to have a stable life and, with a lot of hard work, provide them with every thing they need. Sonia is asking for a loan with which she can offer her husband the help he needs, diversifying her store more with products such as: medicine, beverages, bread, snacks and others. In this way, she hopes to obtain more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products of  basic necessity.

loans.name: Great Hope Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
34-year-old A. Harriet who belongs to 'Great Hope' development group, Mukono, is uncompromisingly relentless as regards running her 5-year-old cosmetics  sales business in a way that she says will make her make more profit and above all establish a good reputation for her business. 

With this sense of purpose she has made great strides in terms of attracting customers who range from low, middle to high income earners within her Kito locality, Mukono. This has translated into increased sales and hence more profits. 

 Being a family-oriented woman, these circumstances have been momentous for her as she has, based on her business, sought the betterment of her family.  Harriet pays tribute to her husband who she says pep-talked her into setting forth in this business. In a month, this mother of one makes 70,000 shillings. With this loan she says she is going to buy more boxes of cosmetics for resale and also purchase machines to use in her beauty salon.

loans.use: purchase more boxes of cosmetics for resale and machines to use in her beauty salon

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is part of the communal bank “Esperanza de Colombo” and resides in the city of San Vicente. For the past four years, Aurora has been selling used clothing in a stand that she rents. It is located in the center of the city, beside her daughter's stand. Aurora attends to her business from Monday through Saturday from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m.
 
With this loan, Aurora plans to purchase merchandise and materials (paint and other items) to repair small damages to her stand caused by the February 27, 2010, earthquake. 

Aurora dreams of owning a car to manage with greater ease the purchase of her merchandise, as Aurora travels to Santiago every month, along with her daughter and her husband, who accompanies them when he’s off work. Aurora's motivation is to have sufficient economic security for her son; he’s 16 years old and has the capacity to continue his studies in the university.  

Aurora is pleased with how easy it is for Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza to provide her the funds of the loan, without many prerequisites. Aurora also values the entrepreneurial training delivered by her loan officer during the weekly meetings, especially the topic of how to administer your business. 

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a commune zone in the center of Chile, belonging to the Region of Libertador General Bernardo O’Higgins, located on the banks of the Estero Zamorano River. San Vincente de Tagua Tagua's main source of income is based on the production of lemons, oranges and avocados.

loans.use: Used clothes and repairs for her stand

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma N. lives in the Kawala neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. Fatuma has had a canteen business for 10 years, and  works six days a week. She sells her products at the near-by school. Fatuma has requested a loan of  400,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, to buy more cakes, donuts, biscuits, samosas and bread for her canteen. She also generates additional income through renting rooms. Her main business challenges include school holidays and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build more rental rooms and to get permanent business premises. Fatuma lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bread, donuts, samosas, and cakes for her canteen

loans.name: Rikaton

texts.en:
Rikaton N., age 42, is married to N. who is a farmer.  Together they have four children aged 20, 13, 10, and 2.   She lives in Enkaroni and her business is in the Bissil market which is in Kitengela.  She sells curios and also practises farming as a secondary business. She was introduced to Kadet by the Credit Officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Rikaton has been running this business for six years and she makes a monthly profit of Kshs 7,000.  The Bissil market is a very busy market.  With the loan she plans to buy more curios, swords and belts for resale, and with the extra income generated she will expand her business and open shops in Nairobi.

With the big plans Rikaton has for the future, she has a dream to sell her curios to tourists in Nairobi.

Rikaton is hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy curios for resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 51-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has the zeal to increase his daily household income. He lives in his own house and is charged with the responsibility of providing basics for his five family members, with his wife providing backup. It is now ten years since he started commercial farming. With his earnings from the sector, he has been able to educate his children. His grand business idea is to become a mechanized farmer. Charles intends to use this loan to buy improved seedlings of maize and beans for planting.

loans.use: To buy seedlings of maize and beans for planting

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar and her family live in a two room brick house in Riwind, a small city in Pakistan.  She started an embroidery business few years ago and makes a good profit every month. 

She is married to S. who purchases young animals, raised them, and sells them to butchers and other people to make profit.  

Kosar has one son and three daughters who are enrolled in school and are getting their education.  Kosar works very hard to pay off their school fees. She wants them to complete their education and become successful in their lives. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to support her husband’s business to buy and raise more animals.  He's been in business for 15  years.

Kosar is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application.  In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit history and never missed a meeting. 

Note: Kosar is in the center of the photo.

loans.use: To buy animals for animal sales business

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.en:
Muhamadi H. is a single man who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He has operated a fruit and vegetable stall for more than a year, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. Muhamadi faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in the market. He hopes to expand his vegetables stall and get more earnings from the sales.

With the 20000 KES he wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits for his stall. He decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of the financial services provided.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits for his vegetables stall

loans.name: Antonio Segundo

texts.es: El señor Antonio Martínez Ramírez tiene 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla en compañía de su esposa y 5 hijos. Tiene un puesto estacionario de comidas en el cual vende carne asada, pechuga de pollo a la plancha, perros calientes, embutidos, hamburguesas y bandejas de papitas fritas con salchichas. El negocio tiene 13 años de existencia y está ubicado en las afueras del centro comercial Metrocentro, a una cuadra del estadio Metropolitano de fútbol, el más grande de Colombia. Todos los días empieza a vender sus alimentos a las 4 P.M. y su jornada se extiende hasta después de media noche. Los días de mayor venta son los viernes,  sábados y domingos, especialmente cuando juega el equipo local de fútbol, Junior  de Barranquilla. La esposa del microempresario le ayuda a preparar las salsas y los ingredientes con que sazona sus comidas. Este es el quinto crédito que tramita en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra al por mayor de víveres. Siempre se ha distinguido por su puntualidad en los pagos. Antes de vincularse a la Fundación, El señor Antonio se financiaba con créditos personales de usureros que diariamente llegaban a cobrarle al negocio. La tasa de interés que pagaba era altísima y nunca le quedaba algún excedente para poder ahorrar.  El promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 70.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 45%. Aunque la reciente temporada invernal afectó negativamente sus ingresos, el microempresario se muestra optimista hacia el futuro porque ya tiene una clientela acreditada. La competencia que tiene en el sector es fuerte y por eso se esmera en ofrecer un buen producto, a un precio justo y sobre todo, con una esmerada atención.
texts.en:
Antonio Martínez Ramírez is 43 years old.  He lives in the city of Barranquilla with his wife and five children.  He has a stationary food stall where he sells roasted meat, grilled chicken breast, hot dogs, sausages, burgers and trays of French fries with sausages.  He has had his business for 13 years and it is located just outside the Metrocentro shopping mall, one block from the Metropolitano soccer stadium, the biggest in Colombia.

Every day, Antonio starts selling his food at 4.00pm and his work day continues until after midnight.  His best days for sales are Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays, especially when the local soccer team, Junior de Barranquilla, are playing.  This small businessman's wife helps him to prepare his sauces and the ingredients with which he seasons his food.

This is Antonio's fifth loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he plans to invest it in buying ingredients wholesale.  Antonio has always stood out for his punctuality in making his loan repayments.  Before he came to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Antonio took personal loans through loan sharks who called at his business daily to collect payment.  The interest rate that he paid was very high and he never had anything left over so he couldn't make any savings.

Antonio's average daily sales are 70,000 Colombian pesos and his profit margin is 45%.  Although the recent winter season negatively affected his income, this small businessman is optimistic for the future because he already has an existing customer base.  The competition in his field is strong and for this reason he takes care to offer a good product at a fair price and, above all, with very good customer service.

loans.use: To buy ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Sou's Group

texts.en: The six people who make up this group loan live in Snuol Khpos village in Takeo province. They will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to improve their families' living. They have selected Mrs. Sou C. to became the group leader.  She was born in 1954.  She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land on which she grows rice to sell to support her family.   Besides farming,  Sou C. is also a weaver. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Sou C. is asking for a loan to buy more silk. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is a weaver, while the others are farmers.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Gloria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria Bustamente es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive en la comunidad de Llariviña que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, en esta parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, cuenta con una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes cargos.
 
La Señora. Gloria tiene 26 años, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad y ahora está embarazada de 7 meses y esta muy contenta por ello. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil y también es agricultor, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en una casa de un familiar.
 
Doña Gloria debido a su estado de gestación se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, también cría ganado y  aves de corral.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito y fue invitada por la señora presidenta del banco comunal quien es su amiga, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y ganado. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria B. is a member of the Unión Progresista (Progressive Union) communal bank.  She lives in the community of Llariviña which belongs to Santa Ana parish.  In this parish one can view a large part of the city of Cuenca.  It has beautiful views of nature.  Its residents are farmers and raise animals; many work at various jobs in the city.

Gloria is 26 years old, lives in a common law relationship and has a 3 year old son.  She is now seven months pregnant and is very happy because of this.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer and is also a farmer.  She does not have a house of her own and lives in a relative’s house.

Because of her current pregnancy, Gloria does household chores and raises cattle and barnyard fowl.

This is her second loan.  She was invited by the bank’s Madam President, who is her friend.  The money from the loan will be used to buy cattle and chickens.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy cattle and chickens.

loans.name: Gladys Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Gladys Mercedes P. S. se dedica a la venta de gaseosas ,golosinas,comida y otros en el kiosko de la Universidad Alas Peruanas hace dos años aproximadamente , el cual es alquilado. Vive en casa familiar con su hija la cual es menor de edad y se encuentra en etapa escolar tiene otro hijo pero es independiente. Requiere del crédito para invertir en mercadería para su negocio ya que empieza a llegar la totalidad de alumnado y por tanto necesita abastecerse. Se le otorgará el crédito por que cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales .
texts.en: Mrs.Gladys Mercedes P. S. has sold soft drinks, candies and food among other things in a rented kiosk at the Universidad Alas Peruanas for approximately two years. She lives in her family home with her daughter, who is a school aged minor. She has another son, but he is on his own.  She requires the loan to invest in merchandise for her business since all of students are starting to come in and she needs to be supplied. She will be given the loan because she has good personal and professional references.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Simeona

texts.es:
Doña Ana, tiene 61 años, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, vive en compañía de su esposo y dos hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad.
Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 35 años, aprendió a elaborarlas cuando trabajo en un comedor, actualmente lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal, lo atiende de 5:00am a 6:00pm. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de maíz, leña y gas, con la adquisición de estos materiales espera continuar con el negocio de una forma más solvente, con todo lo necesario para realizar sus ventas diarias.
Su principal aspiración es que el negocio cada vez crezca más, que le  produzca más ganancias para ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios y en un futuro contar con mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Doña Ana is 61 years old and lives in Jucuapa in the department of Usulután with her husband and two children, ages 18 and 15.  She has been selling tortillas for 35 years.  She learned how to make them when she worked in a diner.  She now has a stall in the municipal market and opens from 5:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  

She is requesting the loan to buy corn, firewood and gas.  With these materials she hopes to continue her business and make it more economically sound by having everything she needs for her daily sales.

Her main goal is to grow her business and increase earnings to help her children with their education and to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood and gas

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa J. is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Felisa is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Felisa plants and harvests sugar cane for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Felisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felisa is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used for farm maintenance labor and to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan is her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer for her sugar cane farm

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz M. is 52 years old. She has a business purchasing and reselling cows and sheep. She has six children, who help in her business. Solmaz would like a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and ultimately, greater profit for her family.

In the future, Solmaz would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase more cows and increase her income even further. She plans to use the increased income to save for the purchase of a house.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and six lambs

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Alicia works hard to support her family. She has a food production/sales business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming.  Alicia is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela tiene 59 años, es viuda y vive al lado de sus 2 hijas mayores que ya son independientes y tiene su propia familia. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a la venta de leche, producto que extrae de una vaca que posee. Es así que todas las mañanas realiza el ordeño, en donde sus hijas la ayudan en esta tarea, ya que es una actividad constante y de mucha paciencia. Asimismo la leche que extrae lo procesa en yogurt natural y queso, productos que también vende. El establo donde cría su vaca lo tiene ubicado en casa de un familiar, ya que dispone de amplio espacio. Por otro lado, vende mazamorras, y lo hace de manera ambulante, de esa manera se genera ingresos diarios. Manifiesta que esta contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que son años de experiencia y con el tiempo ha logrado ganar clientela, que en su mayoría son comerciantes de productos lácteos y que vienen de otras ciudades. Su gran anhelo es tener más vacas. Es su crédito número 14 con MFP,  se siente muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal 
Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca más para su establo.
texts.en:
Adela is 59 years old.  She is a widow and lives alongside her two daughters who are grown up and have their own families.  For more than 18 years, Adela has been selling milk which she gets from a cow that she owns.  She milks her cow every morning.  Her daughters help her in this task since it is a constant activity that requires a lot of patience.  Adela processes the milk into natural yoghurt and cheese which she also sells.  The stable where she keeps her cow is located on a family member's property since they have a lot of space.

Adela also sells 'mazamorra' (a corn-based pudding) as an itinerant street vendor.  In this way, she makes a daily income.  Adela tells us that she is happy with the work that she does since she has years of experience and, over the years, she has managed to gain customers who are mainly people who sell dairy products and come from other towns.

Adela's big wish is to own more cows.  This is her 14th loan from MFP.  She feels very happy to be a member of her community bank.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying another cow for her stable.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr: Jean H. est soudeur, et célibataire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des tôles et clous pour la construction de sa maison d’habitation.  Il n’y a pas de difficultés attendues de non-remboursement du crédit.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de construire une maison a louer pour augmenter son revenu.  Apres qu’il construit sa propre maison, il va se marier.  Son ambition pour sa vie est de créer une famille.
texts.en: Jean H. is a welder. HE is single. He will use his loan to purchase metal sheets and nails to build a house to live in. He doesn’t expect any problems repaying his loan. His business strategy is to build a house to rent out in order to increase his revenues. After he has his own house built, he is going to get married. His goal is to start a family.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and nails for building a house

loans.name: Crisologo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “GRAN RENOVACION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Crisologo; el tiene 59 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, el vende en forma independiente como casacas, ropas interiores, chompas y pantalones llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor como pantalones, casacas y ropas interiores.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sr. Crisologo, 59, is a member of the GRAN RENOVACION community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

He is married and has 4 children.  He operates a clothing sales business.  Among other things, he sells coats, underwear, sweaters and pants, offering his merchandise everywhere he can find buyers.  He wants to expand and improve his business so he's applying for a loan to buy wholesale supplies of merchandise such as pants, coats and underwear that he will then resell.

Sr. Crisologo is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of clothing for his retail business.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es: La señora Roberta es de la comunidad de Moyotepec, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 52 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos José Alberto de 34 años de edad, Juan Carlos de 30 años de edad, Blanca Selene de 26 años de edad ellos son casados  y Jezabel de 16 años de edad es soltera está estudiando danza árabe, ella tiene su taller familiar de bordado y deshilado, ella solicito su crédito para comprar materia prima hilos, pellón, tela como tergal, manta, Camboya para elaborar manteles, rebosos, mandiles, servilletas pintadas y bordadas, ella inicio su negocio hace 25 años por necesidad porque era madre soltera y comenzó a trabajar entro a un proyecto del gobierno federal le dieron para comprar sus maquinas de coser, puso su taller familiar de bordado y deshilado donde trabajan ella su esposo y sus hijos, su negocio es importante porque tiene trabajo la familia y se siente orgullosa ver que sus hijas están aprendiendo lo que ella inicio, de trabajar elaborando los rebosos y los manteles hacerles los bordados, los deshilados y verlos ya terminados que son originales y bonitos, su negocio es popular porque es una artesanía especial con diseños de colores en los bordados, ella tiene la esperanza de agrandar el taller para el porvenir de sus hijos, Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “ gracias por su ayuda y que nos sigan apoyando con los prestamos”. Moyotepec es un pueblo bonito hay campo siembra maíz, caña de clima cálido.
texts.en:
Roberta is from the community of Moyotepec, Ayala in the State of Morelos, México.  She is 52 years old, separated and has four children: José Alberto, 34, Juan Carlos, 30, Blanca Selene, 26, all married and Jezebel, 16, who is single and studying belly dancing.  

She has a family embroidery and openwork workshop.  She asked for her loan to buy raw materials: thread, fleece, Tergal (polyester), cotton skirting and twill to make tablecloths, shawls, aprons, painted and embroidered napkins.  She started her business 25 years ago due to need because she was a single mother and needed to work.  She enrolled in a program sponsored by the federal government that gave her her sewing machines.  She set up her family embroidery and openwork shop where she, her husband and her children work.  Her business is important because the family has employment and she is proud to see that her daughters are learning what she began; they work making the shawls and embroidering the tablecloths, the open work and to see them finished in such an original and pretty way.  Her business is popular because it’s special craftsmanship with colored embroidered designs.  Her hope is to enlarge the workshop for her children’s future.

She wants to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad:  “Thank you for your help and please continue to support us with the loans.” 

Moyotepec is a pretty town.  It has fields of corn and sugar cane.  The weather is hot.

loans.use: to buy thread, fleece, Tergal (polyester), cotton skirting, twill, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and four children; two of them are still attending school. He has 30 years of experience working as a farmer. He started running his own business in 1990.

 He cultivates all types of vegetables and fruit using large plastic tents to better monitor his products' growth. He sells his goods to multiple fruit and vegetable shops. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase fertilizers and seeds. In the future, he is planning to further expand his business operation. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Mario José

texts.es:
Mario José tiene 32 años, es soltero vive con su hija, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijos Magnolia de 5 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz y arroz.


Mario se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz,  Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para mejorar su producción  y suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener un auto para ampliar su negocio. Enfrenta el desafío de la sequia.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Mario José, 32, is single and lives with his daughter, Magnolia, 5, in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.  
The members of his communal bank V.R.C. Valle Alto meet in the Voluntad de Dios office in Ventanas canton.  This chapter is dedicated to short cycle crops and they grow corn and rice.

Mario works as a farmer and grows these two crops.  He buys his supplies in the store, Comercial  Peña, and sells them in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for the corn and rice crops.  The support of the financing will help him improve his production and cover his needs.  His dream is to have a car so that he can enlarge his business.  He confronts challenges such as lack of rain.
He likes sports.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
This is Esperanza, 46, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rasty, who was previously a driver and construction worker, but he stopped working because he had a mild stroke.  Esperanza is also a mother of two children, both are still studying. Together, with her husband and children, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Esperanza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Esperanza earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells cold cuts and fish. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 278 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. A portion of the loan will be used for additional capital for her fish business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Esperanza hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to have an additional business like direct selling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en: Florentina works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for her abaca weaving. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. In the future, Florentina would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Rocío Melisa

texts.es: Rocío es socia del Banco Comunal Belén, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace un año, trabaja en un taller donde confeccionan polos, entró a Finca Perú con la mentalidad de poder tener su taller propio, y ahora con este préstamo se comprara sus primeras máquinas para su taller, esta muy feliz por cumplir su sueño, agradece por todo lo que le enseñaron, sobre todo el ahorrar, le encantan las capacitaciones porque le ayudaron a poder fijarse metas y poder cumplirlas.
texts.en:
Rocío is a member of the Communal Bank “Belén” (Bethlehem). She has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year. Rocío works at a factory that makes polo shirts. She joined FINCA Peru with the intention of starting her own workshop.

Now that she has this loan, she will buy the first set of machines for her workshop. Rocío is very happy to fulfill her dream and is very grateful for everything she learned, most of all how to save. She enjoys the training seminars because they have helped her with establishing goals and accomplishing them.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for starting her own workshop.

loans.name: Yakob

texts.en:
Yakob is a 45-year-old farmer who lives in his own house with two children.  Adrian, 20, is studying in Local University and Indra, 17, is studying at the 2nd grade of Senior High School. His wife passed away a year ago, so Yakob is responsible of taking care of his children. Yakob has a plot of land that supports him by generating money. He cultivates paddy and corn at the farm. Due to the limited irrigation, Yakob could not generate much money from the harvest.

Because of this, Yakob is planning to try another business: he would like to buy crops such as rice, corns, pumpkins, green beans, bananas, and cassavas from other farmers and then resell them in local markets. 

Yakob is seeking a loan of 10,000,000 from TLM to purchase these crops. He is hoping that TLM will assist him by providing a loan for his business.

loans.use: to purchase crops (e.g: rice, corns, pumpkins, green beans, bananas, and cassavas) to sell at local markets.

loans.name: Selman

texts.en: Selman is a 31-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. He has owned a shoe shop in his town for the past seven years. He always presents the new trends and collections to his customers in order to satisfy their demands. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new shoes. He hopes that the diverse selection of new merchandise will generate good profits and enable him to expand his business even further. He expects that his business sales and income will be increased as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase new shoes

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, a 48-year-old married mother of five children, the oldest 23 years old, is a farmer who has been growing and selling rice for 23 years. She earns about 5,000 Philippine pesos per month. Josephine plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides, and hopes to be able to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil lives in Vale, in the southern part of the mountainous region of Georgia. He is 53 years old, married, and lives with his wife, Elmira, and 3 daughters (17, 12 and 11 years old).  All three children go to school.  Elmira is a housewife and also she helps her husband in the family agricultural business. Avtandil and Elmira have 1.5 hectares of land. They grow potatoes and sell  5 tons of potatoes per year on average to the greengrocery retailers. Along with potato growing, Avtandil is busy in his own workshop. He is a joiner and makes various types of furniture: furniture for bedrooms, kitchen and dining rooms. He sells the furniture in nearby towns. Total average monthly income for this 5 person family is 500 Laris (approximately 300 USD). 

Avtandil requested credit for purchasing a new, modern joiner’s bench. It will allow Avtandil to improve the quality of the produced furniture, as well as to increase the volume of production. As Avtandil sells more and better quality products, his income will increase.  Avtandil and Elvira plan to use it for purchasing new goods for the children and household in order to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a joiner's bench

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat, 41, is a hardworking business man who is married and blessed with one child. He has run a grocery business for the last two years to make a living.  He works hard to improve the living standard of his family.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 39-year-old married man and the father of four children.  He says his children represent his whole life. Abbass works in furniture making since 25 years ago, this long experience gave him customers trust and respect. Abbass is requesting a loan from Kiva-partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary wood requested for a special furniture project requested. 
Abbass is willing to support bed room industry as much as he can, because it’s highly requested by most of his customers, he’s willing to make his own showroom, and to improve it as much as he can, to provide the best living to his family.

loans.use: to buy wood for furniture making

loans.name: Rosa Digna

texts.es:
Rosa, se ha decidido de nuevo a adquirir otro crédito, porque quiere ampliar el negocio y surtirla de productos plásticos como: platos, cantaros, depósitos para basura, baldes, picheles, el propósito de ella es tener variedad y ofrecerles a los clientes lo que necesitan en sus hogares. Los financiamientos anteriores le ayudaron a mejorar su negocio y a surtirlo y de esa forma atendió a los clientes mejor, este avance le ayudo a tener mejor rentabilidad y su familia ha tenido mejor estabilidad económica.
Rosa se atraso en unos pagos, ya que tuvo unos problemas que le dificultaron estar al dia con el estado de cuenta.
texts.en: Rosa has decided to get a another loan because she wants to expand the business and stock it with plastic items like plates, jugs, trash receptacles, buckets and pitchers.  Her goal is to have variety and offer her customers what they need for their homes.  Previous loans helped her to improve her business and to stock it to provide better customer service.  This advance helped her be more profitable and her family has had better economic stability.  Rosa fell behind on a few payments because she had some problems that made it difficult for her to be up to date with her account statement.

loans.use: to buy plates, jugs, pitchers, trash receptacles, buckets.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al trabajo como docente del nivel secundario en el distrito de Anta,el socio ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de productos lacteos como leche,yogurt y quesos,el reparte a las diferentes tiendas donde vende productos lacteos,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos lacteos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar leche,quesos y yogurt al por mayor.  

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member works as a high school teacher in the Anta district,and also sells dairy products such as milk, cheese and yogurt, which he distributes to various business establishments.  Through this business he has supported his children and he now wishes to expand his sales. He seeks this credit to buy milk, cheese, and yogurt wholesale.  He is pleased with his participation and is committed to prompt repayment.

loans.use: to buy milk, cheese, and yogurt wholesale.

loans.name: Nilda Zenobia

texts.es: La señora Nilda, tiene 56 años D. edad, la señora es D. origen humilD., ella tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales 2 ya son casados y viven en otra ciudad, ella solo mantiene a dos D. sus hijos que aun son menores D. edad. Doña Nilda tiene casita propia el cual le heredo su papa y esta esta ubicada en la zona central D. la localidad Sacaba, la Sra. Nilda se dedica al comercio D. comida desD. hace mas D. 10 años, Ella venD. comida D. miércoles a lunes, tomándose así un día D. descanso, esto porque los días martes es vacío y no hay venta. El préstamo lo invertirá en compra D. insumos para la elaboración D. comidas como arroz, fideo, aceite, papa, la sra. Nilda es un apersona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Nilda is 56 years old and of humble origin.  She has four children, two of whom are already married and live in another city.  She only supports two of her children who are still young.  Nilda owns her own small house which her father gave her as an inheritance.  It is located in the central area of the town of Sacaba.  Nilda has been selling food for more than 10 years.  She sells her food from Wednesday to Monday, taking one rest day.  This is because Tuesdays are not busy and there are no sales to be maD.. 

Nilda will invest her loan in buying supplies for making her food such as rice, noodles, oil and potatoes.  Nilda is a very hard-working person and she feels happy for the support she is being given.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making food

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years.

Zosima requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her abaca weaving.

In the future, Zosima would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her abaca weaving

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 34 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 5 years, she has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells shoes.

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes for resale, and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 44 years old, married and has three children. She has been in dairy farming for the past six years and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. She is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES with Kiva partner KADET. She will use the loan to purchase dairy feed, i.e. hay, molasses, ground feeds, and grow Napier grass to supplement the off-the-shelf feeds. With the anticipated profits, she will educate her children.
Eunice's dream is to grow her dairy farming business to a larger scale and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 30-year-old, married woman with five children, four of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Sarah requests this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Aila is a 35 year old woman from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan who helps support 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 650 JOD to buy materials for sewing and embroidery. She is planning on opening a shop to sell her embroidery. Her aspirations are to have her children complete their education.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing and embroidery

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman and has four children aged between eighteen and twenty-nine years. She runs a water filtering business, which is located in a busy area. Mary plans to use the loan to buy more bottles to use in her business. She has done this business for five years, and her customers are shops that sell drinking water. Mary faces a challenge of slow movement of the drinking water. But, Mary is optimistic and plans to use the anticipated profits to start other shops for selling water. She has another business running a school, where she earns extra income. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more bottles to use in the drinking water business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Julie owns a big store in her village. She deals in General Merchandising. Her service in the community is helpful as it helps community members to acquire their needs at local self-service shop operated by Julie. She was among the first 10 participants who benefited from the TEACH lending skills training organized by KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION 1997. She has followed her marketing plan and that has carried her to this far. An $800 Kiva loan would strengthen her entrepreneurial abilities in salesmanship in her community.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi operates her BBQ business on Saturdays and Wednesdays, prime days for selling BBQ plates. Naomi’s children are young and she works hard to support their schooling. Though her husband works hard too, her income is needed to provide for the family.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cottons of mutton flaps, 2 ctns leq quarters, 2 boxes sausages

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is married and has two daughters aged 13 and 17, and a young son aged 4. Her husband works as a custodian in an elementary school, nonetheless, the wages he earns are insufficient to cover all of the family's needs.

Hence, 5 years ago Elisa decided to start her own business selling food. She started with a street-stand which her husband bought for her. She works it at night in a strategic location within her neighbourhood. Elisa and her husband work arduously day after day since they wish to offer a better life quality to their children and hope they can contribute to their education.

Currently, Elisa's business has been growing and her clientèle increases on and on. In order to cover the demand for her products, she is requesting a loan of $275 which she will employ to purchase the supplies necessary to continue working. She is offering to pay back the loan in 4 to 8 months.

You can contribute to the growth of this business and the well-being of this family. Make your mind and support them!

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Elisa es casada y tiene dos hijas de 13 y 17 años de edad y un pequeño hijo de 4 años. Su esposo labora como intendente en una escuela primaria, sin embargo el salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir tosa las necesidades de su familia, razón por la que Elisa decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de comida desde hace cinco años, empezó en un carrito de tacos que le compró su esposo, lo atiende por las noches en un lugar estratégico de su colonia. Elisa y su esposo desean poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y que ellos puedan concluir sus estudios, para lo que trabajan arduamente día a día.

Actualmente el negocio de Elisa ha estado creciendo y sus clientes se incrementan cada vez más, para poder cubrir la demanda por sus productos ella solicita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que requiere para continuar trabajando, mismo que ofrece devolver en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio y al bienestar de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Purchasing supplies

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
Maria Salome is married and has a young daughter. Her husband has a manual labor job, but his wages are very low and are not able to cover the family’s basic needs. To earn an extra income, Maria decided to begin working. She started as a kitchen helper, and a short time later, and with more experience and her savings, she started up her own business selling hamburgers, tamales and other foods. This business has flourished due to her good work.

The love she has for her daughter and her faithful commitment to her husband push her everyday to improve and expand her business. Maria is asking for a $200 loan which she will use to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her dishes. She will pay the loan back in 3 months. Support Maria, she will greatly appreciate the opportunity you give her to keep expanding her business and improve the life of her family.

Maria Salome es casada y tiene una pequeña hija, su esposo trabaja como obrero pero su salario es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, para obtener un ingreso extra Maria decidió comenzar a trabajar, inició como ayudante de cocina y poco después con la experiencia y los ahorros que pudo acumular empezó su propio negocio con la venta de hamburguesas, tamales y comidas, en donde ha logrado prosperar gracias al buen trabajo que realiza.

El gran amor que siente hacia sus hijos y el fiel compromiso que tiene con su esposo son lo que la motiva día a día a mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio, ahora Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos que necesita para la elaboración de sus comidas, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Decídete a apoyar a Maria, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le das de continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar la vida de su familia.

loans.use:
Purchase of ingredients

Compra de insumos

loans.name: Yoen

texts.en: Mrs. Yoen Chuum, 44, lives with her husband and 4 children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She earns $1.70 a day selling vegetables, whilst her husband earns $10 a day buying and selling motorbikes. Two of her children are employed at a nearby garment factory, earning $80 a month each. The family's income is pooled and they all look after each other. She has applied for this loan in order to repair their house. In particular, she would like to fix the leaking roof.

loans.use: to repair home

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza / Faith And Hope Group

texts.en:
Ruben is a hard working and honest man; he does the best he can to proviD. for his 96-year-old mother in law (who is very ill), as well as his own wife and their seven children.

He is asking for this loan so that he can continue to buy larger amounts of viviera (vegetables, fruits, etc.) to sell to his community. With the loan he is able to buy in bulk more, and thus save some money.

His dream is to one day build his store out of concrete blocks, with a concrete counter, roof, and floor. He is also building a house out of concrete right now, each month he is able to buy a few more blocks to add on. He hopes that in a year or two his house will be finished.

Ruben is very thankful to everyone for helping him with this loan, and says that without it, his life would not have advanced nearly so much.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables and other food staples

loans.name: Niyameddin

texts.en: Niyameddin M. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  He is 28 years old, married and has one son.  He is engaged in cattle-breeding.  Niyameddin needs a loan in the amount of $350 to buy one calf.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
In order to help with the household finances, Susana had the idea of setting up a hair salon away from home. However, because she had to look after her three children she decided to move her business to her house.

In this manner, Susana offers beauty treatments and services as well as beauty products for sale.

If she had the resources she would expand her business and open a bazaar. However, her biggest dream is to set up a beauty school at her home.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

A fin de ayudar con la economía de la casa, Susana tuvo la idea de poner una peluquería fuera de casa. Sin embargo, por la preocupación de cuidar a sus 3 hijos, trasladó su negocio a su hogar.

Es así como Susana además de ofrecer servicios de arreglo personal, vende productos de belleza.

De tener la posibilidad, ampliaría su negocio y pondría un bazar. Pero su más grande sueño es poner un instituto de belleza en su casa.

loans.use: To expand her business and start a beauty school

loans.name: Adham

texts.en: Adham is a 36 year old father of 2. He works and lives with his wife and children in south Lebanon, in Saida. Adham works in a bakery and needs a loan help him open his own bakery. He is determined to be professionally independent and to raise his living standards.

loans.use: To help him open his own bakery

loans.name: Sheraly

texts.ru:
Sheraly Rahmonovich H. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 42 years old, married with no children. He has college education and is an engineer by profession. He works at the aluminum factory as a shift supervisor. He plans to use the loan to repair his apartment. This will allow Sheraly to improve his living conditions as his salary is not very large and is not enough to allow him to repair the apartment without a loan. He will be able to pay off the loan by small amounts within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хисочаев Шерали Рахмонович проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 42 года. Женат детей не имеет. Образование высшее. По профессии инженер.Работает на Аллюминиевом заводе мастером смены. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы отремонтировать свою квартиру. Это позволит клиенту улучшить условия жизни, так как его заработная плата не так велика, чтобы он смог отремантировать квартиру без помощи кредита.Получив кредит клиент сможет частично погашать кредит в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To repair apartment

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr:
Mr. Seye is a professional cobbler, a craft which he learned from his parents for over 20 years and with which he feeds his family. He specializes in making shoes, purses, and other items made from leather. This is a business which requires substantial working capital and for this reason he is seeking financial support.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr Seye est cordonnier de profession, métier qu’il hérité de ses parents depuis plus d’une vingtaine d’années et avec lequel il nourrit sa famille. Il s’est spécialisé dans la fabrication de chaussures, de sacs et d’autres articles à base se cuir. C’est une activité qui nécessite un fonds de roulement importat c’est à cet effet qu’il demande un appui financier

loans.use: Strengthening working capital

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 24 year-old Clara W.. She is married, and has one child, aged 1. In 2005, Clara established her tailoring business. She earns about US $40 every month from this business. Clara requires a loan in order to purchase stocks of bedsheets and traditional cloth in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets.
