The lack of tangible collateral assets means they are deemed not-creditworthy by financial institutions, restricting access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of bedsheets and traditional cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Omowumi

texts.en:
During a visit to A., it was discovered that she has a small kiosk where she sells cosmetics. Although the kiosk is small according to her, the business is moving and booming. “I have been managing the little loan that I borrowed from LAPO Microfinance to sustain my business," she said. She acquired the skill over 3 years and she has been in this business since the year 2000. She is 34 years old and she is married with 4 children. She has been a leader in a lending group for the past 5 years.

A. needs the sum of $700 to buy more cosmetics so that she can expand her business, thereby increasing her profit margin. She remains grateful to Kiva and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for sales

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi S. is 32 years old, married, and the father of four. He has been working as a cabinet maker for five years in Assahoun, a village located about 50 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Mr. Komi is regarded among cabinet makers as the most reputable in his area, and he earns the trust of his customers because of the quality of his work. Thanks to this loan, he wishes to buy planks to fill orders he has received. He intends to improve his family's living conditions using the profits he will make from his work. Komi is the person appearing on the right in the photo.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Komi S. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il exerce l’activité de menuiserie, depuis 5 ans à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur Komi est compté parmi les menuisiers les plus réputés de sa localité et il gagne la confiance de ses clients à cause de la qualité de ses œuvres. Grâce à ce crédit, il désire acheter des planches pour la réalisation des commandes reçues. Il compte améliore les conditions de sa famille par les profits qu’il tirera de son travail. Komi est la personne située du côté droit dans la photo.

loans.use: To buy planks to produce the items on order

loans.name: Zineta

texts.en: Zineta K. is a 50 year old woman from the town of Doboj.  She is married and her husband receives a small pension.  To support themselves, they have been farming. They grow tomatoes, peppers, and potatoes. This is Zineta's 2nd loan from ŽZene za ZŽene. She is requesting $950 to buy more seeds as well as pesticides and compost for farming.  In the next months, Zineta will be growing lots of potatoes, as these will be a good item to sell through the fall and winter.  Her husband's pension is too small for the both of them, so she needs the additional income from these sales to make sure they can support themselves.

loans.use: to buy seeds and materials to help grow potatoes

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is 31 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos state with her family. Kehinde sells tinned tomato paste and seasoning. Kehinde also sells adults' and children's slippers. She has been in this business since 2001. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more tins of tomato paste and seasonings.

loans.use: To buy more tinned tomato paste for sale

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mr. Leang L., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Nao Soeun, 41, live in a small village off National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both of whom study in the local school.

Mr. Leang has been a TV and radio repairman for sixteen years. He buys old and broken TVs and radios to repair for resell at his shop in front of his house. His wife has been a garment factory worker for eight years. Leang is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cows for raising and to buy more spare parts for his TV and radio repair stock.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for repairing TVs and radios and to purchase cows to raise

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa María empezó esta actividad para ayudar en la economía de su hogar ya que los gastos eran muchos y con los ingresos de su esposo no era suficiente. Aproximadamente hace 7 años comenzó la venta de calzado primero empezó ofreciéndolos con sus amistades quienes la fueron recomendando y gracias a esto logro incrementar sus clientes y así sus ganancias..

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder entregar los pedidos de calzado a tiempo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa María started this activity to help with household finances, since expenses were high and her husband's income was not sufficient. She started selling footwear about 7 years ago, beginning with her friends. Thanks to their recommendations she was able to increase her clientele and her earnings. She needs a loan of US $375, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy merchandise and be able to deliver the footwear orders to her clients in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Saveth

texts.en: Mrs. Saveth S. is a breeder who raises pigs and poultry in Sdouk Thom village in Kampong Cham Province. Her husband, Mr. Tim Toeung, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where they cultivate rice. To increase their rice harvest, Mrs. Saveth S. is asking for a loan to buy more land for growing rice. She is 36 years old and the mother of one young child. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more land

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Ngân năm nay  41 tuổi. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại xã Hưng Trung huyện Hưng Nguyên tỉnh Nghệ An. Hiện tại chị đang làm nghề may và kinh doanh quần áo. Bên cạnh đó chồng chị làm thầu xây dựng nên thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định. Với mức thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị Ngân đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 14.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh daonh quần áo của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi N. is 41 years old. She is currently living with her husband and three children in Hung Trung commune, Hung Nguyen district, Nghe An province. She is a tailor and she also sells clothes. Her husband is a construction contractor, and therefore her family has a stable source of income. With a monthly income of VND5,000,000, the economic situation of Mrs. N.'s family is increasingly stable and improved. In this loan cycle, she requests a loan of VND14,000,000 to expand her clothes trading business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand clothes trading business

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two children. Her family is an average Ukrainian family living in Ordzhonikidze. Olga sells clothing in the central market of her home town and also travels to neighboring villages to sell her inventory there. She has been in this trade for 11 years. 
Olga is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase additional merchandise for further sale. She would like to use additional financial assistance to grow her business even further. Olga loves what she is doing and is looking forward to the future. She is grateful for the opportunity this business has given to provide for and sustain her family of four. We believe Olga’s natural liveliness and optimism along with responsibility and serious business approach will help her make her dreams come true.

loans.use: To purchase assortment of inventory
